revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 13:35:54.000000000', 'message': 'CloudWatch API for Ceilometer

If ceilometer has cloudwatch compatible api, then there are many tools
developed for aws cloudwatch can be used by ceilometer, which makes
ceilometer more general.

For now, there are three interfaces are implemented:
   * PutMetricData
   * ListMetrics
   * GetMetricStatistics

zoho-task: https://projects.zoho.com/portal/unitedstackteam#todomilestones/575701000000032033
Change-Id: Ic00043317193f1e6b4859723c629d426e140bcc8
'}]
commit_message:
CloudWatch API for Ceilometer

If ceilometer has cloudwatch compatible api, then there are many tools
developed for aws cloudwatch can be used by ceilometer, which makes
ceilometer more general.

For now, there are three interfaces are implemented:
   * PutMetricData
   * ListMetrics
   * GetMetricStatistics

zoho-task: https://projects.zoho.com/portal/unitedstackteam#todomilestones/575701000000032033
Change-Id: Ic00043317193f1e6b4859723c629d426e140bcc8

commit_message:
Provide hint for what package contains qemu-img

While following install instructions in README.md it should be more
clear how to install qemu-img on your system.

Change-Id: Ibb8828806bf46716b91b83a4eea696f4fe478206

commit_message:
Functions documentation cleanup.

- Switched to definition lists for parameters to be consistent
  with generated resource docs
- Make consistent the layout of literal blocks and returns
- Other minor grammatical and layout fixes

Change-Id: I62eb179ce2a20024d2195cc7eb88e2e79bd4ae68

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-25 15:09:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix floating IP management from instance panel.

Quantum Floating IP API works with ports ids not instances ones
(opposite to what Nova Network does). So if we want to associate
(disassociate) an allocated floating IP to some instance we must
use the "target_id" (which is a port_id in case of Quantum and an
instance_id in case of Nova network).

Fixes bug 1158596.

Change-Id: Iceba4d8ee74bd58dc1cdbda7668841b0a7eb86f1
(cherry picked from commit de1940c922b0f5fc965a637a9dcf0734530cb85d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix floating IP management from instance panel.

Quantum Floating IP API works with ports ids not instances ones
(opposite to what Nova Network does). So if we want to associate
(disassociate) an allocated floating IP to some instance we must
use the "target_id" (which is a port_id in case of Quantum and an
instance_id in case of Nova network).

Fixes bug 1158596.

Change-Id: Iceba4d8ee74bd58dc1cdbda7668841b0a7eb86f1
(cherry picked from commit de1940c922b0f5fc965a637a9dcf0734530cb85d)

commit_message:
Add posargs to testr-full tox job

This commit adds posargs to to the testr-full tox job. This enables
passing extra arguments to testr when running the tox job.

commit_message:
Correct error messages

Correct error message from "Unable to add userto primary project." to
"Unable to add user to primary project.".

This patch only fix the error messages in the Python file. Because we
have many missing strings in the po files at the moment, we'd better to
update all the strings at once rather than piecemeal.

Fixes bug #1190932

Change-Id: Ib1be37313e70b3c397ca7e15cbfffb9ff523a9b3

commit_message:
Fix creation of trusted queues for the NVP plugin.

Currently if an admin tries to create a trusted queue, Neutron will
fail with MissingDSCPForTrusted exception. However, the NVP semantic
is exactly the opposite, namely the DSCP field must be specified for
untrusted queues and omitted trusted ones.

Fixes bug #1204256

Change-Id: I935fab45fc811a296411283a641b66c5ca96264d

commit_message:
Fix unit suffix and add no_suffix option.

In Cinder we've been using gibibytes, however
we have code in some places using Gigabytes, the brick
LVM code was one of those places.

This change sets the default suffix to gibibytes/mibibytes (1024 based)
and also provides an option to omit the suffix from the response now
that we can say that we're consistent in what is expected.

Change-Id: Id6274ba732bbdf484c5544e005155aebd68eaf2f

commit_message:
xenapi: Setup and Rotate text console logs

This patch installs the cronjob that rotates/sets up the text console
logs of the guests.

Related to blueprint xenapi-server-log

Change-Id: Ie4c778b54f69519fbb80aa0d9822383f55a1e2f9

subject: Fix db.utils.create_shadow_table() method
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 7543, 'name': 'Yongli He', 'email': 'yongli.he@intel.com', 'username': 'yongli.he'}]

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-27 01:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/34643/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/26636 : SUCCESS in 46m 59s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34643/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/26342 : SUCCESS in 45m 11s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34643/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/34302 : SUCCESS in 18m 12s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34643/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/13171 : FAILURE in 20m 33s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/34643/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/14939 : SUCCESS in 10m 36s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-06-27 07:51:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The code looks good, but this is yet another thing that will make writing data migrations even more cumbersome.

<rant>
I believe that we should completely split live and shadow migrations, and allow people to migrate only live tables. This needs to be done even more so since shadow tables are just a bunch of rows (not a consistent view of the world) and any migration needs to look at more than one table will have to do an exponential number of joins.
</rant>

I call this a rant because I am not really sure I have the free cycles to help with this so it's an empty complaint for now, but I believe a warranted one."}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-27 08:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nikola,

I think that there is some kind of misunderstanding.

First of all:
Shadow tables should be synced with the original table always.
And all actions (except work around FK, Unique Constraints and Index ) should be made on shadow tables as well. 

Second thing:
This function helps us to avoid "unreadable code"  and avoid copy paste t is very useful and cleans code a lot. 
(take a look at this migration https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34644/1/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/190_add_pci_devices.py) Here I don't create 2 times tables by hand with the same columns.

Third thing: 
Separated migrations will be really terrible and misleading for all new contributors. 

Forth thing:
If we don't have synced shadow tables, we are not able to move to it data from main table. So we have to make always migration to both tables (original and shadow)

Fifth thing: 
This utils are used also to check that shadow tables are up-to-date always. 
We made a tons of bugs for a really small period of time, just take a look at this BP: 
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/db-improve-archiving
Just take a look at this blueprint

 So I think the current solution is good enough. And I see only one way to improve it. To make this all job hidden, for example sqla monkey patching or  triggers in DB.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-06-27 08:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We might need to move this to the mailing list - but I am reluctant to do so for the reasons mentioned above (I don't have time to help). Just a few points:

This works well and is clean when you just create the shadow table. When you have to do some data migrations - you would need a check if it's a shadow table and if the column type is enum every time. Might be better to have a utility function that is not part of the if-elif that can be reused not only when tables are being created - for a usability win.

Point no 2 (brought up by lifeless on IRC recently) - migrating both might not be what deployers want to do. It is reasonable to imagine that a large cloud would want to migrate their live tables as quickly as possible to avoid downtime, and can "chew" shadow tables offline. Actually shadow tables if done right will be larger than live ones - an operator might choose to just archive them and not migrate them at all when upgrading.

Also consider my point when the migration needs to look at the data from more than one table. To migrate all tables in one go - it will require the migration to look at all the tables involved. This is not easy to solve but might not be what people running openstack in *real* environments want.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-27 08:31:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok I understand what you say but separating these migrations will break DB state and we won't be able to archiving. 

So if you run in real deployment openstack. 
You have to move all data from DB archive tables in some other DB schema. then make migrations, than make migrations for antoher DB schema and move all archived data back in background..

I think that administrators are able to make such simple task. 

And spliting migrations won't help us to provide faster migrations to newver version. 
Cause we have to stop our DB for archive migrations also. To avoid data corrupting."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-06-27 09:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I guess there is no point in having this discussion here. I might bring it up on the dev list.

The smaller point is that I think this will be needed for developers who will try to write migrations with columns of type Enum - so you might want to make that code more reusable.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-27 10:15:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Wait pls my email in openstack-dev about current progress around DB. We are doing real huge work around it. And I think that we shouldn't break this process by doing some minnor nits when we have really big problems."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-06-27 10:18:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sure - that's why I didn't -1 it but just started a discussion instead.

I do still feel that there are dark corners of shadow table functionality we should make better."}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2013-07-01 08:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-07-01 08:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

wtf?'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2013-07-01 08:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi, Boris
wrong opreaton? i use git review -D, and does not change your patch.

how can i fix this?'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2013-07-01 08:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi, Boris

my fault, i play with your patch and add something for -D review, but forgot delete your change ID. 


could you re-load your patch?  

Just ignore my Junk.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-01 09:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Fix db.utils.create_shadow_table() method

As we are not able to create 2 times Enum with the same name.
Our db.utils.create_shadow_table will fail if we have table with
column that has Enum type.

Fix db.utils.create_shadow_table()
now it replace the name of Enum (add shadow prefix to the name)

Add test to check that all works

fixes bug 1194106

Change-Id: I519b267383f329c15284358ed943ed9717267c10

commit_message:
Refactored MongoDB connection pool to use weakrefs

This allows connections to be closed when they are not used anymore

Change-Id: I54b0260f92376dd66dfda1ddb9405d6e0971f9d9

commit_message:
Adding arguments pre-check for glance-replicator

Based on current implement, glance-replicator will expose trace
if there is no arguments specified or the server:port format is bad.
This fix will add pre-check for those sub commands.

Fix bug 1202513

Change-Id: Ib8a90ce583cf938c9fdc0e8ad36af2ef8dfc976b

commit_message:
Relax OpenStack upper capping of client versions

- uncap keystoneclient and bump to >=0.3.0 to match requirements
- fix test case to handle change in keystoneclient where cached
values are stored as string now. Previous test passed in tuple and
new auth_token would fail when it tried to json.loads the
tuple. (see _cache_get() in keystone auth_token)

Change-Id: I568d8e0ae6586b91d5e38cb8750731f3fe6e22e7
Fixes:Bug#1200214

commit_message:
Add metavar for --fixed-ip

This patch adds a metavar for the --fixed-ip option so that it's
more clear that the user needs to pass in ip_address=IP_ADDR.

Fixes bug 1188889

Change-Id: I66efd444a2df52603f124637072f194497e241e2

the older version of python-heatclient and python-ceiloclient
actually required an incompatible version of python-keystone client
to the global requirements list. When running devstack without
heat or ceilo enabled (thus no local git trees), horizon becomes

Change-Id: I8480db4a5c3d08a7d739f495920e4b5a442cbb91
'}]
commit_message:
update global requires on clients for keystone fix

the older version of python-heatclient and python-ceiloclient
actually required an incompatible version of python-keystone client
to the global requirements list. When running devstack without
heat or ceilo enabled (thus no local git trees), horizon becomes
satisified even when you have and old heatclient, which prevents
horizon from installing.

Change-Id: I8480db4a5c3d08a7d739f495920e4b5a442cbb91

runs on PyPy.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 05:04:12.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore emacs autosave files in source-repositories

source-repositories uses find to discover things it should import. If
someone happens to use emacs, and happens to have had an autosave file
in a directory with a wildly broken version of a source-repositories-
file, then dib will attempt to execute the contents of the autosave file
and the user will be sad. Adding a filter to the find command for files
ending in ~ will prevent pain and suffering.

Change-Id: I27c8a4b53d3c9b913ca926db16b4271941f6fb5d
'}, {'created': '2013-07-29 05:04:12.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore emacs autosave files in source-repositories

source-repositories uses find to discover things it should import. If
someone happens to use emacs, and happens to have had an autosave file
in a directory with a wildly broken version of a source-repositories-
file, then dib will attempt to execute the contents of the autosave file
and the user will be sad. Adding a filter to the find command for files
ending in ~ will prevent pain and suffering.

Change-Id: I27c8a4b53d3c9b913ca926db16b4271941f6fb5d
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore emacs autosave files in source-repositories

source-repositories uses find to discover things it should import. If
someone happens to use emacs, and happens to have had an autosave file
in a directory with a wildly broken version of a source-repositories-
file, then dib will attempt to execute the contents of the autosave file
and the user will be sad. Adding a filter to the find command for files
ending in ~ will prevent pain and suffering.

Change-Id: I27c8a4b53d3c9b913ca926db16b4271941f6fb5d

commit_message:
skip stamp test until race in nova can be debugged

This test is causing a lot of gate resets, and as far as I can
tell they are really nova races in volume attachments. However
we should skip the test for now until these can be sorted out.

Related to bug #1205344

Change-Id: I983779841ac3d3f79442e96b37a0cc8da85ae55b

Nachi, would this cause the tests to fail again once you merge the patch that removes the fixed interval looping call?

If yes, we should probably not merge this.

Putting an ugly -2 so I have a chance to have an answer before this patch is merged.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-26 22:06:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

yeah, removing looping call will fix the issue as well. I don't insist merging."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-26 22:08:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So, by saying 'it will fix', I mean that test should not fail if there's no looping call. But if looping call is removed, mocking should also be removed, obviously.

I'm more interested if the very same race condition is the cause of devstack gate failures."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-26 22:14:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: No score

Actually it doesn't matter whether this is merged or not.
Nachi will have to remove the mock if it goes in.

I'm not sure I follow you about the relationship between this patch and the gate failures."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-27 18:28:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Initially I though that the same race condition might result in the issues that occur during gate run but now I see it's unrelated."}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2013-07-29 02:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Fix l3_agent unit tests

Mock FixedIntervalLoopingCall in unit tests so
_rpc_loop doesn't interfere with the tests

fixes bug 1205085

Change-Id: I54cc152890734afc7a5b86dd9ae4ea133bd7574b

Removed the dep on cinder.utils

This patch ensures that we don't have any
dependency on cinder's utils.py.

bug 1205100

commit_message:
Revert "Add jsonschema to requirements.txt"

This reverts commit d35a64499673c2d765dd342fa21dabdbfa4ba276.

Which is possibly the cause of grenade failing the gate, we'll
bring this back later if it isn't.

Print before exiting

Remove "break" as it is unreachable. Move the logging statement
to before we exit as well.

Change-Id: I8a5c3e8fd2cf0532e15cc7eb9920a2ca7428b28f

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-16 17:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(6 inline comments)

This looks to be happening in the wrong place to me. Every time we operate on a Stack, we have to go grab part of it's definition from an external URL and hope that it hasn't changed. That's not robust

We should be fetching the template once and storing it in the environment. This could be done either in the client, in the API, or in the engine as soon as the stack create/update request comes in. In previous posts to the mailing list the approach I suggested was to do it in the client, and use a 'function' like {"Url": "http://example.com/provider.yaml"} to (a) make it easily identifiable to the client, and (b) distinguish it from other values for the resource type (without trying to turn it into a URL and just checking for exceptions).'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-07-16 17:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Zane Bitter: agreed. commit_message:
Allow template resource use outside of Environment

In addition to using TemplateResource as a means to override another Resource
implementation, this allows template authors to specify a template url
as the Type of resource directly. This allows a user to define new Resource
implementations in addition to overriding existing ones via Environments.

implements blueprint provider-resource

Change-Id: I11cf94dc062fcce0e4ff08765696447fc2411a7f

commit_message:
Add a Ceilometer alarm resource

Note: this gets the signed url from the resources capable of getting
signals by calling Fn::GetAtt('AlarmUrl')

blueprint watch-ceilometer
Change-Id: If8822f7c9bfc2113b6ee57e1faff2ab4f8ff3b16

commit_message:
Fix a race where a soft deleted instance might be removed by mistake

When a soft deleted instance is restored there is a tiny risk that it
might be deleted if the reclaim periodic task runs at the same time.
This happens because the restore operation sets deleted_at to None
which makes the reclaim job think it is ok to delete the instance.

This can be resolved by restricting reclaims to only those instances
whose task_state is None.

Resolves bug 1186243.

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
	nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py

Change-Id: Ia138e2d504b7482c46900583f019a32c70513245
(cherry picked from commit cdf10381caad217ae9eb99c69a4226e40ba81db4)

commit_message:
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: Id52268cc077bcc89e345a1cd28203ce2fce75db7

commit_message:
Add needed symlink for Fedora deployment ramdisk.

Symlink /usr/lib -> ../lib for Fedora deployment ramdisk.  This
symlink is needed for systemd-udevd.  Otherwise, the network device is
not loaded and initialized when the deployment image is booted.  This
logic was previously contained in
elements/deploy/root.d/50-redhat-prepare-fs, but now that ramdisk
images are built in a chroot, the change needs to be moved so that it
is applied to the ramdisk build.

Change-Id: Icea43230126956ccf5fb8a6a96ca706b75d5c32f

The project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index in the 203 migration
for the project_user_quotas table was using the wrong column, it should
be using user_id instead of project_id since there is already an index
for the project_id column (defined directly above it).

Fixes bug 1205693

Change-Id: I52bf57086325405d56e10b3eef59287f315416b8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index

The project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index in the 203 migration
for the project_user_quotas table was using the wrong column, it should
be using user_id instead of project_id since there is already an index
for the project_id column (defined directly above it).

Fixes bug 1205693

Change-Id: I52bf57086325405d56e10b3eef59287f315416b8

commit_message:
PCI passthrough Conductor layer

Add 3 methods in conductor:

pci_device_create() and pci_device_destroy_all_on_host()
  Are used to sync available device on host. (sync with nova.conf)
  So as these methods are runed from compute nodes we have to work
  through nova conductor

pci_device_attach_to_instance_by_labels()
  Is used to attach to instance pci_deivces by labels and is called
  from compute.manager so we have to work through conductor also

blueprint pci-passthrough-base

Change-Id: Ic0cf0e1a9c1b6728d6911fc0e132ae6545f352c8

commit_message:
Set lock_path in tests

When lock_path is not set, the synchronized decorator doesn't work
properly.  This change is required so that synchronized can throw
an exception when that happens instead of failing silently.

Change-Id: I341a522e59fda3feb8e41379d06ad3c8f97e5597

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-16 20:15:41.000000000', 'message': "Catch additional connect fail cases.

When fixing bug/1195910, some other failure
cases weren't considered (ie not authorized,
unreachable dest etc).

We should fix this up to handle the various
connection error states accordingly and also
add some hints to the log output to help
determine where to look in case of failure.

Fixes bug: 1201592

Change-Id: Ib099c7af705e7c49be4d0f723c8a20262c942e7f
(cherry picked from commit 5edbc4eb9a6b0d50612fffb6261850c80515b483)
"}]
commit_message:
Catch additional connect fail cases.

When fixing bug/1195910, some other failure
cases weren't considered (ie not authorized,
unreachable dest etc).

We should fix this up to handle the various
connection error states accordingly and also
add some hints to the log output to help
determine where to look in case of failure.

Fixes bug: 1201592

Change-Id: Ib099c7af705e7c49be4d0f723c8a20262c942e7f
(cherry picked from commit 5edbc4eb9a6b0d50612fffb6261850c80515b483)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 02:54:12.000000000', 'message': "Remove junk file when ftp transfer failure

During spawn with powervm driver, the image transfer to the IVM host
may fail in some conditions, eg. IVM host doesn't have enough disk
space. It leaves the junk file in IVM host, and this will disturb
next spawn after resolving environment issue, need clean it.

Fixes bug #1188884

Change-Id: I6347dec4cfda61bed0960159e8a3402fcffa296b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove junk file when ftp transfer failure

During spawn with powervm driver, the image transfer to the IVM host
may fail in some conditions, eg. IVM host doesn't have enough disk
space. It leaves the junk file in IVM host, and this will disturb
next spawn after resolving environment issue, need clean it.

Fixes bug #1188884

Change-Id: I6347dec4cfda61bed0960159e8a3402fcffa296b

messages:
[{'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-18 06:22:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I might be interpreting this completely wrong, however i don't think we should be inheriting V2 from the V3 client. A v3_client.tokens doesn't make sense and i don't think that that is an intentional upgrade path. 

Assuming i'm right, in general please stop inheriting objects just because they do something similar.

I'm not sure about the process_token method being on the base client but it was the only thing V3 relied upon from V2 that let all the tests pass."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-18 07:14:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Client V3 shouldn't inherit V2

Client V3 is a completely different implementation of the API, if we
want to intermix the V2 and V3 APIs then we don't need to version our
client at all.

Change-Id: I80579cd41df73ccfc6c8feb76843772829afac4e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 14:02:51.000000000', 'message': 'Bypass queries which cause a contradiction

This addresses the cause of the log lines like:

SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "instance_system_metadata.instance_uuid"
was invoked with an empty sequence. This results in a contradiction,
which nonetheless can be expensive to evaluate. Consider alternative
strategies for improved performance.

for instance_metadata, instance_system_metadata, and instance_faults.

It especially helps the case of a call to /servers/detail when there are
no servers to list because each of those tables is scanned despite a
guarantee that there will be now rows.

Bug 1204916

Change-Id: I62e65c4409d3e3ab8373eb66450414565c222547
'}]
commit_message:
Bypass queries which cause a contradiction

This addresses the cause of the log lines like:

SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "instance_system_metadata.instance_uuid"
was invoked with an empty sequence. This results in a contradiction,
which nonetheless can be expensive to evaluate. Consider alternative
strategies for improved performance.

for instance_metadata, instance_system_metadata, and instance_faults.

It especially helps the case of a call to /servers/detail when there are
no servers to list because each of those tables is scanned despite a
guarantee that there will be now rows.

Bug 1204916

Change-Id: I62e65c4409d3e3ab8373eb66450414565c222547

commit_message:
Adds help messages to mongodb_store_db and mongodb_store_uri

Help messages are based on the webpages below:

http://api.mongodb.org/python/current/api/pymongo/mongo_client.html#pymongo.mongo_client.MongoClient
http://api.mongodb.org/python/current/api/gridfs/

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id95459b3eb2b50703e5793e3bf02c9ea1b142236

[{'created': '2013-07-27 17:19:44.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Pin Babel to <1.0 since it doesn't play well with pip 1.4"

commit_message:
Revert "Pin Babel to <1.0 since it doesn't play well with pip 1.4"

Fixes bug 1205546.

This reverts commit adf074baa9d6876921b7dbbadae07006a7de6b5d.

Upstream Babel has worked around the pytz versioning issues by
releasing 1.1.

Change-Id: I2298c80ca0291ea6d0797194897ecc79ec50b818

commit_message:
Pin Babel to <1.0 since it fails with pip 1.4

Fixes bug 1205546.

* requirements.txt: The latest Babel, 1.0, adds an unversioned
dependency on pytz. Further, pytz uses date-based versioning which
is not supported by default in the newest pip, 1.4. Adding a
temporary cap on Babel works around this issue.

Change-Id: I9a0613b743b67cd9d4111e14ec4056e61a8e4a29

Fixes bug 1205546.

* requirements.txt: The latest Babel, 1.0, adds an unversioned
dependency on pytz. Further, pytz uses date-based versioning which
is not supported by default in the newest pip, 1.4. Adding a
temporary cap on Babel works around this issue.

Change-Id: I65dcd70c5181b82c7a36e122ce0b4bdbd2eeedd2

commit_message:
Add downloadonly flag to fedora

devstack-gate needs to be able to make an image that has pre-downloaded
but not installed a sequence of packages. To support that, add a -d flag
to install-packages to allow downloading but not installing. -d passes
through on a dpkg install, and with this patch should be transformed
to --downloadonly which is the yum version.

Change-Id: Ia4e61fa4304df86afbee7dfc8067ea1bdf528f3e

commit_message:
Fixed up test-requirements

As a first step to OpenStack alignment, get test-requirements.txt in
line with current OpenStack standard practices.

Fixes: Bug #1205546
Change-Id: I899c3dc167df191b84008250671c58520c436a30

commit_message:
Add jsonschema to requirements.txt

This commit adds jsonschema to the requirements list. It is used in
the glance api v2 testing, however was previously not included on the
requirements list. This commit corrects the oversight.

Change-Id: I6615d07734f693de665b7d89fc20a38a4a1a9e63

Small nit, otherwise looks good!  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-25 01:09:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We have a CONF.snapshot_same_host configuration doing exactly what you want (force volume creating from snapshot to be served on the same host as snapshot).  Of course it simply ignore the AZ option of new volume, which is a bug."}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-07-25 07:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-07-25 07:56:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Huang, CONF.snapshot_same_host does not solve the issue that I have. The issue here is around the availability_zone field.

Even with this configuration option set a new volume could end up with a host in a different availability zone then the volume, and this is what I am trying to avoid. The AZ is set for the new volume gets set well before we get to the part that uses snapshot_same_host.'}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-07-25 07:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-25 08:01:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

When creating a volume from a snapshot we need to pick the
availability zone of the snapshot's source volume. This patch
goes further and enforces that the new volume must be in the same
AZ as the snapshot. It raises an user error if the user tries
to create a volume in a different AZ to the snapshot.

This is enforced across all drivers because creating a volume from
a snapshot is implemented in the drivers and not all drivers are
guaranteed to support creating a volume from snapshot is a foreign
AZ. More to point if you don't support create a volume like this,
and we allow this then you can create volumes and instances that

commit_message:
Create volume from snapshot must be in the same AZ as snapshot

This issue and patch also apply to cloning volumes.

When creating a volume from a snapshot we need to pick the
availability zone of the snapshot's source volume. This patch
goes further and enforces that the new volume must be in the same
AZ as the snapshot. It raises an user error if the user tries
to create a volume in a different AZ to the snapshot.

This is enforced across all drivers because creating a volume from
a snapshot is implemented in the drivers and not all drivers are
guaranteed to support creating a volume from snapshot is a foreign
AZ. More to point if you don't support create a volume like this,
and we allow this then you can create volumes and instances that
get stuck in some weird states that require a support call to fix.

If you do support cross AZ functionality then you can override
the enforcement of that cloned volumes most be in the same AZ
as their source via the 'cloned_volume_same_az' option.

Change-Id: Iafc8f35ecc6a6b51dbe6df8bf44eaa3e79c3bd01
Fixes: bug #1202648

messages:
[{'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-02-20 20:28:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Right now I can picture two ways of implementing datepickers in Horizon. One is using JQuery UI as I did, but I know it adds a lot of extra code. The other is using Django admin datepicker, but it needs a lot of hacks to make it look properly.

In this implementation user input is controlled by JQuery UI and helps to avoid past issues like retrieving data from the future.

If JavaScript is disabled, the user will be able to input dates by hand and in this case some control has to be done. Right now it only supports default input formats, and it doesn't notify the user if the input is wrong in some way.

Something that is not working as expected is the fact that time is in UTC timezone. Right now I'm in -3, so when I log in at night I can see that fields are initializated with one day more. Minor issue though.

Feedback is more than appreciated."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-20 21:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-26 20:10:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Sooooo, I hate to do this to you, but I (and a few of the other Horizon core devs) have a pretty strong distaste for jQuery UI. It's overweight, a total mess to style, and by and large stagnant in development at this point. We decided to go with bootstrap's javascript and bring in one-off solutions to individual problems quite some time ago.

The Django admin datepicker is significantly painful to use outside the admin, so I don't recommend going that route.

That said, there are lots of other JS datepicker plugins that would work fine. I've tried various ones, but don't know what the current best-of-breed is.

I'm not too worried about timezone issues for a first pass. The current implementation is subject to that to some degree as well. It's just less noticeable when you're talking a month's worth of data."}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-02-26 20:29:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

No problemo, I saw that coming! I agree that it's too much code for such a small feature and  don't like making things that way either. 

I considered using Django admin datepicker, but as you mention it needs a lot of hacking to get it looks right. So... I took the highway.

Well, I'll reimplement it with other JS datepicker :)

Thanks for reviewing it!"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-06 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 inline comment)

Thanks for the patch.

I tried typing a invalid date format on the start date (e.g. 10-20-2010) and click submit, I got a keyError. We need to add validation for the date format. Might be also good to display in the page the date format supported.

Is it possible to make the date format configurable? Depending regions of the world have different requirements for the date format.

If it is easy, can you make the field shorter? Seems like the field is too long for its valid input data."}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-07-05 18:51:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for your review lin-hua-cheng!

- I added an extra control for the DateField and the suitable error message for it.

- I also added the information about the date format supported currently.

- About making the date format configurable, it is possible but makes the code complex, non flexible and prone to errors.
This is because the bootstraper datepicker date format syntax is different from the Django's one, so it requires adding a dictionary to control this. And still, it may not fulfill the user needs.
I coded it, so we could discuss further about this in a new bug report.

- Sure! I made it of the supported date format length.

Btw, do you think that the error notification messages are ok? I tend to be too technical and from the user point of view it can be confusing.

Thanks again!"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-07-05 19:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-07-05 19:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-05 20:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

Victoria:

I am still getting a 500 error whenever I use Start="20" and End="<some valid date>" as the input.

I am getting a KeyError on the openstack_dashboard/usage/base.py - csv_link. Are you getting the same error?

I think the problem is the form is not being validated, it is only used as data container. 

If I made a call to form.is_valid(), I am getting a value of False and can see the validation error from forms.errors.  I think we need to add a form validation call in the BaseUsage class.

Another way I could think of is to not allow the user to type and just simply force them to use the date-picker. We used to have a dropdown before, so we didn't have problem with validating user input. :('}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-07-06 12:37:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Oh well spotted Lin! I see what the problem is. The validation requires an extra control: when it validates the input start='20' end=<well-formed-date> the cleaned data only has the end attribute. So, when trying to create the CSV link, it raises a KeyError (there is no 'start'!). I'm on it now, I missed that case.

I thought about restricting the input through the datepicker only, but the problem with this approach is the fallback mode: if the user has JavaScript disabled this controls are needed.

Another option would be using year-month-day dropdown menus, but they can have a negative impact on the usability.

Thanks you for your review again :)"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-07-06 12:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 13:40:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Doesn't seem to work

I wonder does it make sense to set the date format to be configurable in the settings?"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-07-12 16:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for your review Tihomir!

It's a good idea to stick to standards, thanks for pointing out that. I added a extra function that checks the current day and selects the desired range. I consider "first days" of the month to be on a range of 5 days. It can be changed though.

Regarding the configurable date format, as I mentioned in a previous review, it's possible but we would have to restrict the options to make sure we can handle correctly the mapping between Django and Boostrap date formats.

Let me know your opinions, thanks a lot.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2013-07-12 16:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 17:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Works for me

commit_message:
Query a period of time for usage summary

Allows the user to pick a range of time
to query services usage data.

Fallback mode: the user will have to input
dates by hand if JavaScript is disabled.

Change-Id: I4cf4d4fd56fd450743b9d624dc066d6ed74df881
Fixes: bug #1102448

commit_message:
Checks if volume can be attached

This patches makes a boot fail fast if one of the volumes cannot
be attached at boot time. Currently the request is accepted but
spawning fails in addition to leaving the volume state as
available which is an inconsistent state

fixes: bug 1166770
(cherry picked from commit 8e4eec840d504d27a3a4c640dba67b3b47e81730)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py

Change-Id: I35b2034f8aa9574fcb8a34b58ead9f5e9ef27664

[{'created': '2013-07-25 06:29:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix filtering aggregate metadata by key

Filtering by metadata key has no effect in the following two functions:

    aggregate_metadata_get_by_host
    aggregate_host_get_by_metadata_key

Rely on the explicit join instead of joinedload to load the _metadata
relationship in these functions (indicated by the contains_eager
option), so that filtering by key still applies when the metadata is
collected.

Fixes bug 1201283.

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py

Change-Id: I3e44b5db8d67787bfa14f0e57d30a02a271a8833
(cherry picked from commit 7e8fa8f3e6acac0e510cd1fc5af591f9a321d03a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix filtering aggregate metadata by key

Filtering by metadata key has no effect in the following two functions:

    aggregate_metadata_get_by_host
    aggregate_host_get_by_metadata_key

Rely on the explicit join instead of joinedload to load the _metadata
relationship in these functions (indicated by the contains_eager
option), so that filtering by key still applies when the metadata is
collected.

Fixes bug 1201283.

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py

Change-Id: I3e44b5db8d67787bfa14f0e57d30a02a271a8833
(cherry picked from commit 7e8fa8f3e6acac0e510cd1fc5af591f9a321d03a)

[{'created': '2013-07-16 16:57:43.000000000', 'message': "Live mig don't pass image to filter if there is no

If live migration for a volume backed instance without an image supplied
is initiated with no destination supplied, glance client show will not
be called and the image variable will be set to None.

However if passed to filters like that as part of the request_spec
dictionary, None value will cause one of the default filters - the
ImagePropertiesFilter to throw an exception in it's host_passes method,
as it expects an image to be a dictionary.

We solve this by leaving out the image entirely before engaging filters,
and not attempting to get it if it was not supplied to the instance.

This bug was previously fixed (however not fully, as the None image
would still cause an exception) in the following patch:
Ie683a3ca5d6430c52ead77b41f98fbcb4114ea1e, but  was accidentally dropped
in I6de33ada6dc377e20f8df07da92244f2c150b9fe.

Fixes bug 1170596 (again)
Fixes bug 1199811

Change-Id: I0239b6ac5640d075f937f9690eca4ce54f534117

commit_message:
Don't pass empty image to filter on live migration

If live migration for a volume backed instance without an image supplied
is initiated with no destination supplied, glance client show will not
be called and the image variable will be set to None.

However if passed to filters like that as part of the request_spec
dictionary, None value will cause one of the default filters - the
ImagePropertiesFilter to throw an exception in it's host_passes method,
as it expects an image to be a dictionary.

We solve this by leaving out the image entirely before engaging filters,
and not attempting to get it if it was not supplied to the instance.

This bug was previously fixed (however not fully, as the None image
would still cause an exception) in the following patch:
Ie683a3ca5d6430c52ead77b41f98fbcb4114ea1e, but  was accidentally dropped
in I6de33ada6dc377e20f8df07da92244f2c150b9fe.

Fixes bug 1170596 (again)
Fixes bug 1199811

Change-Id: I0239b6ac5640d075f937f9690eca4ce54f534117

commit_message:
Add latest oslo DB support

The common oslo code is backward compatible.

The database configuration variables are now in a new section
[database].

DocImpact

Change-Id: I978493f692179ecf09ea9ed98d521b3e65394880

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-11 14:10:42.000000000', 'message': "Add basic BDM format validation in the API layer

Adds the basic sanity checking for the new BDM data format when it's
passed in to the servers create method.

More comprehensive validation that will take a look at the request as a
whiole, and take into consideration all the metadata, will be done in
the compute API create method in the susequent patches.

Change-Id: Ie4c2c9a219be91faa07106f820a728ca9ac42e1b
"}, {'created': '2013-06-11 14:29:29.000000000', 'message': "Add basic BDM format validation in the API layer

passed in to the servers create method.

whole, and take into consideration all the metadata, will be done in

"}, {'created': '2013-06-18 10:00:35.000000000', 'message': "Add basic BDM format validation in the API layer

Adds the basic sanity checking for the new BDM data format when it's
passed in to the servers create method. Also make block_device routines
that raise IvalidBDMFormat error add a brief explanation to it that can
be reused to send more informative validation errors to the user.

More comprehensive validation that will take a look at the request as a
whole, and take into consideration all the metadata, will be done in
the compute API create method in the subsequent patches.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling
Change-Id: Ie4c2c9a219be91faa07106f820a728ca9ac42e1b

commit_message:
Add basic BDM format validation in the API layer

Adds the basic sanity checking for the new BDM data format when it's
passed in to the servers create method. Also make block_device routines
that raise IvalidBDMFormat error add a brief explanation to it that can
be reused to send more informative validation errors to the user.

More comprehensive validation that will take a look at the request as a
whole, and take into consideration all the metadata, will be done in
the compute API create method in the subsequent patches.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling
Change-Id: Ie4c2c9a219be91faa07106f820a728ca9ac42e1b

commit_message:
xenapi: Fix console rotate script

First time run of the console rotate script failed, due to the fact that
the logs did not exist at that time.

Fixes bug 1204440

Change-Id: I49b5569c1ba3349d911caace42685fa0f19a1f66

commit_message:
Enable force_delete and restore instance via novaclient.

Bug 1195670

Nova supports force_delete or restore instance in the API level,
thus it makes sense to support this feature in novaclient.

Change-Id: I7cc3d2d2a7ab8dfe043176a3ea97c10deae683c9

[{'created': '2013-07-10 22:44:32.000000000', 'message': "Avoid redefining host to none in get_instance_nw_info(...)

The host parameter is required and a part of the method signature.
When it is redefined from kwargs.get('host') the supplied value
gets redefined to None. This removes the redefinition and keeps the
parameter value intact.

Fixes bug #1194178

Change-Id: I779cbce909935a4b794c16cefb0128f16f8563fb
(cherry picked from commit b0a2a2d29f24cea15d866f352d4beae5da965605)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid redefining host to none in get_instance_nw_info(...)

The host parameter is required and a part of the method signature.
When it is redefined from kwargs.get('host') the supplied value
gets redefined to None. This removes the redefinition and keeps the
parameter value intact.

Fixes bug #1194178

Change-Id: I779cbce909935a4b794c16cefb0128f16f8563fb
(cherry picked from commit b0a2a2d29f24cea15d866f352d4beae5da965605)

assert only raise AssertionError when runing python without '-O', so if
we except an Assertionerror in codes, just raise it instead of using
assert syntax instead of different result with or without '-O' flag

Change-Id: I8c1bc2c6849996f0d3f7a4b791671871d79dd939
"}, {'created': '2013-07-17 14:35:59.000000000', 'message': "rm improper assert syntax

assert only raise AssertionError when runing python without '-O', so if
we except an Assertionerror in codes, just raise it instead of using
assert syntax instead of different result with or without '-O' flag

Change-Id: I8c1bc2c6849996f0d3f7a4b791671871d79dd939
"}]
commit_message:
rm improper assert syntax

assert only raise AssertionError when runing python without '-O', so if
we except an Assertionerror in codes, just raise it instead of using
assert syntax instead of different result with or without '-O' flag

Change-Id: I8c1bc2c6849996f0d3f7a4b791671871d79dd939

[{'created': '2013-07-23 16:57:15.000000000', 'message': 'Loop over test output for better readability

The way _run_cmd was working meant that in a test failures, the captured
output was a giant blob of text with \n strings inside it, making it
unreadable. By looping and printing, it becomes readable again.

Change-Id: I2db3057c34e2a50f7a420f2dbcf45c6ec874b632
'}]
commit_message:
Loop over test output for better readability

The way _run_cmd was working meant that in a test failures, the captured
output was a giant blob of text with \n strings inside it, making it
unreadable. By looping and printing, it becomes readable again.

Change-Id: I2db3057c34e2a50f7a420f2dbcf45c6ec874b632

commit_message:
Add support for globbing in data files

Similar to the work in the packages argument, allow the specification
of a directory to recursively include as part of the install.

Change-Id: Ife0414af468e7fcd4fc419eafc3e19e29efcfc7b

"}, {'created': '2013-07-23 17:36:44.000000000', 'message': "Revert include_package_data change

"}, {'created': '2013-07-23 23:18:00.000000000', 'message': "Revert include_package_data change

Setting the value directly in kwargs is not doing what we want it to do.
This is largely because of how the hook system works. When the hooks
process backwards_compat, they do a config.get('backwards_compat',
dict()), which is then written back to the config dict - which means
that blank override values are being fed in.

Later we can go through and just re-engineer how that works. For now,
unbreak nova.

Change-Id: I0c6055253cbc89b6884553e6f2fbfe8a7bbd1953
"}]
commit_message:
Revert include_package_data change

Setting the value directly in kwargs is not doing what we want it to do.
This is largely because of how the hook system works. When the hooks
process backwards_compat, they do a config.get('backwards_compat',
dict()), which is then written back to the config dict - which means
that blank override values are being fed in.

Later we can go through and just re-engineer how that works. For now,
unbreak nova.

Change-Id: I0c6055253cbc89b6884553e6f2fbfe8a7bbd1953

subject: Remove the monkey patching of _ into the builtins

commit_message:
Remove the monkey patching of _ into the builtins

Previous _ was monkey patched into builtins whenever
certain modules were imported. This removes that and
simply imports it when it is needed.

Change-Id: I0af2c6d8a230e94440d655d13cab9107ac20d13c

Manually tested and working great!

With patch:
$ time sudo nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf ls
/usr/local/bin/nova-rootwrap: Unauthorized command: ls (no filter matched)

real    0m0.062s
user    0m0.028s
sys     0m0.028s

Without:
$ time sudo nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf ls
/usr/local/bin/nova-rootwrap: Unauthorized command: ls (no filter matched)

real 0m0.254s
user 0m0.180s
sys 0m0.068s

So a 4x speedup in this case.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-07-26 05:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2013-07-23 22:59:38.000000000', 'message': 'Also patch easy_install script creation

During python setup.py develop, easy_install is called via a different
code path to install the scripts. We need to inject into that place as
well.

Change-Id: Iab319f3771529c6d57f6a36ec717fb3278839f78
'}]
commit_message:
Also patch easy_install script creation

During python setup.py develop, easy_install is called via a different
code path to install the scripts. We need to inject into that place as
well.

Change-Id: Iab319f3771529c6d57f6a36ec717fb3278839f78

commit_message:
Sync lockutils and log from oslo

This commit pulls in the lockutils and log module from oslo, and all
the dependency modules into tempest.

Change-Id: I5376f977a110f502f0e4958cbccbd379539e006b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-11 14:10:41.000000000', 'message': 'Servers API for the new BDM format

This patch makes the nova API aware and able to accept the new block
device mapping format introduced in
If30afdb59d4c4268b97d3d10270df2cc729a0c4c when booting an instance.

The compute API create method will still convert these back to the
legacy format for the time being until the compute API will now how to
take advantage of the new format.

commit_message:
Servers API for the new BDM format

This patch makes the nova API aware and able to accept the new block
device mapping format introduced in
If30afdb59d4c4268b97d3d10270df2cc729a0c4c when booting an instance.

It does so by introducing a new extension into the v2 API. There is no
v3 extension as part of this patch because volume extension is going
away in v3 and thus this functionality can be part of the core servers
extension. This will be done in a subsequent patch.

The compute API create method will still convert these back to the
legacy format for the time being until the compute API will know how to
take advantage of the new format.

As this change adds the new API extension, marking it as DocImpact so
that the changes and the API data format can be documented.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling
Change-Id: I2c1b63e41deca26f727fb9ed912a55494db9c76c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 08:12:32.000000000', 'message': "Adds the ability to send request using a separate auth token.

Specifying X-Auth-Token in a request header won't be overwritten
by the RestClient anymore. This allows methods like
create_account_metadata to to modify a user's account using admin
privileges.

Change-Id: I484b7d33b1cd809dcc2dea079d1c5259e587d0ae
Fixes: bug #1202746
"}, {'created': '2013-07-19 13:43:29.000000000', 'message': 'Modify metadata of a Swift account using another account.

This is useful for instance if you want the admin to set
restrictive metadata (like Quotas Bytes) on a regular account.

The RestClient has to be moidified to accept the use of
a custom auth token in its requests.
Change-Id: I484b7d33b1cd809dcc2dea079d1c5259e587d0ae
Fixes: bug #1202746
'}]
commit_message:
Modify metadata of a Swift account using another account.

This is useful for instance if you want the admin to set
restrictive metadata (like Quotas Bytes) on a regular account.

The RestClient has to be moidified to accept the use of
a custom auth token in its requests.
Change-Id: I484b7d33b1cd809dcc2dea079d1c5259e587d0ae
Fixes: bug #1202746

Using lockmode is standard throughout most of the Neutron code, why are we removing it here?"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-12 12:06:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

the lockmode is there to avoid concurrent modifications on ip availablity ranges and assignation of ips.

The rationale of this patch should be explained in detail."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-12 14:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

sorry I just find the bug report.

It's bug 1198799

This is for avoding failures on postgresql - which however fails with an error which is apparently unrelated to with_lockmode.

Before on agreeing on removing the lock, we need to understand what's the relationship between the proposed fix and the observed failure."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-19 15:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Hi,
Thanks for addressing the comments that I had.
The code looks good but there are a number of minor issues that I would like you to address:
1. the log text that you have added is missing spaces between lines
2. there are a number of cases where you have changed whitespaces. This makes the review process a little more difficult. Personally I would prefer that you return this to the original code. It will certainly speed up the review process and there may also be reviewers who may want the original indentation.
3. The function get_filtered_hosts was change considerably. Are there tests cases for all of the flows?
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-05 10:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Works for me

commit_message:
Separate HostManager and Provider code.

This patchset aims to separate logic responsible for host state acquisition
and capabilities monitoring from host management routines. Also it adresses
code refactoring issue.

Change-Id: I674f4dfbe7735dd1f48d0a2b3e16eda0416ed7bf
Implements: blueprint host-manager-overhaul

subject: Allow to pass options to coverage.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-11 12:29:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36644/1/check/gate-python-swiftclient-pep8/376 : SUCCESS in 40s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/36644/1/check/gate-python-swiftclient-docs/326/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 48s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36644/1/check/gate-python-swiftclient-python26/374 : SUCCESS in 1m 03s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36644/1/check/gate-python-swiftclient-python27/374 : SUCCESS in 47s
'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-07-12 21:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Out of curiosity, what are you passing into coverage instead of "report"?'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-15 12:32:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

the option html to general the html output is the one I am using the most to see what part of the code wasn't tested."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-07-15 14:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'd vote for turning on HTML output, line, and branch coverage for everyone, and adding any resulting files/directories to .gitignore.

In the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34681/ patch, I make the coverage run in ./.unittests generate the report of *which* lines weren't covered.  I also seem to get a "coverage" directory which has HTML in it, showing which lines don't have line or branch coverage... I think without having to pass any additional args to coverage other than "-m"?'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-15 14:49:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I would +2 something like this as well (make as default html) but -m doesn't output an html directory for me am I missing something (using 3.6) ?"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-07-15 15:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Interesting... I deleted the "cover" directory and re-ran ./.unittests and it came back.  NOTE: this was on my threading-refactor branch which has the "-m" arg.  Here's my setup:

  (ssdev) [python-swiftclient] (threading-refactoring)$ coverage --version
  Coverage.py, version 3.6.  http://nedbatchelder.com/code/coverage
  (ssdev) [python-swiftclient] (threading-refactoring)$ pip freeze | grep cover
  coverage==3.6
  discover==0.4.0
  nosexcover==1.0.7
  (ssdev) [python-swiftclient] (threading-refactoring)$ pip freeze | grep nose
  nose==1.3.0
  nosehtmloutput==0.0.4
  nosexcover==1.0.7
  openstack.nose-plugin==0.11
  (ssdev) [python-swiftclient] (threading-refactoring)$'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-07-15 15:08:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm guessing it's one of these (which are in swift's test-requirements.txt but not python-swiftclient's):

  nosexcover
  openstack.nose_plugin
  nosehtmloutput

Or, since python-swiftclient's ./.unittests uses testr instead of nose, maybe testr version matters?  I've got:

  testrepository==0.0.15"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-15 15:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

indeed I just did a pip install -r test-* on my vm and it installed some magic package/version that does the output coverage automatically. I guess we have to assume that people are running in a venv or have it installed. I may abandon it but waiting for a bit in case someone find some usefulness for it (i.:e output for something else than html)'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-07-15 17:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

*nod*

Seems like installing everything listed in test-requires.txt is a reasonable prerequisite for getting any desired baseline of test output/success.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-07-19 22:50:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

-1 so that this will expire if nobody thinks there are other formats to add for coverage. Also, I'm confirming that without this patch, html output is already generated."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-27 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-27 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 12:05:00.000000000', 'message': "Allow to pass options to coverage.

- Adding the env variable COVERAGE_OPTION to .unittests which would be
  passed to the coverage binary instead of the default 'report' command
  argument.

Change-Id: If33da410d2a768925c4f5aeaeafac050791882fe
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to pass options to coverage.

- Adding the env variable COVERAGE_OPTION to .unittests which would be
  passed to the coverage binary instead of the default 'report' command
  argument.

Change-Id: If33da410d2a768925c4f5aeaeafac050791882fe

commit_message:
Don't make nova-compute depend on iSCSI

Because not all volume drivers require iSCSI it makes sense to not
set the initiator in the connector and let the volume drivers
return an error if iSCSI is required.

bug #1007084

Change-Id: I5da472e5013fdc0c733ecb12b919c1068873bdc6
(cherry picked from commit 3ba0c171c0b6f3516662bc0ab660b14cd6d34d8a)

'}]
commit_message:
Fix aggregate_get_by_host host filtering

aggregate_get_by_host never actually joins the _hosts relationship,
so aggregates with non-matching hosts are still included in the output.

This change adds the join and improves the tests to cover the bug.

Fixes bug 1201277.

Conflicts:

	nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
	nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py

Change-Id: I87ebfe3de193b9ae47e3a2c8350a49d9cc863fb0
(cherry picked from commit 13513a182a54dffb62900a8464529459dd836136)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 15:30:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue with v3 tokens and group membership roles

The driver calls used by v3 token controllers to obtain roles
for a user on both project and domain were incorrectly implemented,
leading to roles being missed out of the token. v2 tokens are not
affected, since they don't use the same driver calls.

This fixes these functions and adds additonal tests to cover the
cases (all of which would fail without this patch).  As part of this
fix, the implementation of "get_roles_for_user_and_project() is
pulled up into the driver class (like the domain equivalent is already),
since, for all implementations, it is independant of backend technology.

Fixes bug 1197874

Change-Id: I48aaf79241c87377c6940ab6193fc3acd4006c94
'}, {'created': '2013-07-24 16:00:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue with v3 tokens and group membership roles

The driver calls used by v3 token controllers to obtain roles
for a user on both project and domain were incorrectly implemented,
leading to roles being missed out of the token. v2 tokens are not
affected, since they don't use the same driver calls.

This fixes these functions and adds additonal tests to cover the
cases (all of which would fail without this patch).  As part of this
fix, the implementation of "get_roles_for_user_and_project() is
pulled up into the driver class (like the domain equivalent is already),
since, for all implementations, it is independant of backend technology.

Fixes bug 1197874

Change-Id: I48aaf79241c87377c6940ab6193fc3acd4006c94
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with v3 tokens and group membership roles

The driver calls used by v3 token controllers to obtain roles
for a user on both project and domain were incorrectly implemented,
leading to roles being missed out of the token. v2 tokens are not
affected, since they don't use the same driver calls.

This fixes these functions and adds additonal tests to cover the
cases (all of which would fail without this patch).  As part of this
fix, the implementation of "get_roles_for_user_and_project() is
pulled up into the driver class (like the domain equivalent is already),
since, for all implementations, it is independant of backend technology.

Fixes bug 1197874

Change-Id: I48aaf79241c87377c6940ab6193fc3acd4006c94

The latest Babel, 1.0, adds a dependency on
pytz. Further, pytz uses date-based versioning which is not

commit_message:
Pin Babel to <1.0 since it doesn't play well with pip 1.4

The latest Babel, 1.0, adds a dependency on
pytz. Further, pytz uses date-based versioning which is not
supported by default in the newest pip, 1.4. Adding a fake direct
dependency on pytz with a minimum declared version before installing
Babel works around this issue.

Fixes bug 1205546

Change-Id: Ie52dd85eac595ba8ee35e3342130648010246943

commit_message:
Add example app module for WSGI hosting.

This patch adds a simple app module to marconi.common as a reference
for hosting marconi with external WSGI servers, such as gunicorn and
uwsgi.

Change-Id: Ic398e714fc895a91dd61403ca7253064db5e53ec

commit_message:
Set service_available config options in tempest

This commit loops over the list of services that tempest has config
options for in the service_available group and checks if the service
is enabled. Devstack will then set whether or not the service is
configured in tempest.conf.

Change-Id: Ib845d3e098fd3f45c8c26f5696af14cca1534e01

Pretty nice. Need to make sure that all files have the apache header including the __init__.py's. But otherwise LGTM. For my own edification, what's the relationship between this and python-openstack client. Right now I know it consumes all the python-*client libraries, but I wonder if that's a better place long term for this code. Anyway though I'm good with this incubating in openstack-common."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-05-03 20:16:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (5 inline comments)

Looking good Alessio.  I like the addition of the sessions support.  I've only read the code so far and am hoping to give it a run this weekend.

Jason, the relationship to OpenStackClient is distant as OSC talks to the project API libs and they use this.  I don't think it makes sense to include this in OSC as then everything that wants to use the project API libs would get OSC too.  The apiclient libs and OSC are the bread for the API client sandwich."}, {'account_id': 7366, 'date': '2013-05-04 06:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-05-04 15:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (6 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-05-04 15:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-05-04 15:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I dug through the various client libs when planning for a major revision to the Quantum client library.  I agree that a common code base is sorely needed.  Unfortunately, I don't think we should start with this base.  It borrows a lot from our existing clients, but have we discussed whether this is really the direction we want to maintain?  (I don't recall seeing a thread to discuss it.)  Our planning for the Quantum client update takes us in a different direction and this proposal would not significantly benefit us."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-10 21:14:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Doug and Flavio, thank you very much for comprehensive comments!

Please, give me a sign if you agree with my comments. I will update this and all other commits with great pleasure.

Flavio, as far as I see from you commit to glanceclient, it is very easy to disable SSL compression in my apiclient (just an appropriate `mount' operation). However, I would like to preserve your authorship and add this functionality in a separate commit.

Mark, my commit is an aggregation of all tasty parts from 5 client packages and I am full of desire for writing all the necessary code. Why can't we start with this base?

> It borrows a lot from our existing clients, but have we discussed whether this is really the direction we want to maintain? (I don't recall seeing a thread to discuss it.) 

Frankly speaking, I have started the discussion several times during the last year, but it didn't help. I have participated in openstackclient design session (on Openstack Summit) and its developers agreed that such common API library would be desirable. So, I have written the implementation and a a bunch of patches in hope that they will be accepted as a ready solution.

> Our planning for the Quantum client update takes us in a different direction and this proposal would not significantly benefit us.

Could you share the results of your planning? I know that quantum (and swift) client is a different beast but even the current quantumclient could be easily updated to use the common library (quantumclient will use HttpClient to send HTTP requests and auth plugins to authenticate).

If you want, I could write a commit for quantumclient to show you that updates will be simple and useful."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-13 21:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (7 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-14 11:25:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (5 inline comments)

I replied in-line.

You're doing a great job on digging in the many clients needs and trying to reduce the code that should be changed, however, keep in mind that some clients will need to be changed anyway and since this implementation aims to be a common lib between clients, it is important for it to be simple, clean and easy to use.

Clean everything that doesn't make sense.

Thanks a lot for your effort"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-14 14:19:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Idea:

Since we're in the phase of creating Marconi's client (https://github.com/stackforge/python-marconiclient) and this API hasn't been fully tested, proved in real environments (not that I know), would it make sense to use Marconi's client as a testing environment and help both the client and the library grow at the same time?

I think it would be good to use this somewhere before letting it land, and Marconi client seems like a good place to do it. 

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-05-14 18:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I like this idea. I think that we could reach quite suitable and reliable solution in several commits.

I will update the code according to most of comments during the next day and I would like to send it for review to marconiclient.

What name should be used for the package? Could I put it as marconiclient.openstack.common.apiclient as it were already accepted to oslo? It will make simpler future updates to marconiclient and will make possible test that code is still compatible with other clients.'}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-05-15 16:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-15 16:09:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Doesn't seem to work

(12 inline comments)

Thanks for all your hard work on this!

This is obviously a big patch, so it's difficult to review in detail. I've only reviewed part of it so far. If you could break it down to a smaller initial patch with subsequent additions, that would be great

And I don't mean just putting separate files in separate commits. The logical separation of additions is what's important - e.g. you've removed the completion cache stuff and I could imagine a future patch to add it back. That's really helpful to reviewers ... the more you can limit the scope, the better.


But anyway ... it's looking good. We'll probably eventually get this merged, even without breaking it into smaller chunks.


One thing that I'd really, really appreciate is some commentary in the commit message about where all this code is being pulled from - it will also help people who look at the code in the future and want to look at its history before it was ever pulled into oslo-incubator.

Finally, could you also add an entry to the MAINTAINERS file"}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-05-21 20:44:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: (12 inline comments)

Thanks a lot for your review and your comments, Mark!


I've almost done with updates following your recommendations. There are small nits (I'd like to add one unit test for argument parser and revive authorship), but I hope to send the new code tomorrow.

I absolutely agree that this code is quite huge. Here is my plan of four commits:
1) exceptions and MAINTAINERS (this code is the simplest) (BTW, who will be a maintainer?);
2) move utils to openstack/common/cliutils;
3) the main stuff (client, base, and auth-plugin) will be a solid commit since these modules are not usable without each other;
4) keyring will be the last.

All new changes (such as hooks) will be done later.

If you like this plan, I will split the commit into four parts."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-21 20:51:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I'm writing here rather than lot's of individual reviews. This is a good idea and i've played with something similar before but the majority of it doesn't belong in oslo, they belong in python-keystoneclient. 

Classes such as Auth Response that encapsulate keystone returns are semi present already in keystone client but admittedly need work. If you (nova or other project) wishes to talk to keystone then they should be using the keystone client. This will allow us to add new authentication mechanisms and secure the existing without having to go through oslo. 

For example we are looking at x509 and kerberos and these changes should be able to permeate all projects without requiring an oslo update. 

As you say the code already partially comes from keystone client and nova (because nova doesn't use keystone client) but this shouldn't be copied betweent projects."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-06-19 01:32:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please make the authentication work Pythonkeystone client work instead of Oslo.  We need to make sure that authentication changes are syncronized between Keystone and the Client Code."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-26 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

AuthPlugins are looked up dynamically by stevedore, so, it is possible to provide plugins in any project, including python-keystoneclient. I think that they should be moved there when python-keystoneclient will switch to API client library.

This move is very easy because now all plugin resides in a separate module.'}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-07-16 10:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 10:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Works for me

So i have no objection to the base client (though i didn't do a thorough review) and i'm in favour of the concept of apiclient in oslo. 

We need to keep the auth mechanisms in keystoneclient. We are trying to consolidate them there so that when we add new mechanisms (and i'll stay with my trusty kerberos example) we don't need to update every project. Oslo is slightly better as at least the code is consistent, but then still requires an update through all the projects.

I'm happy with the idea of passing an auth object to client.

There is already work started on moving nova auth into keystoneclient: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36427/

It doesn't make sense to migrate those objects from oslo -> keystone, let's just start in keystone"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-18 20:58:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2013-07-23 17:43:09.000000000', 'message': 'Return right error code/message when creating qos queue in NVP plugin

When submitting a queue creation request with a dscp value and marking
set to trusted, NVP raises a BadRequest exception. This was masked by
Neutron with an Internal Server error exception because of a mishandling
of the inner exception.

This patch fixes this problem by returning the correct error code and
message to the user.

Fixes bug #1204145

Change-Id: I437ccaf91cef26577bc18445bc3c900b5bc6edd3
'}]
commit_message:
Return right error code/message when creating qos queue in NVP plugin

When submitting a queue creation request with a dscp value and marking
set to trusted, NVP raises a BadRequest exception. This was masked by
Neutron with an Internal Server error exception because of a mishandling
of the inner exception.

This patch fixes this problem by returning the correct error code and
message to the user.

Fixes bug #1204145

Change-Id: I437ccaf91cef26577bc18445bc3c900b5bc6edd3

commit_message:
Remove keystone uses ssl encryption by default in install guide

Also adds keystone.log to the chown command as the service fails to start
when it is owned by root.

Fixes bug #1205321

Change-Id: I1695636f5137e44800ab8db8d667c70ad1828477

directories named neutron and python-neutronclient now.
