subject: Add usage command for compute api
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 02:40:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-pep8/449 : SUCCESS in 2m 00s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/97/38097/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-docs/373/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 30s
- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python26/441 : SUCCESS in 1m 25s
- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python27/445 : FAILURE in 37s
"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-22 02:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 02:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-pep8/450 : SUCCESS in 2m 01s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/97/38097/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-docs/374/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 25s
- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python26/442 : SUCCESS in 1m 40s
- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python27/446 : SUCCESS in 1m 03s
'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-22 22:42:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

What kind of usage are we displaying?  The nova command says it is for tenants.  Does this make more sense as:

 project list --usage ...

or maybe

 project usage list ...

I'm hesitant to add a top-level object for a single command if the user's perception is that it is listing usage for a project/tenant or whatever."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-22 23:36:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

It shows the usage for all projects, as well as instances and other data. http://docs.openstack.org/cli/quick-start/content/nova_client.html -> ctrl+f "usage-list".

I had trouble displaying the correct number of instances. 

Projects doesn't seem like a perfect fit, imo. But if you are against creating a new top level object i suppose `project list usage` would be a good enough fit.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-23 04:23:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

The usage info is summarized per project.  Projects are the fundamental owners of cloud resources.

I only want to create a new top-level object if this either a) is really clear that is the right solution, or b) it doesn't otherwise fit anywhere else.  This feels like project data to me."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-23 08:00:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Did you want to keep the functionality in a separate usage file under compute? or move that to project too?

If the latter, this is it's own command? Not an option for `projects list`?"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-23 15:29:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

There is no technical reason for the arrangement we have in the source to divide everything by API/version.  I put limits and quota in openstackclient/common until we figure out what works better.

For this, if its 'project list --usage' then it needs to go in the ListProject class.  If it's 'project usage list' it can say here since it is a compute API or move since it is a project object.  I have a feeling that when we solve the problem of extending commands for extensions we'll solve this too."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-24 03:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 03:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/2/check/gate-python-openstackclient-pep8/461 : SUCCESS in 1m 50s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/97/38097/2/check/gate-python-openstackclient-docs/385/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 10s
- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/2/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python26/453 : SUCCESS in 1m 28s
- http://logs.openstack.org/97/38097/2/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python27/457 : SUCCESS in 1m 08s
'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-24 15:37:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

ok, now that I try 'project usage list' I'm not convinced, but I think it is the least bad option so far. ;)"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-25 06:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-25 13:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-25 19:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-25 20:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-25 21:17:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-25 21:06:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add ceilometer to the sys.path before the nova starts

The setup.py setup develop adds package to the
 /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/easy-install.pth.

The nova uses the ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier, so it must be
in the path before the nova started.

Change-Id: I80ed5e5611278e75afa7ab7f8fb91417897d423f
'}]
commit_message:
Add ceilometer to the sys.path before the nova starts

The setup.py setup develop adds package to the
 /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/easy-install.pth.

The nova uses the ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier, so it must be
in the path before the nova started.

Change-Id: I80ed5e5611278e75afa7ab7f8fb91417897d423f

messages:
[{'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-17 16:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

The missing "return segment" seems to address the primary issue.

As noted in-line, I don't think we want to remove the check that physical_network is not specified, since this attribute does not apply to tunnels.

In addition, we probably don't want to fall though to creating a tenant network if the type driver's validate_provider_segment() returns None (which it should never do). Maybe Ml2Plugin._process_provider_create() or TypeManager.validate_provide_segment() should raise an exception if provider attributes are supplied but the TypeDriver's validate_provider_segment() returns None.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 16:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
ML2 tunnel drivers validate provider networks correctly

there was a copy/paste error in GRE/VXlan type drivers implementation.
the segment wasn't returned while validating the provider network.

Change-Id: I7df6d2e714d09618644f935a9ed41354b62de9d0
Fixes: bug #1202244

Ah, spotted a bug in this patch -- all the places that add Link to an API object before returning it are adding the "thing.id" field, so the URI looks like, eg, "/nodes/1" instead of "/nodes/aaaaa-bbbb-....". IOW, you should be passing "thing.uuid" to make_link, not "thing.id".

Also, the test that validates the link should ensure the right UUID is there :)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-07-24 10:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add links to API Objects

This patch adds links to the resources, this allows a client to easily
obtain rather than construct resource URIs.

The patch also:
* Add from_rpc_object to convert RPC objects into API object
* Add unittests for the API /chassis/ and /port/
* Change get_all() to return a list of objects instead of a list of UUIDs

Change-Id: I54a7b4846f1e9a76ee5fcb1bc84b5fd2b4fc3d8a

commit_message:
Scipped tests don't render as ERROR's

Replaced `raise nose.exc.SkipTest()` statement to self.skipTest().
Removed unused nose.exc imports.

Fixes bug 1172794

Change-Id: Ieb353864acadef43508d185156c7fa1667baa845

subject: Update vncproxy service resource to use service name
messages:
[{'account_id': 216, 'date': '2013-07-26 04:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-26 04:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36/38736/1/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-lint/279 : SUCCESS in 4m 32s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36/38736/1/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-style/144 : SUCCESS in 5m 21s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36/38736/1/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-unit/277 : SUCCESS in 13m 19s
'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-07-26 09:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We've been using the same pattern everywhere else when declaring services. So I'm just curious what are the "times when that is a less favorable solution"?'}, {'account_id': 6530, 'date': '2013-07-26 13:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Ionut,

Thanks for taking a look at this.  You bring up an interesting point, and I am wondering if we should change more of these recipes to reflect the pattern below. Let me explain better.

In my environment, I happen to have a recipe that does some introspection with regard to which nova services are present and then based upon certain criteria, attempts to notify them to restart.

The difficulty I encountered was that on Ubuntu the "nova-vncproxy" service resource is actually maintaining the "nova-novncproxy" service by way of attributes:

"compute_vncproxy_service" => "nova-novncproxy",

Therefore, when I went to notify, I was greeted with a message indicating that the specified resource does not exist.

This change was isolated to the vnc proxy services, but now you have me thinking it might be a good change for any of the platform-specific service names/resources.

Thoughts?

Thanks again,
Craig'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-07-26 16:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Perfectly fine explanation.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-26 16:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-26 17:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36/38736/1/gate/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-lint/283 : SUCCESS in 4m 27s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36/38736/1/gate/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-style/148 : SUCCESS in 5m 26s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36/38736/1/gate/gate-cookbook-openstack-compute-chef-unit/281 : SUCCESS in 13m 34s
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-26 17:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 04:25:07.000000000', 'message': 'Update vncproxy service resource to use service name

Instead of calling the nova-vncproxy service by the generic
"nova-vncproxy" name, name this resource by its actual service name.
This change aids recieps that are dependent upon knowing which
service to notify when necessary. While it is possible to simply
notify "nova-vncproxy," there are times when that is a less favorable
solution.

Change-Id: Iefbec31b050dd93eba118012b07745dcc215f8c5
'}]
commit_message:
Update vncproxy service resource to use service name

Instead of calling the nova-vncproxy service by the generic
"nova-vncproxy" name, name this resource by its actual service name.
This change aids recieps that are dependent upon knowing which
service to notify when necessary. While it is possible to simply
notify "nova-vncproxy," there are times when that is a less favorable
solution.

Change-Id: Iefbec31b050dd93eba118012b07745dcc215f8c5

Devananda, there is two cases:
1)Tests on developer localhost. 
2)Tests on Jenkins. 
For 1) developer can enable any backend via test_migrations.conf with own credentials. 
For 2) we must use hardcoded credentials and skip test
if backend not available on developer host. 
There is separate "opportunistic" test in Nova (not in Oslo)
for 2). I can move "opportunistic" tests from Nova in separate patch, https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/db-migration-tests-opportunistic.'}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2013-07-25 16:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-25 04:33:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

a few issues:
1. bug/1202065 was filed for the same issue, please mark one of the bugs duplicate of another.
2. The fix seems strange to mock only part of tests of AgentUtilsExecuteTest.
I think mocking should be done in setUp and then reset in tearDown.
Also looking at tests themselves It seems that author actually wanted to run external commands. I think tests deserve more mocking (e.g. mocking of utils.subprocess_popen)"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-25 06:21:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

When I filed the bug, your report didn't pop up...I blame Launchpad :)

As for the mocking...I only mocked the failing tests, and the inner-most methods that required to be stubbed and yet still have the most of the test coverage. It's difficult to understand what the author really wanted, but to test  utils.execute there's no need to go all the way to calling the OS, that's a little more than unit testing."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-25 06:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

By the way do you have a fix for your bug report? I am happy to abandon this change if you have a better one.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-25 06:36:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No, I don't have the fix, so I'll reassign my bug to you.  I've seen this issue only twice and never saw these tests failing alone.

Also, that's a bit strange that only few of all AgentUtilsExecuteTest are failing. But I still think that mocking could be improved. It's not nice when unit tests are calling external commands."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-25 06:57:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, sounds good...but I still don't understand what's your proposal."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-25 07:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The proposal is to apply your fix for every test in AgentUtilsExecuteTest.
To minimize amount of additional code - mocking could be applied in setUp() and reset in tearDown()'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-25 07:13:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Gotcha. I thought about it, but the change would become greater in scope (whereas the current one would be enough to address the failures I experienced). On a side note, I wonder if we should look at all the utils.execute calls across all the unit tests and ensure they are properly stubbed out; in this case a refactoring of the agent execute test case would be due.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-25 07:22:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

That might make sense to check utils.execute usage, but I'm more concerned about sys.exit(). But that's different story :)"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-25 08:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

As far as I understood this is not a persistent bug. Given this is there a way to confirm that this patch fixes all possible causes of the fail?'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-25 17:35:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, we'll get it merged and see if the problem occurs again :P

Jokes aside, I'll address Eugene's comments and push another cs shortly."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-25 19:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-25 19:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Deal with intermittent OverflowError in gate-neutron-python26

This occurence looks like is related to a failure in
utils.execute. This patch attempts to deal with the error
by mocking out Popen.communicate altogether.

Fixes bug #1202065

Change-Id: I4092efb17939b69dd2d1965aaf619a9b2be03ef4

Fix migration branch appeared after recent commit

providernet extension support for cisco plugin

fixes bug 1205229

commit_message:
Delete Ironic context

Since all the production code uses a context from
openstack common library, the ironic.common.context
has been deleted. All unit tests have been patched to
use openstack.common.context rather than the old one.

Change-Id: I2db5033200694191ce57a20f271d737d7e1acec7

commit_message:
Use 'Neutron' in place of 'Quantum'

bug 1201596

All usages of the Quantum codename have been replaced with 'Neutron' or
other periphrases.
This does not apply to references to Quantum 1.x, as well as some samples which
are in the source code tree but not used anymore.

Patched to address Akihiro Motoki's capitalization edits.

Change-Id: Ie6b0a5f82587e32737c975b3748573a6d6ce3945

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 13:51:13.000000000', 'message': "Install which on Fedora

Create an install hook where core utilities can be installed
on Fedora. In this case we are installing which.
Which is being used by
  ramdisk/post-install.d/01-ensure-binaries
  vm/finalise.d/51-grub
The absence to which caused the ramdisk build to fail on F19.

On Ubuntu which is installed with the package debianutils, this pretty
much has to exist on Ubuntu images, so a corresponding package install for
ubuntu isn't needed.

Fixes Bug 1202612

Change-Id: I847c1619cdab021c9348caed3fa32db64e663e8e
"}]
commit_message:
Install which on Fedora

Create an install hook where core utilities can be installed
on Fedora. In this case we are installing which.
Which is being used by
  ramdisk/post-install.d/01-ensure-binaries
  vm/finalise.d/51-grub
The absence to which caused the ramdisk build to fail on F19.

On Ubuntu which is installed with the package debianutils, this pretty
much has to exist on Ubuntu images, so a corresponding package install for
ubuntu isn't needed.

Fixes Bug 1202612

Change-Id: I847c1619cdab021c9348caed3fa32db64e663e8e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 13:50:49.000000000', 'message': "Only remove $TMP_BUILD_DIR on cleanup

During ramdisk cleanup if for some reason the filesystems mounted
in $TMP_BUILD_DIR were not removed this recursive delete ended up
deleting parts of the host filesystem that were mounted (in particular
most of the contents of /dev got removed.

This commit doesn't deal with the reason the filesystem didn't unmounted
but ensures the consequences are not as severe.

Fixes Bug 1202612

Change-Id: Id8eba0753c2fe76c79ae1d952ce690d26e33e3ed
"}]
commit_message:
Only remove $TMP_BUILD_DIR on cleanup

During ramdisk cleanup if for some reason the filesystems mounted
in $TMP_BUILD_DIR were not removed this recursive delete ended up
deleting parts of the host filesystem that were mounted (in particular
most of the contents of /dev got removed.

This commit doesn't deal with the reason the filesystem didn't unmounted
but ensures the consequences are not as severe.

Fixes Bug 1202612

Change-Id: Id8eba0753c2fe76c79ae1d952ce690d26e33e3ed

There is a section of code in the capabilities filter that
is improperly indented.  This causes extra_specs that are not
prefixed by 'capabilities:' to fail to be properly handled.

This commit fixes the indentation so that extra_specs are properly
handled.

fixes bug 1205175

Change-Id: Idd07952e6122debfc6ce049631db5f88602c83ff
"}]
commit_message:
Wrong indentation in capabilities_filter

There is a section of code in the capabilities filter that
is improperly indented.  This causes extra_specs that are not
prefixed by 'capabilities:' to fail to be properly handled.

This commit fixes the indentation so that extra_specs are properly
handled.

fixes bug 1205175

Change-Id: Idd07952e6122debfc6ce049631db5f88602c83ff

[{'created': '2013-07-09 08:42:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add scenario test of instance/volume snapshot and attach them

This test is for snapshotting an instance/volume and attach the volume created from snapshot to the instance booted from snapshot.
The following is the scenario outline:
1. Boot an instance "instance1"
2. Create a volume "volume1"
3. Attach volume1 to instance1
4. Create a filesystem on volume1
5. Mount volume1
6. Create a file which timestamp is written in volume1
7. Unmount volume1
8. Detach volume1 from instance1
9. Get a snapshot "snapshot_from_volume" of volume1
10. Get a snapshot "snapshot_from_instance" of instance1
11. Boot an instance "instance2" from snapshot_from_instance
12. Create a volume "volume2"  from snapshot_from_volume
13. Attach volume2 to instance2
14. Check an existence of a file which created at 6. in volume2

Change-Id: If8eef9c8c4415b8658ac1b13dc2e114dc22378b4

commit_message:
Add scenario test of instance/volume snapshot

This test is for snapshotting an instance/volume
and attaching the volume created from snapshot
to the instance booted from snapshot.
The following is the scenario outline:
1. Boot an instance "instance1"
2. Create a volume "volume1"
3. Attach volume1 to instance1
4. Create a filesystem on volume1
5. Mount volume1
6. Create a file which timestamp is written in volume1
7. Unmount volume1
8. Detach volume1 from instance1
9. Get a snapshot "snapshot_from_volume" of volume1
10. Get a snapshot "snapshot_from_instance" of instance1
11. Boot an instance "instance2" from snapshot_from_instance
12. Create a volume "volume2"  from snapshot_from_volume
13. Attach volume2 to instance2
14. Check the existence of a file which created at 6. in volume2

Change-Id: If8eef9c8c4415b8658ac1b13dc2e114dc22378b4
Fixes: bug #1203637

add service tests

1. list service by some params combination
2. enable/disable service

commit_message:
Move common scheduler code from components.

Some components like nova and cinder have common scheduling

settings. All common things placed in oslo-scheduler.

Implements: blueprint oslo-scheduler

Change-Id: Ie30fea6169e76938b15fb9bbe6002e29bde1eb5b

"}, {'created': '2013-07-24 07:15:44.000000000', 'message': "Don't call consume() each time iterconsume() is called

commit_message:
Don't call consume() each time iterconsume() is called

We're going to be using iterconsume(limit=1) and this basically seems
to be broken right now because you get an error if you call consume()
multiple times on the same connection.

Set the 'do_consume' flag at connection time rather than on entry into
iterconsume().

Change-Id: I988e4074ae0e267384931d6e1994e9cbe5248196

commit_message:
Basic starter scenario for testing the dashboard

Add tests to check that the homepage is working, and that it's
possible to log in and see the overview page.

Fixes bug 1204408

Change-Id: Ifd62e833c85b78c39052f1365a4e1e00680713ef

So this is a good start, but it is -1 for a few reasons:

1. The commit message needs to be cleared up a bit. The title line isn't descriptive enough. See:
http://wiki.openstack.org/GitCommitMessages

2. These tests probably belong under the server actions tests:
tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_actions.py

3. The first test doesn't need to create and then delete a server. You can get the same result by just trying to pause a nonexistent server. (See: test_get_console_output_invalid_server_id for an example of doing this)

4. commit_message:
Added a server-pause test

Implementd a negative test for pausing
a already paused server.

Implements blueprint: add-negative-test-for-server

Use console_scripts instead of bin

It is required for migration to pbr. Currently there is no need to use bin files.

Change-Id: Ia06b1786e1c66370f472fc00937394be722526b1

Changing a default value for the config driver will take a lot more than just flipping a switch. If you look at the test failures there are some fundamental problems with your approach. I would argue that you don't need these changes in Neutron at all. Just tweak the devstack scripts to let the user customize the quota driver from a preset variable in the localrc."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-26 10:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, I realized it is little bit more complex issue.
Looks like the usual config overrides does not helps in not using the DB driver with the existing test cases.

Multiple people would like to test this feature on the devstack-tempest gate. What do you recommend, how to do this ?'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-26 11:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

I abandon this change in favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/38678/ .'}]

[{'created': '2013-07-25 06:56:44.000000000', 'message': 'The per tenant quota update default possible

The old config based quota driver neutron.quota.ConfDriver
does not allow you to update the per tenant quota settings,
but the neutron.db.quota_db.DbQuotaDriver does.

This feature is necessary to provide similar quota functionality as
the nova-network.

Fixing bug 1198165

Change-Id: Ic9c8569490774bf661734e3915c1e7e0ca8e77d7

commit_message:
The per tenant quota update default possible

The old config based quota driver neutron.quota.ConfDriver
does not allow you to update the per tenant quota settings,
but the neutron.db.quota_db.DbQuotaDriver does.

This feature is necessary to provide similar quota functionality as
the nova-network.

Fixing bug 1198165

Change-Id: Ic9c8569490774bf661734e3915c1e7e0ca8e77d7

commit_message:
Validate image tags to contain required tags for plugin

Add method check_required_image_tags to validations/base.py which checks image tags to containing required tags
Add validation required tags for default image to cluster create validation and cluster create template validation
Add unit tests for this methods

Fixes: bug #1204410

Change-Id: Iff80057106fc73fc5f29b5a1f983f99b33840b73
(cherry picked from commit af19c04d5d94a557c71bce919404518fc2e86c5c)

commit_message:
Fix a timing sensive cloudwatch testcase

This was leaving a watchrule in the db and causing
a test case in test_engine_service.py to fail.
Also cleanup the created stacks.

Change-Id: If8451291b4f17c797b72fd3ab51793d51c2c97ad

commit_message:
Remove support for sqlalchemy-migrate < 0.7

The sqlalchemy-migrate dependency already requires >= 0.7, so supporting
anything older is unnecessary

Change-Id: I0cfd640f420b4fe2837b496f4ef3d3e260619b63

- http://logs.openstack.org/37835/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/19473 : SUCCESS in 22m 06s
'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-19 09:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This change results in the client making two calls to  "os-hypervisors/detail"  both of which return details of all hypervisors in the system from which the client then filters the one that it wants.  On a large system that can mean getting the details of 1000's of hypervisors 

If you really want the convenience of using a name instead of an ID then I think the client should be doing the work to get the list, translate the name to the ID, and then get the details via the ID'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-19 11:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for review, Phil,

If the specified hypervisor is an ID(int), utils.find_resource() calls to "/os-hypervisors/<ID>".
That gets only detail of one hypervisor:

novaclient/utils.py
 195 def find_resource(manager, name_or_id):
 196     """Helper for the _find_* methods."""
 197     # first try to get entity as integer id
 198     try:
 199         return manager.get(int(name_or_id))

novaclient/v1_1/hypervisors.py
 32 class HypervisorManager(base.ManagerWithFind):
 [..]
 54
 55     def get(self, hypervisor):
 56         """
 57         Get a specific hypervisor.
 58         """
 59         return self._get("/os-hypervisors/%s" % base.getid(hypervisor),
 60                          "hypervisor")
 
So I don't think its workload is so bigger than current one if specifying an ID as its argument.

On the other hand, if the specified hypervisor is a name, utils.find_resource() calls to "/os-hypervisors/detail".
On a large system, that results in more workload as you said.
but I feel many people execute "nova hypervisor-list" command currently before "nova hypervisor-uptime" to get its id.
so the workload on client side will be almost same in real world, I think..'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-19 16:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

OK - you won me over :-)

Does need some unit tests though'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-22 00:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, I see.
I will add some unittests to next patch.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-22 00:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 01:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 05:07:17.000000000', 'message': 'Replace config_by_role with search_for

config_by_role is almost entirely unused, and returns inconsisent
results depending on which node it is called from. Similarly, with the
new structure of these cookbooks, the "section" attribute of
config_by_role is pretty useless. So get rid of config_by_role and
replace it with search_for in this case.

Also ajust test to account for change in return type.

This change is related to https://review.openstack.org/38738

Change-Id: I12e99e665a037791ef1f8c351f261cd34ae38d72
'}]
commit_message:
Replace config_by_role with search_for

config_by_role is almost entirely unused, and returns inconsisent
results depending on which node it is called from. Similarly, with the
new structure of these cookbooks, the "section" attribute of
config_by_role is pretty useless. So get rid of config_by_role and
replace it with search_for in this case.

Also ajust test to account for change in return type.

This change is related to https://review.openstack.org/38738

Change-Id: I12e99e665a037791ef1f8c351f261cd34ae38d72

- http://logs.openstack.org/37826/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-testr-full/259 : SUCCESS in 28m 50s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/37826/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/33395 : SUCCESS in 47m 07s

'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-19 08:56:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have a number of problems with this change:

1) Accepting a name instead of an ID only works where the API call will accept either - and this isn't the case with the aggregated API.  So I don't think this change will work as intended.


2) Aggregate names are not constrained to be unique in the system, and so allowing actions by name will lead to confusion and possibly wrong behavior.

Sorry but I just don't see this as a valid case for accepting a name instead of an id"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-19 09:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Phil,

> 1) Accepting a name instead of an ID only works where the API call will accept either
> - and this isn't the case with the aggregated API. So I don't think this change will work as intended.

I'm sorry if I don't understand the above comment correctly..
This change allows both a name and an id as the argument, and passes an id to the aggregated API.
The API parameter is the same as current behavior.


> 2) Aggregate names are not constrained to be unique in the system, and so allowing actions by name will
> lead to confusion and possibly wrong behavior.

If the specified name is duplicated, the command fails by the following code:
Isn't this behavior enough?

novaclient/utils.py
 233     except exceptions.NoUniqueMatch:
 234         msg = ("Multiple %s matches found for '%s', use an ID to be more"
 235                " specific." % (manager.resource_class.__name__.lower(),
 236                                name_or_id))'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-19 11:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Seems I was wrong about aggregate name not being unique, the DB layer in Nova does enforce this.

Still not wild about the implementation here though, as what this change actually does is when using a name change the APi call from a get of "/os-aggregates/<id>" to a get of "/os-aggregates" - which will pull back details of all aggregates and then filter for the one that's wanted.

Its not quite as bad as the hypervisor case proposed in a similar patch as there are less aggregates on a system - but  I still don't really like that overall lazy approach  / system load for what is really a very minor productivity issue 

So I'll take away the -1,  but I'm not convinced enough of the benefit to make it a +1'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-19 12:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

OK, I can see your point.
I have gotten some performance result on my poor devstack environment, I believe there is not any production environment which is cheaper than it :-p

All following results are after applying this patch.

Summary:

* The time of "nova aggregate-list": 21.5 sec
* The time of "nova aggregate-delete <id>": 0.6 sec 
* The time of "nova aggregate-delete <name>": 42.7 sec

Details:

The devstack environment:
  cpu: i5-3570 CPU @ 3.40GHz * 2cores
  mem: 2GB

I created almost 1,000 aggregates:
 $ nova aggregate-list | wc -l
 1005
 $

The time of "nova aggregate-list":
 $ time nova aggregate-list > /dev/null
 real    0m21.498s
 user    0m0.396s
 sys     0m0.044s
 $

The time of "nova aggregate-delete <id>":
 $ time nova aggregate-delete 1001
 Aggregate 1001 has been successfully deleted.
 real    0m0.633s
 user    0m0.304s
 sys     0m0.044s
 $

The time of "nova aggregate-delete <name>":
 $ time nova aggregate-delete aggregate-999
 Aggregate 1000 has been successfully deleted.
 real    0m42.659s
 user    0m0.356s
 sys     0m0.052s
 $'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-19 13:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As the result, users can get good performance with argument <id> even if applying this patch.
on the other hand, we get bad performance with argument <name> if many aggregates.
but I feel many people execute "nova aggregate-list" command currently before "nova aggregate-*" to get its id.
so the workload on client side will be almost same in real world, as I said on other patch(I9adfb699775d2d8f8ca45a7a28621e634bc03055) ..'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-19 13:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Phil, just curiosity..

Some operators ask me sometimes "Why should I specify IDs of OpenStack entities as command line parameters even if the entity has its name?" or "Why should we parse ID by referring NAME in a shell script to specify ID as parameter of second command line?".

Have you experienced such questions?'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-07-19 15:02:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So, it seems reasonable to me to support names, though I agree that incurs a performance penalty; it probably bears mentioning in the novaclient documentation that, in most cases, resolution by name will be slower than using the ID.  However, that is out of the scope of this patch

What is in scope, however, is that I want to see some by-name tests added"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-19 16:09:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

To answer your question I'd say that generally for many objects in Nova names are not unique (this is esp true from a user perspective) - so I try to get our operators to use is/uuids instead.

When you'er working across systems or across projects on a system there is always a chance with a name that you'll hit the wrong object"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-22 00:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Phil - That is good advice for me. Thanks.
Kevin - Thanks for reviewing, I see. will add unittest with next patch.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-07-22 01:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 01:55:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add name argument to aggregate commands

Fixes #Bug 1202901

This patch adds name arguments to the following subcommands:
 * aggregate-update
 * aggregate-delete
 * aggregate-set-metadata
 * aggregate-add-host
 * aggregate-remove-host
 * aggregate-details

Change-Id: I93f44a12b6d5a91b448f6f8d238311d58bf40c01

commit_message:
Remove config_by_role in favor of search_for

config_by_role is only used in once place:
openstack-compute::nova-common. And, in this single place it happens
to return inconsistent results. Now that we have search_for, which
does return consistent results, move this one last config_by_role
call to use that. In the interest of good clean living, I am removing
this code.

Bumping to version 0.4.0

Change-Id: Ib755a5d568008599ee7d663f43716e7fe47251f9

As it stands right now, libvirt calls out to system to execute
grub2-set-default and this was stubbed out only in the Suse chefspec
libvirt test. Move this stub to spec_helper and modify our tailor
configuration to allow for this change.

Change-Id: I276d799cb3db5f725ffa396b5bed8724b6e42696
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken libvirt recipe test

As it stands right now, libvirt calls out to system to execute
grub2-set-default and this was stubbed out only in the Suse chefspec
libvirt test. Move this stub to spec_helper and modify our tailor
configuration to allow for this change.

Change-Id: I276d799cb3db5f725ffa396b5bed8724b6e42696

commit_message:
Add support for listing claimed messages (storage)

This patch modifies the default behavior of the message listing
interface such that both claimed and unclaimed messages will
be included in the results. A new kwarg was added to the method
so that the caller can override the default behavior.

Change-Id: I21309e986e3e0a501ca14dbfec72321fd6279565
Fixes: bug #1202430

http code.

commit_message:
recognize 429 as an rate limiting status

currently novaclient recognize 413 as rate limiting status while
it shoule be 429 according to HTTP protocol.

fixes bug 1191874

Change-Id: Ib1ae54f7d13d0ca579dd264e8d0d7630770e92d6

commit_message:
Ensure that L3 managed port have status ACTIVE

Some plugins may set the port status as DOWN when it is created. This was not
updated when the port was actually up. This patch ensures that gateway and
router ports that are created will be set as ACTIVE when they are actually
up and running.

Ports that are attached to additional bridges in the OVS will only update the
port status as ACTIVE. There will be no tags set on the specific ports as this
will break the existing functionality.

Fixes bug 1192883

Change-Id: I9993f56963ac704f0f345102d2e8b2d99dd9ad9e

commit_message:
port baremetal_nodes API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Change-Id: I180bbf7306e7d3bffa4d6093fedfd52e4baf5215

commit_message:
Validate image tags to contain required tags for plugin

Add method check_required_image_tags to validations/base.py which checks image tags to containing required tags
Add validation required tags for default image to cluster create validation and cluster create template validation
Add unit tests for this methods

Fixes: bug #1204410

Change-Id: Iff80057106fc73fc5f29b5a1f983f99b33840b73

Add a simple object pool implementation for our connection pool, in
place of eventlet.pools.Pool.

Also use threading.Lock in place of eventlet.Semaphore.

There are still some eventlet modules imported by the code, but we can

commit_message:
Port away from some eventlet infrastructure

Add a simple object pool implementation for our connection pool, in
place of eventlet.pools.Pool.

Also use threading.Lock in place of eventlet.Semaphore.

There are still some eventlet modules imported by the code, but we can
avoid using them at runtime and clean things up later. We can't remove
them now or it'll cause pep8 failures.

Change-Id: I380408d1321802de813de541cd0a2d4305c3627c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 03:40:52.000000000', 'message': "do not raise exception on ip address recycle operation

Currenty a exception will raise on ip address recycle operation if the ip
address don't belong to any allocation pool which will make user unable
to update port, even worse it will make user unable to create new port.
So do not raise exception if the ip address to be recycled don't belong
to any allocation, just delete it from the ip allocation table.

fixes bug 1201692

Change-Id: Icfbded5158f1f4043f69bb1463fd4c830c9714a9

commit_message:
do not raise exception on ip address recycle operation

Currenty a exception will raise on ip address recycle operation if the ip
address doesn't belong to any allocation pool which will make user unable
to update port, even worse it will make user unable to create new port.
So do not raise exception if the ip address to be recycled doesn't belong
to any allocation, just delete it from the ip allocation table.

fixes bug 1201692

Change-Id: Icfbded5158f1f4043f69bb1463fd4c830c9714a9

commit_message:
Remove use of gettextutils

We don't have any infrastructure for localizations in oslo.messaging
so using this is pointless right now. I'm also generally not convinced
we want to translate any of the strings in this library anyway.

For now, just add a dummy _() function. We can can unmark the strings
later.

Change-Id: I1b6a698ee5558c50dc5eafee1f5f05ee2570435e

commit_message:
Remove use of openstack.common.local

This means we no longer set the request context for the current thread
so that it can be used in logging.

We do need to add this back later, but it might be in the form of a
get_current_context() method.

Change-Id: I3f08a85e2019affddec829e2ea008b5c10707660

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 06:28:05.000000000', 'message': "Add support for provider networks

Quantum lost the ability to configure provider
networks between folsom and grizzly in part
due to changes made in commit 094c2ae:
only set network_vlan_ranges for vlan network types

Since network_vlan_ranges informs the plugin
which provider networks are available, it is
still needed even when not in vlan mode.

This patch changes the behavior to be:

- if the user sets vlan_ranges, the config option
will be set regardless of plugin

- if the user doesn't set it, a default is used
when in vlan mode, while the value is ensured
absent when in gre mode.

Change-Id: I1638d28da87041798c0b183923137c3bd535c6c3
"}, {'created': '2013-07-26 06:28:05.000000000', 'message': "Add support for provider networks

commit_message:
Add support for provider networks

Quantum lost the ability to configure provider
networks between folsom and grizzly in part
due to changes made in commit 094c2ae:
only set network_vlan_ranges for vlan network types

Since network_vlan_ranges informs the plugin
which provider networks are available, it is
still needed even when not in vlan mode.

This patch changes the behavior to be:

- if the user sets vlan_ranges, the config option
will be set regardless of plugin

- if the user doesn't set it, a default is used
when in vlan mode, while the value is ensured
absent when in gre mode.

Change-Id: I1638d28da87041798c0b183923137c3bd535c6c3

commit_message:
Return group name 'unknown' for options with no group info

Rather than raising an exception, print a warning that
the group name of an option was not found. For options
that were registered twice or not registered on the same module
it was defined should be fixed manually. There are some options
which its groups are created at runtime therefore impossible to determine
the groupname. For instance, the cinder lvm options are set on different
backend names, i.e

[lvm1]
volume_group=lvm-group-1
...

[lvm2]
volume_group=lvm-group-2
...

Change-Id: I3bcb506a2366d616de8f390997a64725307d332d

commit_message:
Migrate sqlalchemy utils from Oslo

These utils are useful for work with database and schema migrations.

File `nova/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py`
- contains utilites that can be used in database migrations.

File `nova/openstack/common/exception.py`
- contains required exceptions

Change-Id: Idf52099023c67882b01bdce5ece80d2ea3e1d7b2

Hmm, what's the reasoning for adding another format? I think this creates an external API change that users can't probe for, and that we've not supported in the past. Thus, I don't think we should be making this change. I think some feedback from the API folks is needed.

That said, if we do, we should be making the change against APIv3 as well (or perhaps only).

I'm -1 until we get some more feedback."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-18 15:40:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

agreed, the previous version of this code was there to handle time formats we knew we had. Not sure why there would be another time format in here."}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-07-18 16:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

This is what str() would return for datetime instances with the microseconds part set to 0. ISO 8601 seems to allow the separator to be specified (so space is ok) and microseconds part to be optional. And we already have "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%f".

I thought it would be useful to have an additional format here. If you think it's not, I'll abandon the patch and mark the bug as invalid.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-26 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 13:53:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new datetime format to _parse_datime()

_parse_datetime() currently supports following datetime formats:
 - "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S"
 - "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%f"
 - "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%f"

Support for the "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S" datetime format should be added
(ISO8601 without microseconds part, that uses the space character as
a separator between date and time).

Fixes bug 1200146.

Change-Id: Idc5537e1b58826745d56956c6e40671638646732
'}, {'created': '2013-07-12 14:32:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new datetime format to _parse_datetime()

commit_message:
Add a new datetime format to _parse_datetime()

_parse_datetime() currently supports following datetime formats:
 - "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S"
 - "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%f"
 - "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%f"

Support for the "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S" datetime format should be added
(ISO8601 without microseconds part, that uses the space character as
a separator between date and time).

Fixes bug 1200146.

Change-Id: Idc5537e1b58826745d56956c6e40671638646732

commit_message:
XenApi virt driver should throw exception on failure

    Virt xenapi driver does not throw InstancePowerOffFailure exception
    on a failure while destroying an instance.
    _shutdown_instance in compute manager expects InstancePowerOffFailure
    and reraises it.
    This ensures that instances are not wrongly marked as deleted.

    This commit was reverted for 1194264. But the bug was due to
    Xenapi shutdown not returning a true when the instance was already
    shutdown. It is fixed as part of review #34865

    Fixes: bug #1190076
    Change-Id: I0f063820a350de7393f12f27159fff48167c3cc8

Change-Id: I30f06d1526bd5df402526f2338b8ba20d8749a20

- http://logs.openstack.org/34095/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/33132 : SUCCESS in 17m 59s

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-23 23:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The name check_newest is confusing since the method returns True for a negative condition (newest object found and x-delete-at does not match).

The delete marker object in the .expiring_objects account will remain if the newest object is found and x-delete-at does not match, meaning it will sit there forever retrying (until someone deletes the offending object).

I'm also not sure why all the metadata_prefix stuff. Why not just resp.headers.get('x-delete-at')?

I would recommend just removing the new method and modifying the delete_actual_object code, skipping over that DELETE request if the object isn't found or its newest x-delete-at doesn't match. Something like this:

    def delete_actual_object(self, actual_obj, timestamp):
        """
        Deletes the end-user object indicated by the actual object name given
        '<account>/<container>/<object>' if and only if the X-Delete-At value
        of the object is exactly the timestamp given.

        :param actual_obj: The name of the end-user object to delete:
                           '<account>/<container>/<object>'
        :param timestamp: The timestamp the X-Delete-At value must match to
                          perform the actual delete.
        """
        path = '/v1/' + urllib.quote(actual_obj.lstrip('/'))
        resp = self.swift.make_request(
            'HEAD', path, {'x-newest': 't'}, (2, HTTP_NOT_FOUND))
        if is_success(resp.status_int) and \
                resp.headers.get('x-delete-at') == str(timestamp):
            # TODO(yourname): Remove X-If-Delete-At header in a future release.
            self.swift.make_request(
                'DELETE', path, {'X-If-Delete-At': str(timestamp)},
                (2, HTTP_NOT_FOUND, HTTP_PRECONDITION_FAILED))

Also, I'd like to see the X-If-Delete-At logic in the object server commented as deprecated so we can remove it in a future release.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-23 23:39:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-23 23:40:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Man, I'm horrible at button clicking today. See above, above comment as why the -1."}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-06-24 03:34:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@gholt

Thanks, I'll update it.

but I'm not clear about the logic here:
say we have 3 copy expired at the same time, and the result of the head request would also be '404 not found' thus the sample code will have no chance to issue the delete requests? however actually we need to delete these expired objects?"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-24 12:45:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ah, very good point I'd forgotten about. One improvement considered was adding X-Delete-At values to the 404 response from the object server. It would serve this purpose of checking by the expirer, but would also let a user/admin know if the object was still on disk but expired (would've been useful already in a few situations here)."}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-06-25 02:06:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@gholt

Let me try to do a summary here:
1. the normal case would be the newest copy has the same expire time

There are several race conditions here: 
2. the newest copy is overwritten and its x-delete-at is none
3. the newest copy is overwritten and its x-delete-at is in the future(bigger than current copy's)
4. the newest copy is overwritten and its x-delete-at is in the past(smaller than current copy's)
5. the newest copy is deleted

in case1: the head result should be '404'-> safe to delete

in case2: the head result should be '200' with x-delete-at=None -> skip the delete 

in case3: 
a)the head result should be '404' -> safe to delete
b)'200' with different x-delete-at -> skip delete 

int case4: the head result should be '404' -> safe to delete

in case5: the head result should '404' -> safe to delete

so these are two situations we need to skip the delete request: case2 and case3.b. Both of the head results are:
resp.status == 200, and different x-delete-at header

and the pseudo code should be:
if is_success(resp.status_int)and resp.headers.get('x-delete-at') != str(timestamp)
    return
issue_delete_requests

make sense?"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:14:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

That does sound right. Might actually be good to put that in the docstring. Even though it'd be like telling a story, it would likely help a future dev."}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-06-27 06:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-06-27 06:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-27 07:26:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-06-27 11:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck bug 1182628'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-27 11:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/34095/7/check/gate-swift-pep8/2937 : SUCCESS in 39s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/34095/7/check/gate-swift-docs/2767/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 09s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34095/7/check/gate-swift-python26/3014 : SUCCESS in 2m 37s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34095/7/check/gate-swift-python27/3013 : SUCCESS in 1m 36s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34095/7/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/26752 : SUCCESS in 41m 54s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34095/7/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/34433 : SUCCESS in 17m 04s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34095/7/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/26458 : SUCCESS in 42m 52s
- http://logs.openstack.org/34095/7/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/13273 : FAILURE in 20m 54s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-27 12:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-28 09:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Maybe I'm thinking about this wrong, but when I see:

1) HEAD X-Newest
2) if "something that I think I know"
3) then DELETE

It *looks* like a classic "test and set" race?

PLUS, what if the newest copy *available* at the time the expirer made the HEAD request wasn't *actually* the newest stored in the system?  Won't the X-If-Delete-At create a .ts with the current timetamp and eventually replication will eat the "newer" object that wasn't available to participate in the X-Newest quorum at the time the expirer made the ill-informed DELETE?

Hopefully I misunderstand the solution; but if so I'd appreciate if you could point out how.

If this change is ment purely to minimize the likelihood of the issue (rather than *fix* bug 1182628), I may have a different opinion entirely... but it seems like this could be fully addressed entirely in the object-server with some careful translation of the objects *original* X-Timestamp to the new timestamp of the tombstone iff the X-Delete-At is a match.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/39345/

Those servers who receive the the X-If-Delete-At and can't verify the request would simply reject it and let replication sort it out.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-06-28 14:24:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: No score

Clay, yeah, I should've mentioned why the x-timestamp + .00001 doesn't work either. The reclaimer would discard tombstones older than a week (by default).

I'm pretty there's no solution to solving all the races, just minimizing the window and limiting the damage that can be done.

With that said, I wonder if doing the max(x-timestamp + .00001, time() - reclaim_age / 2) is the best we can do? It would discard any while-it's-working races (assuming it doesn't take longer than reclaim_age / 2 to perform a single check and delete) and will still give reclaim_age / 2 to settle any replication issues before the tombstone was discarded.

But, I haven't given a ton of thought on this whole thing. Maybe I should. :/"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-28 23:54:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: No score

Well when I looked it seemed that the replicator (the part that does the reclaiming anyway) looks at the mtime on the file instead of .ts

Yuan,

Does gholt's suggestion make sense?  Do you think it would be a better or more complete solution?  Would you be interested in pursuing it?

Here's the relevant utility method:

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/utils.py#L1312

And it's caller:

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/obj/replicator.py#L379"}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-06-29 00:23:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@Clay,yes this is a better solution. I'll update it. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-07-02 16:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-02 16:18:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Fix race conditions in obj-expirer

Fix bug 1182628

There will be some race conditions when expirer running on a
inconsistent system. This patch is trying to minimizing the
window.

Change-Id: I98a1a2c0a7e9faf43797415b244b364f2894a91a

Ensure booleans are capitalized in template

Python requires booleans to be capitalized to be a valid value.

commit_message:
Return 500 when an action without decorator expected_errors raise any exception

This can avoid we are missing decorator expected_errors for any action.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ia803e21f73efcbd2d02126f5595adcce59cadcbb

commit_message:
Allow use of local conductor

Fixes bug 1204864

Conductor API import was directly importing remote API not allowing
use of use_local flag in nova.

Change-Id: Ieea410ac6b90fedb6871e0f4c3d02e6a35363439

owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
documentation Updated README.md for module release

Updated the README.md documentation in anticipation
of the puppet-quantum 2.0 release (Grizzly). Matched
style to other modules, added a short example, and
included links to further documentation and resources.

* Added example code to enable quantum networking in nova.
* Included a list of other quantum network drivers of
interest.
* Updated contributors to point to the latest github
graph.
* Trailing whitespace removed.
* Added cisco-quantum to documentation
* backticks around inline source

Change-Id: Ice968a719541c8e3a8924647690a99ef6d304378

commit_message:
Add configurable log for proxy-server service

This patch add configurable log for swift proxy-server service.
And add related spec test.

Partially implements blueprint puppet-swift-log-support.

Change-Id: I385093b3e63f8210d83ec125e6d2578b06b631d4

commit_message:
Use nose skip exception conditionally

testtools and nose disagree on the exception raised for skipping
tests with python < 2.7 (see inline comments for exact details).

This monkey-patches testtools to recognise the nose skip exception.
However, due to nose being deprecated we hide this behind an
environment variable to make it an opt-in fix.

While we're there, modify tempest.test.api.utils @skip_unless_attr
decorator to raise from tempest's BaseTestCase rather than
testtools.TestCase directly.

Change-Id: I13a8f374e879799870bc9193a1ddbdc8d6abb73c

'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-05-06 04:41:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I can see the value in having more granularity in the quota system, but I have a number of concerns with this change as it stands.

Its nor clear to me from reading the blueprint or the code how these new per-user quotas are intended to interact with the existing per-project quotas:

- Users and Projects are orthogonal concepts, but its not clear if the quotas here are per-user across all projects that user is associated with, or a sub-division of an project quota (in which case perhaps they should be called per-project-user-quotas

- What happens is some users associated with a project have additional quotas and some don't.

- How does this maintain backwards compatibility with the current project-only quotas

All of these areas should be covered in detail in the Blueprint text.  

Also the change needs to be flagged as DocImpact, and the blueprint text should include some examples that can be included in the documentation set

Finally you seem to be extending an existing API extension, and until we get to API extensions in the V3 API that needs to be a specific new extension so that clients can tell via the API that the system supports this capability or not."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-05-06 13:23:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi, Phil
Thanks for the tips! I'm trying to give some explanations to your question.
1. User quota is a sub-division of a project quota.
2. The sum of all users' quotas under a same project will not exceed the quotas of the project.
3. If user quota is not setted, the usages of a resource of all users will be limited by project quotas.
4. The usage of a resource will be limited by the user quota, if it was setted.
I will add some examples to the blueprint text in detail and add DocImpact flag to commit message later."}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-05-07 01:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-05-07 01:18:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-07 02:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Problems with shadow table=)"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-05-07 16:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi, Thanks for the clarification to my previous comments.

I still have some problems with the approach here, mainly in that your describing something as a user quota when really its a user quota within a project.  Users and Projects are orthogonal concepts, users are not subdivisions of a project.  I can have users U1 & U2 both of whom are associated with Projects P1 & P2.

So it seems to be that we should either be:
- Allowing quotas to be defined just at the user level (so U1 has a quota of X across all projects

- Renaming this to per-project-user-quotas and being consistent about that in table names, etc

(or maybe allowing both cases)

I'd also really like to see some consideration of making this work with something akin to quota classes for managability.   Its already  a pain to have to define each project quota seperatly on a large system, and this has potentially a "x N" magnification  on the number of quota values that need to be defined and managed.'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-05-08 15:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-05-08 16:29:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi, Phil

Done for renaming.

Defining quotas for a user across all projects seems good, i will introduce it in another bp after this.

Actually, quota classes also works for project user quotas as the project quotas do.

As you said per-user-quotas will add more complexity to the quotas system, so i'm considering to grant privileges to a 'project admin' role to manage the quotas of the users with in it, but it will not be done in this bp."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-08 16:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-05-04 14:42:01.000000000', 'message': 'Adds per-user-quotas support for more detailed quotas management

Implements blueprint per-user-quotas.

Based on the original quotas structure.

NOTE:
quota_instances, quota_cores, quota_ram, quota_key_pairs and
quota_security_groups are supported per user.

Add CRUD methods for user quotas API.

Add commands for user quotas management.

Change-Id: I24af1f6bc439d5d740303c6fe176a9bffe754579
'}, {'created': '2013-05-04 17:04:10.000000000', 'message': 'Adds per-user-quotas support for more detailed quotas management

Implements blueprint per-user-quotas.

Based on the original quotas structure.

NOTE:
quota_instances, quota_cores, quota_ram, quota_key_pairs and
quota_security_groups are supported per user.

Add CRUD methods for user quotas API.

Change-Id: I24af1f6bc439d5d740303c6fe176a9bffe754579
'}, {'created': '2013-05-07 01:18:25.000000000', 'message': 'Adds per-user-quotas support for more detailed quotas management

Implements blueprint per-user-quotas.

Fixes bug 968175

Based on the original quotas structure.

NOTE:
quota_instances, quota_cores, quota_ram, quota_key_pairs and
quota_security_groups are supported per user.

Add CRUD methods for user quotas API. DocImpact
 - Shows quotas for a user.
   GET v2/{tenant_id}/os-quota-sets/{tenant_id}?user_id={user_id}
 - Updates quotas for a user.
   POST v2/{tenant_id}/os-quota-sets/{tenant_id}

Add commands for user quotas management.
 - Show user quotas:
   nova-manage project quota --project <Project name> --user <User name>
 - Update/Create user quotas:
   nova-manage project quota --project <Project name> --user <User name>
   --key <key> --value <value>

Change-Id: I24af1f6bc439d5d740303c6fe176a9bffe754579

Add commands for project user quotas management.

   nova-manage project quota --project <Project name> --user <User name>

   nova-manage project quota --project <Project name> --user <User name>
   --key <key> --value <value>

commit_message:
Per-project-user-quotas for more granularity

Implements blueprint per-user-quotas.

Fixes bug 968175

Based on the original quotas structure.

NOTE:
quota_instances, quota_cores, quota_ram, quota_key_pairs and
quota_security_groups are supported per user.

Add CRUD methods for project user quotas API. DocImpact
 - Shows quotas for a user.
   GET v2/{tenant_id}/os-quota-sets/{tenant_id}?user_id={user_id}
 - Updates quotas for a user.
   POST v2/{tenant_id}/os-quota-sets/{tenant_id}?user_id={user_id}

Add commands for project user quotas management.
 - Show user quotas:
   nova-manage project quota --project <Project name> --user <User name>
 - Update/Create user quotas:
   nova-manage project quota --project <Project name> --user <User name>
   --key <key> --value <value>

Change-Id: I24af1f6bc439d5d740303c6fe176a9bffe754579

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-15 20:41:20.000000000', 'message': "Add ini_setting based custom types for configs

Previous configuration file management method used templates.
This method had limited flexibility and was cumbersome
to use and maintain between upstream versions.

This change introduces new custom types based on ini_setting:
  * swift_account_config: /etc/swift/account-server.conf
  * swift_bench_config: /etc/swift/swift-bench.conf
  * swift_config: /etc/swift/swift.conf
  * swift_container_config: /etc/swift/container-server.conf
  * swift_dispersion_config: /etc/swift/dispersion.conf
  * swift_object_config: /etc/swift/object-server.conf
  * swift_proxy_config: /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf

The use of ini_setting offers multiple advantages:
  * Ability to individually manage configuration settings without
    the need to modify templates. This allows the user to manage or
    override settings that aren't handled by the module.
  * Use upstream default values if none is provided.
  * Remove the need to maintain and synchronize templates
    to match upstream versions. Such maintenance could become
    problematic and complicated if multiple upstream versions
    are supported but have different base configuration files.

Implements: blueprint puppet-swift-ini-settings
Change-Id: Iba7be64581b81b8ab4f33cf7096df37e64ccc4b4
"}, {'created': '2013-07-25 14:20:31.000000000', 'message': "Add ini_setting based custom types for configs

    to match upstream versions. Such maintenance could become
    problematic and complicated if multiple upstream versions
    are supported but have different base configuration files.

Implements: blueprint puppet-swift-ini-settings
Change-Id: Iba7be64581b81b8ab4f33cf7096df37e64ccc4b4
"}]
commit_message:
Add ini_setting based custom types for configs

Previous configuration file management method used templates.
This method had limited flexibility and was cumbersome
to use and maintain between upstream versions.

This change introduces new custom types based on ini_setting:
  * swift_account_config: /etc/swift/account-server.conf
  * swift_bench_config: /etc/swift/swift-bench.conf
  * swift_config: /etc/swift/swift.conf
  * swift_container_config: /etc/swift/container-server.conf
  * swift_dispersion_config: /etc/swift/dispersion.conf
  * swift_object_config: /etc/swift/object-server.conf
  * swift_proxy_config: /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf

The use of ini_setting offers multiple advantages:
  * Ability to individually manage configuration settings without
    the need to modify templates. This allows the user to manage or
    override settings that aren't handled by the module.
  * Use upstream default values if none is provided.
  * Remove the need to maintain and synchronize templates
    to match upstream versions. Such maintenance could become
    problematic and complicated if multiple upstream versions
    are supported but have different base configuration files.

Implements: blueprint puppet-swift-ini-settings
Change-Id: Iba7be64581b81b8ab4f33cf7096df37e64ccc4b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 20:11:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix policy failure on image_metadata calls

Image metadata create/update/delete calls were not catching failures
returned by Glance and translating them into nice returns for API
callers.  Now ImageNotAuthorized failures are caught and passed back to
the caller as 403s.

bug 1204646

Change-Id: Ib9e451531d8102b6089e2cfc9be16d1bd635d59d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix policy failure on image_metadata calls

Image metadata create/update/delete calls were not catching failures
returned by Glance and translating them into nice returns for API
callers.  Now ImageNotAuthorized failures are caught and passed back to
the caller as 403s.

bug 1204646

Change-Id: Ib9e451531d8102b6089e2cfc9be16d1bd635d59d

commit_message:
Auto-document all resource types.

There are separate pages for OpenStack, AWS and Rackspace resources.

Currently the following sources are used for resource type documentation:
- the docstring for the resource class
- properties_schema
- attributes_schema

Change-Id: I901d227e8bc2a7209f216b57653da77a4f500e47

commit_message:
Sphinx extension to generate resource documentation.

Implements a resourcepages directive which generates resource type
documentation for any type that matches the specified type prefix.

For example:
.. resourcepages:: OS::

Implements blueprint generate-resource-docs

Change-Id: I3b2c94a766686e17e2bdbe8be27657decd65bb3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-21 01:13:53.000000000', 'message': 'Unify _commit_puts for accounts and containers

The _commit_puts method is exactly the same in AccountBroker and
ContainerBroker, except for what it puts on the the list. This seems
to be easy to factor out without victimizing the code clarity unduly.

We also factor common checking for LockTimeout: not so much for
any code savings, but to underscore that all these little segments
really are the same, so a reader does not need to prove uniformity
every time.

Change-Id: Idf9b553a3cf28de3c8803aaa47cf9a2be6817f00

It seems to be easy to factor out without victimizing the code

commit_message:
Unify _commit_puts for accounts and containers

The _commit_puts method is exactly the same in AccountBroker and
ContainerBroker, except for what it puts on the list pending records.
It seems to be easy to factor out without victimizing the code
clarity unduly.

We also factor common checking for LockTimeout: not so much for
any code savings, but to underscore that all these little segments
really are the same, so a reader does not need to prove uniformity
every time.

Change-Id: Idf9b553a3cf28de3c8803aaa47cf9a2be6817f00

commit_message:
Enable service validate-template for hot template

Get `Resources' and `Description' for hot or cfn template instead of
the raw one.

Change-Id: I54ac8a9905634529b641fe322eee4c10e587bac3
Fixes: bug #1204061

I do not agree with the namespace used to define such package.

I feel the problem we are trying to address is broader and require more thinking/planning as we will face the same issue with linuxbridge and other plugins. I don't want to see a multiplication of *_core.pp in the global namespace of the module.

I would prefer something under quantum::plugins::ovs. I'll have to think about it."}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-07-26 00:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I would like to have more time to think for a better plan.

You can however still define the package in the agent class and wrapping it with "if defined(Package['quantum-plugin-ovs'])" to avoid resource conflicts. quantum::plugins::ovs would need to be updated as well with if defined.'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-07-26 00:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Define quantum-plugin-ovs package resource for ovs agent and plugin.

deploying ovs agent on rhel 6.4 fails with a Could not find resource
'Package[quantum-plugin-ovs]' for relationship on 'Quantum_plugin_ovs[OVS/local_ip]' on node.
This fix only defined the resource if not defined already.

Change-Id: Iedf8a607915f65b7a8cf7af99749b9b65cba7bd9

commit_message:
Allow to clear extra routes from router

Ensure that we can handle None field for routes as no
neutron client has the ability to clear arbitrary
fields.

Some refactoring for the unit tests is done to reduce
duplication.

Fixes bug #1193143

Change-Id: I067e70ee87354e50a5a7d91c383449464bb33eb0

Not sure how I missed this commit, but asserts are useful to "assert" the state the code expects.  Can you point me at the talks about the use of assert that describes it as a problem?'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-25 23:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi peter, there're some links I search in Google before submit this patch. With those, my personal thought is: assert should not be used to verify common mistakes, like variable value, but should be used to check some "should never happen" problems. 

I think "should never happen" is something leak memory leak or some outside problems. An example is that keeping 'assert' is 'assert os.path.exist(path)', a usage for assert a file is not removed by outside. I think this is ok. But the assert in this patch is used checking variable value. 

The problems is if this is a necessary checking here, this will be lost in -O flag of running python. IMO, here looks like a conman value checking not an outside case, so I use raise instead of assert.'}]

commit_message:
remove assert syntax

assert is not a good tool for checking common mistakes, but could be
used test conditions that `should never happen` (there're many talks
about it)

Change-Id: Iccf9710008293465bb9bb59e65f0ed77d7910688

commit_message:
Fix failing network manager unit tests

* Instance uuid was not returned by the mocked methods of some
  network manager unit tests causing them to fail with KeyError.

Fixes bug #1204810

Change-Id: Iee04872ea954c2c59b1bf24e7cb0058c59ae8a84

[{'created': '2013-07-25 18:22:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix leaky network tests

`test_networks.py:test_validate_instance_zone_for_dns_domain` was setting a
config in a way such that it could leak to other tests: using CONF.foo instead
of self.flags(foo=X).

This would cause other tests to break in non-determinstic ways, hence it
landing in trunk (order of tests running mattered!).

The test succeeds with the line removed, meaning it was probably only relevant
in an earlier version of the code, so the solution is to remove it.

Fixes bug 1205034

Change-Id: Iaa143a215e285d9b97c10d81bd9916ed3feeb04b
'}, {'created': '2013-07-25 18:26:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix leaky network tests

config in a way such that it could leak to other tests: using CONF.foo instead
of self.flags(foo=X).

This would cause other tests to break in non-determinstic ways, hence it
landing in trunk (order of tests running mattered!).

The test succeeds with the line removed, meaning it was probably only relevant
in an earlier version of the code, so the solution is to remove it.

Fixes bug 1205034

Change-Id: Iaa143a215e285d9b97c10d81bd9916ed3feeb04b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix leaky network tests

`test_networks.py:test_validate_instance_zone_for_dns_domain` was setting a
config in a way such that it could leak to other tests: using CONF.foo instead
of self.flags(foo=X).

This would cause other tests to break in non-determinstic ways, hence it
landing in trunk (order of tests running mattered!).

The test succeeds with the line removed, meaning it was probably only relevant
in an earlier version of the code, so the solution is to remove it.

Fixes bug 1205034

Change-Id: Iaa143a215e285d9b97c10d81bd9916ed3feeb04b

[{'created': '2013-07-15 21:24:15.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Pass string arguments to popen

The current BitTorrent code was passing integer arguments to `make_subprocess`
which would in turn pass those to `popen`. This would cause a failure because
the semantics of the underlying `execve` function is to only accept a list of
strings.

The solution is to cast the arguments to a string before passing them into
`make_subrpocess`.

Fixes bug 1201594

Change-Id: I8372795ca032420641c449cb07bb47f9252ff4ef
'}, {'created': '2013-07-17 22:08:01.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Pass string arguments to popen

The current BitTorrent code was passing integer arguments to `make_subprocess`
which would in turn pass those to `popen`. This would cause a failure because
the semantics of the underlying `execve` function is to only accept a list of
strings.

The solution is to cast the arguments to a string before passing them into
`make_subrpocess`.

Fixes bug 1201594

Change-Id: I8372795ca032420641c449cb07bb47f9252ff4ef
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Pass string arguments to popen

The current BitTorrent code was passing integer arguments to `make_subprocess`
which would in turn pass those to `popen`. This would cause a failure because
the semantics of the underlying `execve` function is to only accept a list of
strings.

The solution is to cast the arguments to a string before passing them into
`make_subrpocess`.

Fixes bug 1201594

Change-Id: I8372795ca032420641c449cb07bb47f9252ff4ef

commit_message:
Skip RSA generation during tests

Use a static key in Rackspace cloud server tests, to remove the overhead
of the SSH keys generation.

Change-Id: Ief14f034fb86e42ecbb801b9d4f82ff27fb35588

commit_message:
Update nova configuration doc to use notify_on_state_change

notify_on_any_change option is covered by notify_on_state_change option

Change-Id: I562addea5c1ac1ce0450c24dac16524427a40624
