'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (12 inline comments)

I have only a question about what kind of service providers we are supporting now.
It seems that anything which is not in the configuration file gets disabled.
Also, the API is readonly, so I cannot define any service provider beyond the ones in the config file.
Finally, the config file specifies only 'default' service types (or the variable 'default_serviceprovider_opts' is misspelled).

It might be ok for me to keep the API read-only, even if I personally like giving admins the ability of managing the system with API other than just config files.

However, if we store all the service providers in the configuration, it might be worth asking ourselves whether we want to keep the db code or get rid of it. We can cache the values read by the config file in memory (this will work easily even with multiple instances of quantum-server), and you won't have to worry about enabling/disabling records which are not in sync with the configuration file"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (5 inline comments)

Eugene,
thanks for addressing the commnents.

For more discussion we can either use gerrit or IRC.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-07-08 17:30:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 27: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Discussion about DB vs In-memory approach is in this doc.
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1v0nLTEsFOwWeYpYjpw4qe3QHB5lLZEE_b0TmmR5b7ic/edit#slide=id.gefc32ecf_00

I'm still not sure this patch is safe for Act-Act configuration. Also IMO, storing immutable information in the DB is bad design. Choosing bad design because of ease of implementation should be avoided.

If we can implement fully db-based implementation in havana, I would like to +2 for this patch. However, if it cannot be in havana, I'm -1 for this patch."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-09 17:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

I have added some more comments to that google presentation, which in my opinion does not do a great job in collaborative editing.

Etherpad anyone?'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-09 23:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Do not merge

While there is a pressure to get this to land this week,  I do not want to cram code in H2 because the calendar.  There are too many pieces of information floating in too many places to adequately review and consider this change.  The linked spec does not seem to match up with the code that has been submitted.  

In terms of the proposal at hand, storing configuration values in the database is not good from a deployment perspective especially those who manage configuration via Chef or Puppet.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-10 13:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-10 13:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Works for me

implements blueprint service-type-framework-cleanup

that admins provide in configuration.
* ServiceType entity which maps to ServiceOfferings in new terms
is removed for now.

Not adding migration since service types were not used in grizzly.

commit_message:
Service Type Framework refactoring

implements blueprint service-type-framework-cleanup

* Defines logic and API for ServiceProvider - read-only entity
that admins provide in configuration and which is stored in memory
* ServiceType entity which maps to ServiceOfferings in new terms
is removed for now.
* Routed service insertion fixed to not to refer to service providers.
* In case configuration changes and some service providers are removed
then the resources must be cleanup in a special way (undeploy logical
resources). This is a matter of future work
* Add migration.

Change-Id: I400ad8f544ec8bdc7d2efb597c995f284ff05829

Yes, sorry for messing up the change id. Now I know how to keep it up.  I will be working on the test failures. Seems there are some test cases where I have to update according to my patch.'}, {'account_id': 7025, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Updating relevant test cases.'}, {'account_id': 7025, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for all the comments. I mostly reflected them on a new patch. However, one thing I would like to discuss is about the desired default MTU size of veth interfaces. I think since the current code uses a tagging mechanism for both 'flat' and 'vlan' network type, the default MTU size of veth interfaces (that are used for allowing traffic between two OVS bridges: br-int and br-ethxx) should be 1504 rather than 1500. So other than this different default MTU size, I believe I corrected all the problems that the initial patch had. Please let me know if I am missing something here."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 161, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Michael: Ah, got it, my mistake. Thank you for the clarification!'}, {'account_id': 161, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

This all looks good syntactically, but I have a question about functionality. I've attempted to replicate this by manually changing the MTU of the bridge devices, specifically:

594 int_veth.link.set_mtu(self.veth_mtu)
595 phys_veth.link.set_mtu(self.veth_mtu)

By running:

ip link set br-tun mtu 9000 && ip link set br-int mtu 9000

But, if you want to use a larger MTU on the VMs for internal traffic, don't you also need to set the MTU on every veth device in the chain? Specifically the tap device, the port on the integration bridge and the tenant bridge device?

For example, from brctl show:
bridge name	bridge id		STP enabled	interfaces
br-int		0000.c2917091334b	no		qvoc02e4a90-de

qbrc02e4a90-de		8000.da37849a432b	no		qvbc02e4a90-de
							tapc02e4a90-de

The traffic from the VM to the tunnel bridge would flow as follows:

VM -> tapc02e4a90-de -> qbrc02e4a90-de -> qvbc02e4a90-de/br-int -> patch-tun/patch-int -> br-tun.

I would expect fragmentation to occur (and frames > the default 1500 to be negated) if any link along the way has a lower MTU. I could be completely wrong (which is why I'm simply bringing it up for discussion or to be corrected), but I mention it because I've not been able to get MTUs larger than the default 1500 to work."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I have tested without your patch:

vm# ping -s 1472 10.0.1.10 -c 1

PING 10.0.1.10 (10.0.1.10): 1472 data bytes
1480 bytes from 10.0.1.10: seq=0 ttl=64 time=13.263 ms

@Kevin

The specific functionality is to be able to modify the veth patch ports set up between the integration bridge and any external network bridges. When using flat mode or vlan mode for the ovs plugin, you would loose 4 bytes of data because the plugin added the vlan tag. This patch is _only_ for the veth ports, it doesn't include bridge, tap or anything else."}, {'account_id': 4912, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@gongysh

The exact steps to replicate the problem are documented in the bug fairly well I think. If you want to see the bug in action, follow the bug's setup, then provision a VM and ssh to it. You will see that the session appears to work fine, until you do something that causes the packet size to fill up the whole 1500 MTU. Ie. cat a big file or something, after that your session is forever screwed up. The reason being that we add a vlan tag for any packets coming from the VM's tap. The code that adds the VLAN tag in openvswitch just moves the payload over 4 bytes and adds in the 802.1q header. This results in a transmission unit of 1504 bytes. Since the MTUs are 1500 everywhere, you loose the last 4 bytes. Let me know if I am being unclear and I can explain further."}, {'account_id': 4912, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: No score

@gongysh

How interesting, the same test fails for me without increasing MTU on the veth. I think this indicates that the problem lies with the version of openvswitch we are using or possibly version of kernel we are using. Would you mind sharing your setup? We are currently:

OVS: 1.7.3
Kernel: 2.6.32-220.23.1.el6.x86_64'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

In order to find the exact failure point, you may use the following packet size between MTU 1500 and MTU 1504.

VM# ping -s 1472 gateway_IP

With the patch, you can see that the max size became up to 1518 with MTU 1504.

# tcpdump -e -vvv -ni phy-br-eth0.57  not arp
tcpdump: listening on phy-br-eth0.57, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 65535 bytes
13:04:59.536075 fa:16:3e:64:12:12 > 02:e0:52:aa:e8:01, ethertype 802.1Q (0x8100), length 1518: vlan 1, p 0, ethertype IPv4, (tos 0x0, ttl 64, id 0, offset 0, flags [DF], proto ICMP (1), length 1500)
    69.195.65.20 > 69.195.65.1: ICMP echo request, id 31493, seq 1, length 1480

For the same test, if you use MTU 1500, you cannot see any packet.

Now anther interesting test. You can see IP fragments with my patch when a larger packet than MTU is used, in the following. 

VM# ping -s 1476 gateway_IP

# tcpdump -e -vvv -ni phy-br-eth0.57  not arp
tcpdump: WARNING: phy-br-eth0.57: no IPv4 address assigned
tcpdump: listening on phy-br-eth0.57, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 65535 bytes
14:30:13.232099 fa:16:3e:64:12:12 > 02:e0:52:aa:e8:01, ethertype 802.1Q (0x8100), length 1518: vlan 1, p 0, ethertype IPv4, (tos 0x0, ttl 64, id 31805, offset 0, flags [+], proto ICMP (1), length 1500)
    69.195.65.20 > 69.195.65.1: ICMP echo request, id 33797, seq 1, length 1480
14:30:13.232115 fa:16:3e:64:12:12 > 02:e0:52:aa:e8:01, ethertype 802.1Q (0x8100), length 42: vlan 1, p 0, ethertype IPv4, (tos 0x0, ttl 64, id 31805, offset 1480, flags [none], proto ICMP (1), length 24)
    69.195.65.20 > 69.195.65.1: icmp

@gongysh	:

Well, per se, MTU is correlated to both layers of L2 (Ethernet) and L3 (IP) although I think all you said are mostly correct. 

Here is what I understand. When Ethernet was developed, it had a fixed size of Ethernet header. It didn't expect the Ethernet header size would change. However, the introduction of VLAN really changed the total Ethernet frame size due to the increased size of Ethernet header. The typical min and max of the Ethernet frame size ranges 64 and 1518 with MTU 1500. It means, at the Ethernet level (frame), with VLAN tag the max Frame size needs to be increased by increasing MTU size, i.e., the min and max range changes to 64 and 1522. That's why in general it is recommended to accordingly increase MTU size on physical switches for trunk ports where VLAN tags are added. You may refer to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.1Q."}, {'account_id': 7025, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Well, the diagrams are somewhat skewed. But I think you can guess which part belongs to what. Basically, I added the packet size info in every path between two entities (e.g., tap <--> [br-int]).'}, {'account_id': 7025, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7025, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Wow, sorry for being late in responding all those questions. Thanks Mike to answer for them. Seems there is confusion why this patch is related to the reported bug (bug/1075336). So let me try to give a clear problem description and why this patch resolves it.

Here is an entire path for packet flow (e.g., outgoing from a VM) with the patch.

(inf)          (bridge)        (inf)                      (inf)                   (bridge)         (inf)
tap---->[br-int]---->int_veth------->phy_veth ---->[phy-br]----> eth0
    1500         1504 (tag added)    1504                   1504              1500
* (inf) -> (interface)

There are two OVS bridges, [br-int] and [phy-br], and four interfaces in the diagram. Bridges can handle whatever size of packets.

1. A VM sends a packet of 1500 bytes to its tap interface.
2. The [br-int] OVS bridge receives the packet and applies an OVS flow of adding a VLAN tag before forwarding the received packet to an output port of int_veth. At this point, the packet that is received at int_veth has been increased to 1504 bytes. No truncation happens because the virtual Ethernet interface of int_veth has MTU=1504 with the patch.
3. The interface phy_veth receives the same tagged packet whose size is 1504.
4. The [phy-br] OVS bridge strips off the tag and forwards the stripped packet (now 1500 bytes) to a physical interface (eth0).

Without the patch:

(inf)          (bridge)        (inf)                      (inf)                   (bridge)         (inf)
tap---->[br-int]---->int_veth------->phy_veth ---->[phy-br]----> eth0
    1500         1504 (tag added)    1500!                   1500              1496!

1. When int_veth's MTU is 1500, the packet tagged by [br-int] is truncated down to 1500 bytes on int_veth. 
2. When [phy-br] bridge receives the truncated packet, it stripes off the VLAN tag and sends the striped packet (now 1496) to a physical interface.

I hope this helps you understand more clearly.

Thanks,

-Jun"}, {'account_id': 7025, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Allow OVS default veth MTU to be configured.

In some environments where a packet is dropped when a VLAN tag is
added to the packet, you need to increase the MTU size of veth
interfaces to 1504.

Fixes: bug #1075336
Change-Id: I4f03b4cdc571a462096d419d6dd8324cf096156b

[{'created': '2013-07-25 09:16:05.000000000', 'message': 'Verify if the RPC result is an instance of dict

The RPC client is currently assuming that all values returned from the
API are iterable. Since errors are always returned as dicts, this patch
verifies whether the returned value is an instance of dict before
checking for the existence of the _error key.

Fixes bug: #1204668

Change-Id: Ie953d7dd2d327334789d66f689a30ce5e36afba9
'}]
commit_message:
Verify if the RPC result is an instance of dict

The RPC client is currently assuming that all values returned from the
API are iterable. Since errors are always returned as dicts, this patch
verifies whether the returned value is an instance of dict before
checking for the existence of the _error key.

Fixes bug: #1204668

Change-Id: Ie953d7dd2d327334789d66f689a30ce5e36afba9

commit_message:
Allow confirm_resize if instance is in 'deleting' status

Deleting an instance puts it into 'deleting' task_state.
If the instance is in 'resized' vm_status, this tries a
confirm_resize on the instance. confirm_resize currently expects
the task_state to be None. It should instead expect
None/deleting task_state.

Fixes bug: 1189391

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py

Change-Id: I6a3f82eab9ed2242bfd38bc1ac760dbb4b3d8c4a
(cherry picked from commit 0fed513b695cd15aaca24d24926a1c7d13e63509)

[{'created': '2013-07-25 18:15:46.000000000', 'message': 'Handle Jenkins node already being added to Jenkins

If the devstack launch jobs timeout it is possible for some Jenkins
nodes to be in Jenkins but still marked as Building in the devstack gate
DB. Previously when this happened it caused the node to be deleted
possibly breaking any tests running on that node. Now if the node is
already in Jenkins ignore the error and allow the node to go into a
ready state.

Change-Id: Ib285f90f86bf79bab274b4e1a289284b0e5f30f9
'}]
commit_message:
Handle Jenkins node already being added to Jenkins

If the devstack launch jobs timeout it is possible for some Jenkins
nodes to be in Jenkins but still marked as Building in the devstack gate
DB. Previously when this happened it caused the node to be deleted
possibly breaking any tests running on that node. Now if the node is
already in Jenkins ignore the error and allow the node to go into a
ready state.

Change-Id: Ib285f90f86bf79bab274b4e1a289284b0e5f30f9

commit_message:
Passing the error message as keyword argument

as expected by the base exception class
(OpenstackException) which does not accept
any positional arguments

Fixes: bug #1204321
Change-Id: I320807f6f629fc337a612ad2f9c55ae2c156cfd9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 19:30:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix iptables rules when metadata_host=127.0.0.1

When metadata_host is set to 127.0.0.1 metdata_forward will use the
REDIRECT target instead of the DNAT target in iptables rules. The
REDIRECT target results in an implicit DNAT to the primary address
of the incoming interface. As a result requests coming in from VMs

Fixes: bug #1202356

commit_message:
Fix iptables rules when metadata_host=127.0.0.1

When metadata_host is set to 127.0.0.1 metdata_forward will use the
REDIRECT target instead of the DNAT target in iptables rules. The
REDIRECT target results in an implicit DNAT to the primary address
of the incoming interface. As a result requests coming in from VMs
will have a destination address of the gateway brought up by
nova-network.

metadate_accept will now allow traffic destinatined for any local
address on the metadata_port when metadata_host is set to
127.0.0.1.

Change-Id: I877befe6f7c1020d2160194b6f6cab8297cb086c
Fixes: bug #1202356

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-25 15:51:57.000000000', 'message': "Swap the order of configparser imports

The configparser backport package has un-understood issues parsing
our files. But the intent of the code is to use whichever is the
package for the version of python in use. So, instead of trying to
install the python3 version first, which can also result in loading
the backport package, first try the python2 package, so that if
configparser itself is loaded, it will be because we're running python3.

Change-Id: I7ef497127822d0110804b04a674f24c195a07278
"}, {'created': '2013-07-25 16:07:15.000000000', 'message': "Swap the order of configparser imports

The configparser backport package has un-understood issues parsing
our files. But the intent of the code is to use whichever is the
package for the version of python in use. So, instead of trying to
install the python3 version first, which can also result in loading
the backport package, first try the python2 package, so that if
configparser itself is loaded, it will be because we're running python3.

commit_message:
Swap the order of configparser imports

The configparser backport package has un-understood issues parsing
our files. But the intent of the code is to use whichever is the
package for the version of python in use. So, instead of trying to
install the python3 version first, which can also result in loading
the backport package, first try the python2 package, so that if
configparser itself is loaded, it will be because we're running python3.

Change-Id: I7ef497127822d0110804b04a674f24c195a07278

commit_message:
Install jeepyb and requirements from REPODIR

integration.sh already expects there to be a pbr source dir in
$REPODIR/pbr. If we pull jeepyb and requirements from the same place,
then we can gate them as wel as pbr.

Change-Id: Ie0eb513c2deade957d480a25dfba2c5486d14876

Additionally, we were trying to intsall pip 1.3 for a test but were not

Change-Id: I61b9b810e64b40ceccb5eb0f4b2ddc4faefd8e04

commit_message:
Stop trying to install old pip and setuptools

Now that pip 1.4 is out, setuptools<0.7 is invalid because 1.4 will not
install 'pre-release' software without being explicitly asked, and all
of the pre 0.7 setuptools releases have a letter in them. Just stop
trying to do it, because we actually don't use it anyway.

Additionally, we were trying to intsall pip 1.3 for a test but were not
installing that into the local mirror. Match them so that they're equal
and can install.

Change-Id: I61b9b810e64b40ceccb5eb0f4b2ddc4faefd8e04

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 23:17:46.000000000', 'message': "Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c
(cherry picked from commit 383ca6cf5ff9172a43339dbf845245fbdf2f8210)
"}]
commit_message:
Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c
(cherry picked from commit 383ca6cf5ff9172a43339dbf845245fbdf2f8210)

commit_message:
Prevent possible server list damage in BigSwitch plugin

The old failover logic for the BigSwitch plugin modified a
list of controllers as it tested them. If the code for one
thread unexpectedly raised an exception or died, the global
server list could lose a server permanently.
This patch addresses that by flagging servers as failed instead
so the global server list is never modified.

Fixes: bug #1200022

(cherry picked from commit 3732f022778a7c4a47c58029ae77e32a0a4a6ee9)

Conflicts:

	quantum/plugins/bigswitch/plugin.py

Change-Id: Id2dcb820ef9f62fd03e3215bff3345e56c78afe2

'}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2013-07-21 13:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As you say, 'dhcp_release' was not present in all distros. The default is false maybe more reliable.

I can't think up a reason why the default value is 'true' will be better."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-22 19:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

dhcp_release is now in all distros we are actively trying to support that I know of.  It was recently fixed in RHEL6 as per the linked bug.

Enabling force_dhcp_release allows for ip addresses to be recovered quicker, which is very useful.

Since we know red hat supports dhcp_release now, and everyone seems to agree it is useful (http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-July/011667.html)  I think this is a good candidate to enable by default'}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-07-22 23:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2013-07-23 02:46:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Tell the true, I would like the config default is 'true'.

But I test ubuntu 13.04, dhcp_release is not installed defaultly, Which means I should apt-get install dnsmasq-utils before install nova.

I think the config item is distro dependency. To match as much distro as possible, keep it to 'false' maybe good."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-23 04:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The example from Ubuntu only shows that when packaging they need to add this as a dependency, an easy issue to fix.  Limiting ourselves to defaults that are installed in a stock Linux distro is a strange requirement. The original reason this was false was there was no way to even install dhcp_release on rhel at one point.'}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2013-07-24 04:09:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ok, adding dnsmasq-utils into dependency sounds good.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-24 19:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 19:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Change force_dhcp_release default to True

Historically it was was false because it requires the dnsmasq binary
'dhcp_release' which was not present in all distros.

Related to bug 970893

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4975d85a66fb930d6a56900dd569cec2a1874439

commit_message:
Adds oslo.sphinx

Nova now has oslo.sphinx in its requirements. Propagates
this fact in this repo.

Change-Id: I7812d0ef15fa1543592093d95f377dedfcad7aec

commit_message:
adding aggregates panel to admin dashboard

This commit adds a new panel "Aggregates" to the admin panel in
the dashboard listing defined aggregates.

fixes bug #1197775

Change-Id: I19c00cf393844199acc1b0eb93e10c35099627a6

In this commit,  we will increase up to 60s.

commit_message:
Increase ping timeout on scenario testing

Some gating may fail because ping timeout is short (20s).
In this commit,  we will increase up to 60s.

- Added ping_timeout for compute config with default 60s
- Replaced hardcorded ssh timeout value with ssh_timeout

Fixes bug 1194026

Change-Id: If4e64aff17fc9aea1b6de03c684dff145ef5e6f2

commit_message:
xenapi: ensure vcpu_weight configured correctly

Currently the vcpu_weight specified by the flavor is only set after
the VM has started, and is not set during migrate_finish.

This changes moves the setting of the vcpu_weight to the same place
that other vCPU options are set, such as the number of vCPUs, during
the initial creation of the VM record.

Fixes bug 1203714
Change-Id: I475a247f1ac3153798e9e58d64700f8124dd2a95

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-21 10:11:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix volumes search by metadata

The metadata parameter is urlencoded (to string) by cinderclient
but isn't decoded back to dict by the API.

The metadata parameter needs to be converted back to dict
to be of any use by the filters parameter of get_all().

The original implementation has been done by:
Mathieu Gagne <mgagne@iweb.com>

Fixes: bug #1195015

Change-Id: I19d7d386afddddc067e9f4ef86967c9b72d9e530
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volumes search by metadata

The metadata parameter is urlencoded (to string) by cinderclient
but isn't decoded back to dict by the API.

The metadata parameter needs to be converted back to dict
to be of any use by the filters parameter of get_all().

The original implementation has been done by:
Mathieu Gagne <mgagne@iweb.com>

Fixes: bug #1195015

Change-Id: I19d7d386afddddc067e9f4ef86967c9b72d9e530

"}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-07-16 13:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 13:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37225/4/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/3425 : SUCCESS in 1m 24s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/37225/4/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/2230/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 20s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37225/4/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/3348 : SUCCESS in 29m 49s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37225/4/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/3354 : SUCCESS in 6m 21s
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:14:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

I don't think we want to port the existing migrations at all. We need to support upgrading systems that have run some (or all) of the existing migrations. Porting them to alembic will mean that the migration tool will try to run them again, which will either break the database or cause the upgrade to fail.

Instead of porting, let's just make sure that the old migrations run, and then alembic runs afterwards. Then we can, as a project, agree that we will not create new migrations using sqlalchemy-migrate, and switch to alembic. When we reach a point where we can deprecate the old migrations, we can delete them safely."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:17:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Actually existing installations should not break since system correctly determines current state and won't apply migrations if they are already applied."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Please refer to
def _fix_alembic_version_stamp(engine, current_version):
in migration.py for more details'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:42:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

It sounds like you're going to a lot of unnecessary work, though. Just configure alembic to store its history in a different table than sqlalchemy-migrate and then run them in order. There is no reason at all to rewrite the existing migrations."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-07-25 18:29:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Abandoned

As agreed old migrations won't be ported. We'll use alembic for new ones and old migrations will stay until the end of backward compatibility period"}]

commit_message:
Start using hacking 0.6

So we can start using new hacking 0.6 checks.

Since hacking 0.6 pins pep8, pyflakes and flake8 they can be removed
from test-requires. For any unfixed checks list them in tox.ini

Fix a H103, 'Header does not match Apache 2.0 License notice' that
leaked in

Change-Id: I652fe3270f1c37afdd386bfae7c4b27b6abcfa06

commit_message:
Setup password for root using variable 'DIB_PASSWORD'

Move ssh configuration for root login into 'root-passwd' element.

Fixes: bug #1199970

Change-Id: Iaac460394482651d8cb3d73dd924fcb600d3065c

subject: Add Fedora 19 support
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 15:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37500/1/check/gate-noop/3775 : SUCCESS in 0s
'}, {'account_id': 7555, 'date': '2013-07-17 21:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

FYI, moving the Hadoop install will not resolve the ldconfig issues. Adding a call to /sbin/ldconfig after installation should.

I was not able to build an F19 image with this patch, it failed in 99-up-to-date with -

Transaction check error:
  file /usr/bin from install of filesystem-3.2-13.fc19.x86_64 conflicts with file from package hadoop-1.1.2-1.x86_64
  file /usr/lib from install of filesystem-3.2-13.fc19.x86_64 conflicts with file from package hadoop-1.1.2-1.x86_64
  file /usr/lib64 from install of filesystem-3.2-13.fc19.x86_64 conflicts with file from package hadoop-1.1.2-1.x86_64
  file /usr/sbin from install of filesystem-3.2-13.fc19.x86_64 conflicts with file from package hadoop-1.1.2-1.x86_64

Because of a new filesystem RPM version. The proper solution to this is a patch to upstream Apache Hadoop to create an RPM that does not claim ownership of "/usr/bin" "/usr/lib" "/usr/lib64" or "/usr/sbin".

I'm not sure what an intermediate workaround is other than  hosting a patched RPM for use in image creation, similar to what is done for the swift jar.

-1 for setenforce 0

I'm not able to build an F18 image to verify the changes are otherwise legitimate (DIB_RELEASE=18 constructs an incorrect URL), but I have a feeling they should work.'}, {'account_id': 7555, 'date': '2013-07-17 21:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Missed one: -1 for setenforce and move of hadoop install to post-install.d'}, {'account_id': 7555, 'date': '2013-07-18 01:48:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, my # threads was too high earlier. I ran my eval of the patch w/o actually having the patch applied.

I see how the move to post-install.d is a viable workaround for the filesystem + hadoop conflict. We still need a patch sent upstream so we can eventually remove our workaround. I'm willing to file the JIRA for this, just say so.

I was able to successfully create an image, build a cluster from it and run dfsadmin -report and hadoop jar ... pi.

-1 still for setenforce 0, but otherwise looks good"}, {'account_id': 7732, 'date': '2013-07-18 11:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7555, 'date': '2013-07-18 12:32:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add Fedora 19 support

* Hadoop installation on Fedora 19
* setup Fedora 19 first-boot
* small fixes to ssh configuration

Fixes: bug #1201794

a UnicodeDecodeError and turn that into returning HTTPBadRequest. Now
get_param() just raises HTTPBadRequest directly, and the __call__
methods in the account/container/object servers catch and return

Change-Id: I2be96ef757d04bfd6af180cd9c92393c841db21f

This lets us get rid of some really repetitive exception conversion

a UnicodeDecodeError and turn that into returning HTTPBadRequest. Now
get_param() just raises HTTPBadRequest directly, and the __call__
methods in the account/container/object servers catch and return
it. All that "except UnicodeDecodeError" stuff goes away.

Refactored the path splitting and device validation in the object

Change-Id: I2be96ef757d04bfd6af180cd9c92393c841db21f
'}]
commit_message:
Catch swob responses that are raised.

This lets us get rid of some really repetitive exception conversion
code, like everybody that called common.utils.get_param() had to catch
a UnicodeDecodeError and turn that into returning HTTPBadRequest. Now
get_param() just raises HTTPBadRequest directly, and the __call__
methods in the account/container/object servers catch and return
it. All that "except UnicodeDecodeError" stuff goes away.

Refactored the path splitting and device validation in the object
server too.

There are other things that can benefit from this as well, but this
patch is big enough.

Change-Id: I2be96ef757d04bfd6af180cd9c92393c841db21f

commit_message:
fix name 'update_volume_status' to 'update_volume_stats'

_update_volume_status() private method is called by
get_volume_stats(). This is confusing as the volume's
stats and not status gets updated.

fixes bug #1199327

Change-Id: I9f7971e457250798320c14d3f58bdc199c8cfceb

commit_message:
Make tenant_network_mask_bits default setting consistent

tenant_network_mask_bits in the sample config is 29, but
in the config.py it is 28.

According to the bug report the 28 is the desired value.

Fixing bug 1105199

Change-Id: I45e73dc436bd6aea109c1be934bc7de2d950ef2b

commit_message:
API for Modify User Attributes - username, host, password

At present, when a Cloud Database user creates a username, password and hostname for a database user,
he does not have the ability to modify these user attributes.
This API enables the Cloud DB user to make changes to one or more of these user attributes (username,hostname,password).
These changes are in the troveclient to enable simple command line requests

Implements: blueprint modify-userattributes

Change-Id: I0887f2d927eec8c77c0f562c9d855a370591231a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-20 21:14:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix volumes search by metadata

The metadata param is urlencoded (to string) by python-cinderclient
but isn't decoded back to dict by Cinder.

If the actual state of python-cinderclient is preserved and
a fix applied to Cinder, it would require other Cinder client
implementations to serialize and urlencode a map structure using
a pythonic serialization which isn't reasonable.

This change proposes a new cross-language compatible syntax to search
by metadata: metadata[key]=value

This change does not break backward compatibility as this feature
has never worked in the past.

Fixes: bug #1195015
Change-Id: I464ef270126cf8a85e23bbfab1a38c42a3ab5caa
"}, {'created': '2013-07-20 21:21:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix volumes search by metadata

by metadata: metadata[key]=value

Fixes: bug #1195015
Change-Id: I464ef270126cf8a85e23bbfab1a38c42a3ab5caa
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volumes search by metadata

The metadata param is urlencoded (to string) by python-cinderclient
but isn't decoded back to dict by Cinder.

If the actual state of python-cinderclient is preserved and
a fix applied to Cinder, it would require other Cinder client
implementations to serialize and urlencode a map structure using
a pythonic serialization which isn't reasonable.

This change proposes a new cross-language compatible syntax to search
by metadata: metadata[key]=value

This change does not break backward compatibility as this feature
has never worked in the past.

Fixes: bug #1195015
Change-Id: I464ef270126cf8a85e23bbfab1a38c42a3ab5caa

[{'created': '2013-06-26 20:42:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix volumes search by metadata

The metadata parameter is urlencoded (to string) by cinderclient
but isn't decoded back to dict by the API.

The metadata parameter needs to be converted back to dict
to be of any use by the filters parameter of get_all().

Fixes: bug #1195015
Change-Id: I1ebc44cc6b6adb4482232d42d3375f68322a2066
"}, {'created': '2013-06-27 00:34:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix volumes search by metadata

The metadata parameter is urlencoded (to string) by cinderclient
but isn't decoded back to dict by the API.

The metadata parameter needs to be converted back to dict
to be of any use by the filters parameter of get_all().

Fixes: bug #1195015
Change-Id: I1ebc44cc6b6adb4482232d42d3375f68322a2066
"}, {'created': '2013-07-20 20:37:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix volumes search by metadata

The metadata param is urlencoded (to string) by python-cinderclient
but isn't decoded back to dict by Cinder.

If the actual state of python-cinderclient is preserved and
a fix applied to Cinder, it would require other Cinder client
implementations to serialize and urlencode a map structure using
a pythonic serialization which isn't reasonable.

This change proposes a new cross-language compatible syntax to search
by metadata: metadata[key]=value

This change does not break backward compatibility as this feature
has never worked in the past.

python-cinderclient will have to be updated to use the new syntax.

Fixes: bug #1195015
Change-Id: I1ebc44cc6b6adb4482232d42d3375f68322a2066
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volumes search by metadata

The metadata param is urlencoded (to string) by python-cinderclient
but isn't decoded back to dict by Cinder.

If the actual state of python-cinderclient is preserved and
a fix applied to Cinder, it would require other Cinder client
implementations to serialize and urlencode a map structure using
a pythonic serialization which isn't reasonable.

This change proposes a new cross-language compatible syntax to search
by metadata: metadata[key]=value

This change does not break backward compatibility as this feature
has never worked in the past.

python-cinderclient will have to be updated to use the new syntax.

Fixes: bug #1195015
Change-Id: I1ebc44cc6b6adb4482232d42d3375f68322a2066

commit_message:
Fix the is_volume_backed_instance check

Changing the check for volume backed instance to handle instances with
no root_device_name

Fixes LP bug #1197237

Change-Id: If0e2dff98a55ed1addf8a010849389f85db427f6

commit_message:
Refactored impl_mongodb to use full connection url

Host parameter can be a full URI see:
http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/connection-string/

This allows to set replicaSet config and other options in the connection
URL without the need to have additional config values

Replaced deprecated pymongo.Connection with pymongo.MongoClient

Change-Id: I1aea1d8a48dc1bec717e7d1fbe256e2887e27039

commit_message:
calling distinct on _id field against a collection is slow

To optimize the code, distinct method should be avoided especially
against _id field. Sort should also be done on the server side to
take advantage of generator to avoid using up memory for large
data set.

Change-Id: Ib417f73e2238a5d9865a2a1a9990e891b0f7a24c
fixes: bug #1204607
fixes: bug #1204609

[{'created': '2013-07-25 16:12:50.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Add validation of available_zone during instance create"

This reverts commit aada048b165c2ca70a986b4adf1a635b05025992.

Specifying an availability zone is controlled by policy.  This new code
does not take that into account and does this validation before the
policy is checked.  It should do the validation *after* checking the
policy.

Change-Id: I05ff5c63acae09a67564af778b2dc135968e8883
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add validation of available_zone during instance create"

This reverts commit aada048b165c2ca70a986b4adf1a635b05025992.

Specifying an availability zone is controlled by policy.  This new code
does not take that into account and does this validation before the
policy is checked.  It should do the validation *after* checking the
policy.

Change-Id: I05ff5c63acae09a67564af778b2dc135968e8883

[{'created': '2013-07-25 09:37:54.000000000', 'message': "Always convert AllowedValues to a list

Passing e.g. a string as the AllowedValues list can appear to work, since
str.__contains__() performs a substring match. It's better to fail fast, so
convert AllowedValues to a list regardless of its initial type.

Change-Id: I74783e6a7c1743ead3f086116dd3850afeb7a028
"}]
commit_message:
Always convert AllowedValues to a list

Passing e.g. a string as the AllowedValues list can appear to work, since
str.__contains__() performs a substring match. It's better to fail fast, so
convert AllowedValues to a list regardless of its initial type.

Change-Id: I74783e6a7c1743ead3f086116dd3850afeb7a028

commit_message:
Add Oren Katz (Alcatel-Lucent)

Oren is not an OpenStack developer, but he is heading a team at
Alcatel-Lucent that is considering OpenStack for their CloudBand
platform. Oren contributes interesting thoughts and insights
into OpenStack from the perspective of a large, established telco.

Change-Id: I13be4a12838ad460ec468e84b7e3944989d8cd69

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 18:32:16.000000000', 'message': 'Improve EC2 API error responses.

Implements blueprint ec2-error-codes

Proper EC2 error codes are returned where possible.

Redundant logging code was united in new ec2_error_ex() helper function
and all standard EC2 error responses are now uniformly logged on DEBUG
log level because they are just responses to invalid client requests,
not nova errors. New unit tests are provided.

Unexpected client/server errors are logged on ERROR/CRITICAL level and
their exception name is used as error code - no more useless
UnknownError. Error descriptions are supressed for unexpected server
errors as they might contain sensitive information.

EC2APIError was removed and replaced by specific exceptions. New EC2
exceptions were introduced with ec2_code attribute.

Change-Id: I79a57e0ac4aa10d38b43e8d44677b9af8543b917
'}]
commit_message:
Improve EC2 API error responses.

Implements blueprint ec2-error-codes

Proper EC2 error codes are returned where possible.

Redundant logging code was united in new ec2_error_ex() helper function
and all standard EC2 error responses are now uniformly logged on DEBUG
log level because they are just responses to invalid client requests,
not nova errors. New unit tests are provided.

Unexpected client/server errors are logged on ERROR/CRITICAL level and
their exception name is used as error code - no more useless
UnknownError. Error descriptions are supressed for unexpected server
errors as they might contain sensitive information.

EC2APIError was removed and replaced by specific exceptions. New EC2
exceptions were introduced with ec2_code attribute.

Change-Id: I79a57e0ac4aa10d38b43e8d44677b9af8543b917

I don't think this is the best way to split the patch what. I would suggest is to split it in such a way that:

* Moving code around and into common places - 1 patch.
* Add the functionality (new attribute on exceptions etc) - 2nd patch
* Change the behavior of the API to use new code and codes.

I realize this will cause some redundant code in the interrim patches - but I feel reviewers need to see the API changing code separate from refactoring."}, {'account_id': 6717, 'date': '2013-07-25 14:50:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Refactoring part of patch:

https://review.openstack.org/38642'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 18:32:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix and unify EC2 API error response generation.

Implements blueprint ec2-error-codes

EC2 API client and server errors now use the same function ec2_error_response
to generate EC2 error response.

Fault wrapper no longer returns HTTP status code as an EC2 error code which
was a ridiculously incorrect behaviour. Instead, it now uses ec2_code
exception attribute if present or exception name otherwise.

This is a basis for a fix of current terrible exception handling code.

Change-Id: I0599c8cf8308c892e5245b3698a3f4f90a3f81af
'}]
commit_message:
Fix and unify EC2 API error response generation.

Implements blueprint ec2-error-codes

EC2 API client and server errors now use the same function ec2_error_response
to generate EC2 error response.

Fault wrapper no longer returns HTTP status code as an EC2 error code which
was a ridiculously incorrect behaviour. Instead, it now uses ec2_code
exception attribute if present or exception name otherwise.

This is a basis for a fix of current terrible exception handling code.

Change-Id: I0599c8cf8308c892e5245b3698a3f4f90a3f81af

commit_message:
Remove useless jquery.tweet.js

This file exports a jQuery tweet function, but it's never called anywhere in
the theme.

Change-Id: Ie5191940a8e9dc3e2562888d050cd00dc63066d8

(1 inline comment)

I am giving you a -1 because I am an evil guy I love picking on you!

Even if the Nicira plugin does not use host_id, there is still a database table being used by this extension and so either add the nicira plugin to the supported plugin in the related migration (https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/176a85fc7d79_add_portbindings_db.py) or define a new migration (just like the one linked above) for the NVP plugin only.

The former solution would work for release-to-release upgrade; the latter would work for trunk chasers too.

We are not mandating yet consistency in db migration for trunk chasers, so it's up to you."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Dr Evil, now that you bring the issue to my attention, there are a number of plugins that support this extension, but only two that show up in the migration, so what shall I push another patch, i.e. add plugins to "port-binding migration"? commit_message:
Add support to the port binding extension for the NVP plugin.

Also, this patch removes the non-serializable object for
port profile. This went undetected for quite some time.

Implements blueprint nvp-port-binding-extension

Change-Id: I380570f08e92f75d6431dcda6fac2a770887bb48

commit_message:
Simulate image_locations table in simple/api.py

Currently the simple/api.py does not implement any 'image_locations'
related actions as in sqlalchemy/api.py. Actions like image_create/
image-update etc in simple/api.py does not look at making appropriate
changes in the image_locations table as it does in sqlalchemy/api.py

Change-Id: Ifae710d3d820225218ba72d7a16652b03b64a24f
Fixes: Bug #1202985

commit_message:
fix name 'recon_container' to 'rcache'

self.recon_container is called before assigned. Accounding the context
codes, this is used to store somehing like self.rcache. So I guess the
name of 'recon_container' is a mistake, and change it to 'rcache'
(we could look at other places using dump_recon_cache)

Also add unit tests

fixes bug #1201958

Change-Id: I3a6e3d22ba1dbffc4309bc22ff37873b4a3f09b3

commit_message:
Add service restart function in oslo-incubator

Add signal handler of SIGHUP and restart function for service to restart.

It depends on blueprint cfg-reload-config-files of oslo.config.

Implements blueprint service-restart

Change-Id: Ib68fc5fb6038c4855d35464573c8866776493f6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 20:54:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix image reference in basic-install.

When renaming Quantum to Neutron and moving an impacted shared image to
"common" it looks like the relative path used to refer to it wasn't
quite right. I have updated it to go down the additional level in the
directory structure and the book now builds.

Change-Id: I116e9d74ffd5ec2ced17f1168ccc22a22305799e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix image reference in basic-install.

When renaming Quantum to Neutron and moving an impacted shared image to
"common" it looks like the relative path used to refer to it wasn't
quite right. I have updated it to go down the additional level in the
directory structure and the book now builds.

Change-Id: I116e9d74ffd5ec2ced17f1168ccc22a22305799e

[{'created': '2013-07-24 13:49:06.000000000', 'message': 'Bug # 1199853 - Add libvirt_vif_driver setting for OVS Bridge.

Added the libvirt_vif_driver setting for use with the OVS plug-in to the
nova.conf file provided in the guide. This setting is required for OVS
networking to function correctly, as the guide does not attempt to use
the linux bridge plug-in no alternative required.

Change-Id: I6f09068efcf11232c8a9ca064c56eeb207d11f7b
Fixes: 1199853
'}, {'created': '2013-07-24 21:02:13.000000000', 'message': 'Bug # 1199853 - Add libvirt_vif_driver setting for OVS Bridge.

Added the libvirt_vif_driver setting for use with the OVS plug-in to the
nova.conf file provided in the guide. This setting is required for OVS
networking to function correctly, as the guide does not attempt to use
the linux bridge plug-in no alternative required.

Change-Id: I6f09068efcf11232c8a9ca064c56eeb207d11f7b

commit_message:
Bug # 1199853 - Add libvirt_vif_driver setting for OVS Bridge.

Added the libvirt_vif_driver setting for use with the OVS plug-in to the
nova.conf file provided in the guide. This setting is required for OVS
networking to function correctly, as the guide does not attempt to use
the linux bridge plug-in no alternative required.

Change-Id: I6f09068efcf11232c8a9ca064c56eeb207d11f7b
Fixes: 1199853

commit_message:
Teach ScalingPolicy and Restarter to create signed urls

This is so they will be able to support ceilometer webhooks

blueprint watch-ceilometer
Change-Id: I18b0dc22f95957a66f2287a7bd70613c8c8db3d6

Ummm, shouldn't we also add requests to requirements.txt?"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-07-25 12:03:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Zane, it's being picked up by transitive dependency from the python clients we import

python-cinderclient/requirements.txt:requests>=1.1,<1.2.3
python-keystoneclient/requirements.txt:requests>=0.8.8
python-novaclient/requirements.txt:requests>=0.8

Note that there a bug people are working on:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1182271

So i did not want to add one explicitly in heat..."}]

Fixes LP# 1201534

commit_message:
Replace urllib2 with requests in urlfetch module

simple replacement of urllib2.urlopen with requests.get

Fixes LP# 1201534

Change-Id: Ia0a2ed3b092e22246339a42f432086dd05f788fa

'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-07-11 01:23:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

For the record I still hate the idea of changing names/id's around.  I really think it's extremely convoluted and that we're just asking for trouble down the road.

That being said, the -1 is actually because I stole your migration ID... sorry.  You'll have to bump.

I'd really like to get input from others, it seems you and I were the only ones really active on the etherpad, so maybe I'm making a bigger deal out of this than I should."}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2013-07-11 02:33:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Looks well thought out and complete! I wish we could support snaps in some way, but I'm sure that would be much harder for some drivers than others."}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-07-11 10:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

Response to Ben inline.

John: Note that what's in the code is MUCH simpler than what I suggested in the etherpad.  The etherpad solution has changes to the API and all sorts of other places - this is all contained within some small DB changes.  IMO it is not only simpler, but also safer.  And please don't make a habit of stealing my miration IDs ;)"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-07-11 11:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-11 11:57:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Doesn't seem to work

Avishay, nicely done! Your patch looks good to me.  Just few nits."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-07-23 13:51:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Couple of things inline, also something to think about.  Migration really is sort of a special case of clone, not sure why we can't leverage that more or at least meld the two together a bit more.

Also related to that note, why not utilize snapshots for the migration process and limit the down-time on the volume?  This will also help eliminate the "must be in available state" limitation.

Finally, not sure if you changed it last night or I just didn't notice it again this morning, but keep in mind that name and description are optional.  You can't rely on the name in particular, and rather than getting Null and moving it around it would probably be better to just check it and behave accordingly if it's Null.'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-07-23 15:57:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-07-23 16:21:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

Zhiteng: I have addressed your comments.  You mentioned that I was sending the RPC to the destination cinder-volume, but from what I see it's the source.  I do send the destination host as a parameter, so maybe that was confusing?

John: I made the driver's copy_volume_data function a bit more generic, so that it can be used for a cross-backend version of clone in the future. And we will keep the snapshot idea in our minds for the future as well.

Thanks everyone for the input!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 16:49:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Doesn't seem to work

[{'created': '2013-06-14 13:44:32.000000000', 'message': "Migration for detached volumes.

This is a first draft of migration for detached volumes (WIP).

What's missing?
1. Waiting on the attach/detach brick code (there is a log message
in volume/manager.py where it will be called).
2. Tests.
3. I'm unsure if the volume should go into an error state if migration
failed, as the volume is perfectly usable. On the other hand, do we
expect the admin to check if the volume moved to determine success or
failure? Other options?
4. Migrating snapshots.
5. Note that volumes can now be moved and separated from their
snapshots. Backends will need to deal with this.

Change-Id: Ib6fcf27051f45e60aa3ba5f599e88c1421db753e
Implements: bp volume-migration

'}, {'created': '2013-07-02 11:39:42.000000000', 'message': "Migration for detached volumes with no snaps.

Implementation of volume migration for detached volumes with no
snapshots. Migration is initiated by an admin API. The scheduler
confirms that the specified destination host can accept the
volume. The source and destination drivers are given the opportunity
to migrate the volume on their own. Otherwise, a new volume is created
on the destination, both volumes are attached, the data is copied
over, the volumes are detached, and the source is deleted.

To provide a seamless experience for the user, the volume ID is kept
unchanged. This is done by keeping the 'id' as a unique internal
identifier, and adding an 'extern_id' which is what is returned to
the user and passed as parameters by the user. There is also a
'migrating_from' field which allows for differentiation between the
source and destination volumes.

Implements: bp volume-migration
Change-Id: Ib6fcf27051f45e60aa3ba5f599e88c1421db753e
"}, {'created': '2013-07-07 17:52:46.000000000', 'message': "Migration for detached volumes with no snaps.

Implementation of volume migration for detached volumes with no
snapshots. Migration is initiated by an admin API. The scheduler
confirms that the specified destination host can accept the volume.
The source driver is given the opportunity to migrate the volume on
their own. Otherwise, a new volume is created on the destination, both
volumes are attached, the data is copied over, the volumes are
detached, and the source is deleted. In the database, the destination
volume's attributes are copied to the source so that the volume-id
remains unchanged, and the destination volume row is deleted.

Implements: bp volume-migration
Change-Id: Ib6fcf27051f45e60aa3ba5f599e88c1421db753e

The source driver is given the opportunity to migrate the volume on
their own. Otherwise, a new volume is created on the destination, both
volumes are attached, the data is copied over, the volumes are
detached, the source is deleted, and the destination is renamed. In
the database, the destination volume's attributes are copied to the
source so that the volume-id remains unchanged, and the destination
volume row is deleted.

DocImpact

Implements: bp volume-migration
Change-Id: Ib6fcf27051f45e60aa3ba5f599e88c1421db753e

commit_message:
Migration for detached volumes with no snaps.

Implementation of volume migration for detached volumes with no
snapshots. Migration is initiated by an admin API. The scheduler
confirms that the specified destination host can accept the volume.
The source driver is given the opportunity to migrate the volume on
their own. Otherwise, a new volume is created on the destination, both
volumes are attached, the data is copied over, the volumes are
detached, the source is deleted, and the destination is renamed. In
the database, the destination volume's attributes are copied to the
source so that the volume-id remains unchanged, and the destination
volume row is deleted.

DocImpact

Implements: bp volume-migration
Change-Id: Ib6fcf27051f45e60aa3ba5f599e88c1421db753e

commit_message:
Remove python-netaddr requirement

Remove python-netaddr as a DevStack (stack.sh) requirement,
this does not change any individual project requirements.

Specifically it replaces address_in_net() and adds cidr2netmask()
and maskip() functions.

Change-Id: Ic604437fde2e057faced40a310ab282f3eb27726

- http://logs.openstack.org/36844/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cells-full/386 : FAILURE in 15m 52s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36844/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/31966 : SUCCESS in 46m 39s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36844/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/3760 : SUCCESS in 24m 27s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-16 11:06:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

I'm not convinced that we need to be validating individual fields in a property when we pass it as a parameter. It seems like this makes the template way-complicated when for 99% of cases the parameter data will be passed straight through to the corresponding property. We provide e.g. Fn::Select now to gives users the flexibility to edit dictionaries and lists if they really have to.

Can you elaborate on why you think the recursive schema is important?"}, {'account_id': 7395, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:43:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Zane Bitter: I think recursive schema resolution is important because this feature could be used for more than just generating a quick example template, it could also be used to build a web form. Because of that I did not want to make assumptions about what level of the schema to resolve, I allowed the resource implementer to decide for me. However, by allowing the end user to specify if nested schema's should be exploded or not, you are given the ability to keep the template from becoming complex."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-17 08:10:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The purpose of this feature is to automatically build a provider template for an existing resource. If we recursively expose the schema, it fails to fulfil this purpose, since the parameters no longer match the properties of the original resource, so the facade no longer conceals the underlying abstraction.

As discussed on IRC, this feature is not the way we want to expose the schema to external tools (blueprint resource-properties-schema), for which we will simply return the whole schema.

So this feels to me like over-engineering in service of solving a non-existent problem. The point of having this feature is to make things simple; let's not make things complicated unless there's a specific use case that justifies the extra complexity."}, {'account_id': 7395, 'date': '2013-07-22 20:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 21:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Generate a template from a resource implementation.

Using the properties and attributes schema in a
specified resource, generate a template where
all properties have been mapped as parameters,
and all attributes have beeen mapped as outputs.

blueprint resource-template

Change-Id: I0f494f039e91daf482385f225f8551826cace485

commit_message:
Add an API for passing a signal through to a resource

Reuse the /waitcondition functionality to provide a
/signal pathway.
a signal could be a waitcondition or an alarm.

blueprint watch-ceilometer
Change-Id: Ia9da222b8072ee0dc65bf137e7d3eb7fa4d944f5

would you mind updating this patch to talk a little about why you need html spice support and why it should be part of the configuration for nova::compute? I'm happy to add additional manifests to configure it, but I am a little hesitant to make it part of nova::compute (unless it really is a common configuration) I would be much happier with something like nova::compute::spice."}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-05-06 06:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I have made the change in nova::compute only because the vnc part is in this class, but I agree nova::compute::spice seems to be a better place.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-05-06 10:35:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-06 10:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

(1 inline comment)

Couple of concerns.

There is actually no openstack-nova-spicehtml5proxy on RHEL/Fedora. We use the openstack-nova-console package for that.

---

Also, why are we installing python-numpy? It seems unrelated... and if required should be part of the packaging (not these modules)"}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-05-21 08:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-21 08:41:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

I have no objection to introducing a quota mechanism for external networks, but please take a look at the comment I added to the bug report.

I suggest (instead of or in addition to introducing this quota) we eliminate the issues that actually prevent a single l3-agent from hosting multiple routers that use different external networks. When external_network_bridge is set to None (empty), normal provider networks can be used as external networks, and I see no fundamental reason an l3-agent shouldn't be able to use multiple external networks simultaneously."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 09:34:23.000000000', 'message': 'XenApi virt driver should throw exception on failure

    Virt xenapi driver does not throw InstancePowerOffFailure exception
    on a failure while destroying an instance.
    _shutdown_instance in compute manager expects InstancePowerOffFailure
    and reraises it.
    This ensures that instances are not wrongly marked as deleted.

    This commit was reverted for 1194264. But the bug was due to
    Xenapi shutdown not returning a true when the instance was already
    shutdown. It is fixed as part of review #34865

    Fixes: bug #1190076
    Change-Id: I2d9792775ca88fd60c83fccea8a25301d9162d30

Change-Id: I0f063820a350de7393f12f27159fff48167c3cc8
'}]
commit_message:
XenApi virt driver should throw exception on failure

    Virt xenapi driver does not throw InstancePowerOffFailure exception
    on a failure while destroying an instance.
    _shutdown_instance in compute manager expects InstancePowerOffFailure
    and reraises it.
    This ensures that instances are not wrongly marked as deleted.

    This commit was reverted for 1194264. But the bug was due to
    Xenapi shutdown not returning a true when the instance was already
    shutdown. It is fixed as part of review #34865

    Fixes: bug #1190076
    Change-Id: I2d9792775ca88fd60c83fccea8a25301d9162d30

Change-Id: I0f063820a350de7393f12f27159fff48167c3cc8

commit_message:
Implements Cross Service Unified Request id

Including 'correlation_id' middleware from oslo-incubator.
Adding this to openstack-common.conf to copy over the middleware to
the location glance/common

The correlation_id that is generated by the correlation_id
middleware is added to the RequestContext and is logged along
with the request_id, to enable more effective debugging
of requests that span multiple services.

Change-Id: I320abd9a8a35c64c8c1a65285efd34579df46b70
Implements: blueprint cross-service-request-id

commit_message:
fixes get_default_host_ip on new installations

Moves the installation of package prerequisites in front
of the common configuration to make get_default_host_ip
workable, which is missing python-netaddr on new devstack
installations at the moment.

fixes bug 1083475

Change-Id: I643fd1587bda6963c62f9bdd1ede7897741a9ca1

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-17 12:39:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We usually not add skipped test cases. The the test cases usually becomes skipped when they are instabill for some reason.

Frequently happens, if more test closely relates test cases added at the same time, some the skipped ones also accepted.

IMHO the lock/unlock should be added as individual server API test case.

I vote with -1 because this change skips the whole scenario test.

tempest.scenario.test_server_basic_ops.TestServerBasicOps.test_server_basicops ... SKIP: Until Bug #1201662 is fixed"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-17 13:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Additional note (read the previews one as well): 

IMHO you should remember to this change. 
(Looks like the sytsem does not recognized it as bug fixing commit, otherwise it would be commented on the bug automtacially).

0. restore the change (after 1 weak inactivity it is required, you just need to click to the restore button in gerrit)
1. git review -d 37435
2. git rebase master
3. remove the skips (by your favorite editor)
4. git commit -a --amend
5. git review'}, {'account_id': 8085, 'date': '2013-07-25 04:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Sync models for AgentBuild, Aggregates, AggregateHost tables.

DB models definition should be up-to-date with DB schema obtained after
applying of migrations. Currently, there are no tests enforcing this and
it's really hard to analyze what indexes should be added, and what indexes
we have at the moment.

So the first step is it to fix all models, and add missing descriptions
about Indexes and UniqueConstraints in __table_args__ and use explicit
'nullable' parameter in columns description.

Add empty __table_args__ parameter to Table

blueprint db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I76e064cf11d8b0df473c6085271b48a81fe31702

3PAR drivers support extend volume doc update

Added extend volume as a feature that is now supported in the
Havana release by the HP 3PAR StoreServ cinder drivers.

this patch.

commit_message:
Make sure users can't remove their account quotas

Protect X-Remove-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes same as X-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes

Fixes bug 1204110

Change-Id: Ibac5b555f50b1fe41b2999c0d5776d90f9c9f3d1

commit_message:
Fixes NoAuthMiddleware URL windows generation bug

Fixes bug where NoAuthMiddleware URL generation
would break on Windows because os.path.join was used

Change-Id: I2ec5af4f83a9092b40502db0aed0b2a37549de1e

commit_message:
Fixing dnsdomain_get call in nova.network.manager

  db.dnsdomain_get() was being passed an availability
  zone instead of a domain.

fixes: bug #1190718

Change-Id: Ia8ccf6e84d4b181adaa3b0475e51e3897ac03bd2

Hi John,

I tried writing test for add and remove of the hostname, but the issue is both are happening in the same method spawn in vmops. 

One way I could think of testing this was by mocking and setting up expectations for both add and remove. But the challenge in that is the 'spawn' method has nested methods imlimented as steps which couldn't be mocked.

We may have to restructure/refactor entire spawn mechanism to be able to test it. I am not sure if I should go ahead, looking for you thought around this.

Or Is there a easy way to test it ?"}, {'account_id': 6950, 'date': '2013-07-22 09:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-07-22 09:35:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Remove hostname param from XenApi after first boot

Removes hostname param from XenApi after first boot.
Hostname being present is causing PV tools to pick
old hostname and revert the hostname changes.

Fixes: bug #1203025
Change-Id: I48d8e43addb8d6cd84ad160cd52427d47a31ff69

commit_message:
Sync latest rpc changes from oslo-incubator

Includes these commits:

 99b7c35 Convert kombu SSL version string into integer
 1a2df89 Enable H302 hacking check
 3969355 Fix exception arg typo
 3006787 Sanitize passwords in _safe_log
 323e465 Add conditional exception reraise
 dea334a Replace sys.exit by a RPCException
 719eba4 Don't reconnect to exclusive fanout consumers.
 22ec8ff Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust
 13650b1 rpc: remove some unused serialization code
 e204885 Optionally reject messages on exception.
 688832f Remove unused zmq relay functionality

The sslutils module is included for its validate_ssl_version() method.

Change-Id: Ic2b64f68bfda0dde365221ab1efbc592b1e5bc6f

remove it.

Change-Id: I8ce4c98f819c98e835a6d8298fe22f2fd0ca18b6
"}, {'created': '2013-07-24 18:34:05.000000000', 'message': "use encode('utf8') instead of str()

It is not clear for converting a unicode to string by using str().
Instead we should use var.encode('utf8') to do this.

Change-Id: I8ce4c98f819c98e835a6d8298fe22f2fd0ca18b6
"}]
commit_message:
use encode('utf8') instead of str()

It is not clear for converting a unicode to string by using str().
Instead we should use var.encode('utf8') to do this.

Change-Id: I8ce4c98f819c98e835a6d8298fe22f2fd0ca18b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 10:23:40.000000000', 'message': 'get_snapshot should populate the snapshot metadata

Update the query in db api snapshot_get() to join with the table
snapshot_metadata, so that snapshot metadata is returned. This makes the
api snapshot_get() function in the same way as volume_get().

Fixes: bug #1204446

Change-Id: I37004140f6a11b96aaeb3af6c631028a44541d3a
'}]
commit_message:
get_snapshot should populate the snapshot metadata

Update the query in db api snapshot_get() to join with the table
snapshot_metadata, so that snapshot metadata is returned. This makes the
api snapshot_get() function in the same way as volume_get().

Fixes: bug #1204446

Change-Id: I37004140f6a11b96aaeb3af6c631028a44541d3a

allowed driver call to dd in one case.  Modify tests to

Change-Id: I437b56505ba025b256b051dfaf43d8124005f854
Fixes: bug #1203075
'}, {'created': '2013-07-24 22:10:46.000000000', 'message': 'GPFS stub calls to truncate and dd in unit tests

gpfs unit tests had calls to truncate, and allowed
driver call to dd and df.  Modify tests to stub these
out.

Also remove references to image_path.  This was a temp file

commit_message:
GPFS stub calls to truncate and dd in unit tests

gpfs unit tests had calls to truncate, and allowed
driver call to dd and df.  Modify tests to stub these
out.

Also remove references to image_path.  This was a temp file
created using truncate that is no longer used.

Change-Id: I437b56505ba025b256b051dfaf43d8124005f854
Fixes: bug #1203075

commit_message:
Storwize/SVC: Use VolumeDriver's copy vol<->image.

Inherit the VolumeDriver copy volume<->image functions. This patch also
creates a new SanDriver class which is protocol-agnostic, and leaves
the SanISCSIDriver class for drivers that wish to use it.

Change-Id: Iad5cb030545ef7f4e01d006f1e63cdeeec713bf6

commit_message:
Fixing broken credential schema in sqlite.

Credential table has foreign key constraint
referring to tenant table which is dropped.
Since sqlite does not support alter table
drop constraint, the foreign key constraint
was not dropped. When we try to load credential
table using sqlite backend it fails because tenant
table does not exist. Fix is provided such that
the credential table is recreated without foreign
key constraint and the data is moved from old
credential table to the new credential table.

Fixes Bug #1190383

Change-Id: I3afb04254f33e12fccb7da84c8674feba36622c8

commit_message:
Remove python 2.4 and python 2.5 support.

As a project we do not support python 2.4 or python 2.5
and these versions of python are not tested, so remove
the compatibility code.

Change-Id: I267d9e7e83d85322c45d56d9c5256b514224ad8c
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

Did a quick scan, looks good so far!  Need to do a more thorough review.  Note that I've made progress on volume migration for the detached case:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33055/

After that gets through, I'd like to call your API for migrating attached volumes.  Cinder would create a new volume, call volume_swap, and delete the original volume.  From the user's point of view, it is the same volume, and should keep the same ID.  Any thoughts on swapping the volumes' IDs?  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-23 13:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

minor nits'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-06-24 17:10:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Avishay:

I've thought about it a lot and the only way I've come up with so far is to do a double migration.

i.e: swap to a new volume with a new id. Move the now unattached volume to a new host (or delete and recreate it). Then swap back to the old volume. It is pretty inefficient for I/O but I haven't been able to come up with a good alternative."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-06-27 19:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-27 19:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

This is going to need a rebase RSN, so I marked that.

Technically, we're trying to avoid adding new interfaces that take old-world objects. Would you consider updating this to use new-world objects? From the look of it, I think all you'd need is to add "want_objects=True" to your compute_api.get() call, and then of course, remove the to_primitive() call on your instance in rpcapi. From looking, I *think* that might be the only thing you need to do.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 18:29:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add support for volume swap

Adds support for transparently swapping an attached volume with
another volume. Note that this overwrites all data on the new
volume with data from the old volume.

Implements blueprint volume-swap

Change-Id: Iaace71f46acd33cf1531d953d569c0b6d0bbe680

commit_message:
Code dedup in class ServersControllerCreateTest

Externed common parts to setUp():
- request body
- request object
- test image UUID
- test flavor URL
These parts were equal in the most part of the methods.

bp nova-tests-code-duplication

Change-Id: I091f14a9753059d759ba2f7b05ff33f5abea0f00

commit_message:
Make ServersViewBuilderTest DRYer.

Move detail and brief info about server from test methods to setUp()
to expected_detailed_server and expected_server respectively. Every
test modifies the particular fields in the variables to create
appropriate test environment.

Blueprint: nova-tests-code-duplication
Change-Id: I31bf6ed3c266da99c57b128c298cf7beae9a6db4

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-28 21:23:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I like the idea, this is a a reasonable tradeoff, verifying the availability zone is valid before attempting to schedule.

Although on second thought, taking this idea further we can moving more and more of the validation into the API server instead of in the scheduler.  Making the validation synchronous instead of asynchronous.  Doing so will slow down the API server and potentially cause race conditions.  

So I am on the fence on this one."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-06-29 00:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Please come off the fence Joe ;-)

If we let users make mistakes which end up with then instance in an Error state it cost us time and effort (as a cloud provider) to help them understand what went wrong.

Anything that can be validated in the API needs to be - its as simple as that'}, {'account_id': 7551, 'date': '2013-06-30 08:27:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-30 09:16:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work
