Still looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 6904, 'date': '2013-07-03 10:15:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-03 12:11:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Scheduling on availability zone is optional (since it is in a filter), and this patch will make it required.  And I would prefer we keep things optional when possible."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-04 11:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi Joe,

I don't see that the change makes an AZ any more or less optional than it already is - if "availability_zone" is null there won't be any validation, and it will end up being set to CONF.default_schedule_zone (which may or may not be set).

Whether AZs are actually used for scheduling or not depend on how the cloud provider configures the filter scheduler.

I would agree that calling _handle_availability_zone both here and in _create_instance is a bit clumsy - it would maybe be better to just pass the results of the first call into _create_instance'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-05 06:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (1 inline comment)

see inline.'}, {'account_id': 7551, 'date': '2013-07-10 05:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 06:16:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

- http://logs.openstack.org/33657/9/check/gate-nova-pylint/16223 : SUCCESS in 11m 13s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-10 09:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Do not merge

"nova boot --image=1029f005-5396-4d23-8948-acebef5c733e --flavor=m1.nano --availability-zone=fake myinstance"
should work when  
"scheduler_default_filters = RetryFilter,ComputeFilter,ComputeCapabilitiesFilter,ImagePropertiesFilter," but with this patch that breaks.

Instead we get
 "ERROR: The requested availability zone is not available! (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-a0c26496-dcf4-4a95-92e4-d0497a25c17c)"'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-10 16:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

-2 because a badly specified test case that used to get through because there was missing input validation is now broken - I don't see the logic here ?

Why should "availability-zone=fake" be considered a "must-have" an exception to input validation rules when other values like "--flavor=fake" or "--image=fake" are allowed to fail ?

If you want a availability zone called "fake" then just create one - but I don't get why we would want to make validation weaker (and therefore a much worse experience for used in the other 99.99% of cases) just to accomodate a test case that can be easily changed.'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-10 17:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Also worth noting that to get the failure you describe you would need to configure the AvaiabilityZone API extension.   If you rally want "--availability-zone"  to be ignored then why not just disable that API extension ?

Having the API extension enabled but the corresponding scheduler filter nit configured doesn't strike me as a core configuration that needs to be supported.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-10 17:49:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Sadly, the API extension isn't for enabling availability_zones for the user its for listing them.  an AZ is an optional argument while the image and flavor are not.

Perhaps this is a funny configuration for us to support, but we do support it now and we need be careful about changing user facing behavior.  And this doesn't seem like a strong reason to change it.  Yes this will result in a more explicit error msg, although a 'nova show' should show the same thing. Although this example is a little silly, I think the question of validation of optional filter parameters in the API is a more general topic that perhaps should be discussed or addressed in a more general manor.

Other options are welcome on this topic."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-10 22:15:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Would also welcome other opinions, but want to clarify on point you make Joe - Doesn't this code fragment show that the availability zone is only parsed from the request if the AvailabilityZone extension is loaded ?

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L816-818


The difference between validating and not validating this parameter to the user is an error message back form the API vs an instance going into an ERROR state - and ERROR is meant to mean that the system hit a problem - not that the user mis-typed something"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-11 07:37:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I missed that line, you are correct.  disabling the extension will make this work.  The relationship between the api extension and filter should be mentioned in the commit msg (and that now you must disable the extension along with the filter) and that this doesn't break that."}, {'account_id': 7551, 'date': '2013-07-12 14:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-12 15:24:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me

commit_message:
Add validation of available_zone during instance create

When using nova boot command with --availability_zone parameter and only
input the zone without host and node, now will check if the zone is
available, if not, then return an error message directly rather than
create an instance with an Error state

Add a get_only_available option to function get_availability_zones

To disable available zone, one should have to disable both the scheduler
filter and the API extension, if the API extension is not disabled, this
patch will still do the validation of available zone

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ibff117d48b60ac4f4ae33e3b3d2840d7313ce0d4

commit_message:
config.generator: remove the total number of options

This is not really useful, and has the unbearable side effect of triggering
merge errors when two patches modifying the number total of options go in at
the same time.

The merge could very likely succeed is there was not this particular line,
so let's drop it!

Change-Id: Iff7a0b71e88ab573ea668538ad6eba989e9a77b4

[{'created': '2013-07-19 23:36:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up trivial license mismatches

This prepares Nova for Hacking 0.6 by fixing all occurences
of H103 - license header does not match Apache 2.x license.

Change-Id: I413d46c6940716fed39542b35a6ddc02a87f5196
'}]
commit_message:
Fix up trivial license mismatches

This prepares Nova for Hacking 0.6 by fixing all occurences
of H103 - license header does not match Apache 2.x license.

Change-Id: I413d46c6940716fed39542b35a6ddc02a87f5196

In order to encourage taskflow adoption, take a hint
from oslo-incubator and have a similar update.py script
that will allow users of taskflow to selectively pick up
flows and there dependencies for usage in there own projects.

commit_message:
Add a way to use taskflow until library stabilized.

In order to encourage taskflow adoption, take a hint
from oslo-incubator and have a similar update.py script
that will allow users of taskflow to selectively pick up
flows and there dependencies for usage in there own projects.

Example run:

$ python2.6 update.py  --base cinder --dest-dir /tmp/cinder_test --primitives flow.linear_flow

Copying module 'taskflow.decorators' -> 'cinder.taskflow.decorators'
  '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/' (new)
  '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/__init__.py' (new)
  'taskflow/decorators.py' -> '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/decorators.py'
Copying module 'taskflow.exceptions' -> 'cinder.taskflow.exceptions'
  'taskflow/exceptions.py' -> '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/exceptions.py'
Copying module 'taskflow.patterns.base' -> 'cinder.taskflow.patterns.base'
  '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/patterns/' (new)
  '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/patterns/__init__.py' (new)
  'taskflow/patterns/base.py' -> '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/patterns/base.py'
Copying module 'taskflow.patterns.linear_flow' -> 'cinder.taskflow.patterns.linear_flow'
  'taskflow/patterns/linear_flow.py' -> '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/patterns/linear_flow.py'
Copying module 'taskflow.states' -> 'cinder.taskflow.states'
  'taskflow/states.py' -> '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/states.py'
Copying module 'taskflow.utils' -> 'cinder.taskflow.utils'
  'taskflow/utils.py' -> '/tmp/cinder_test/cinder/taskflow/utils.py'

Change-Id: Ib4e6299bdae737e2759f22b1eff35c344bb8beb2

Providernet extension support for the Cisco Nexus plugin

Implements blueprint provider-network-extensions-cisco

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-16 14:30:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mig 186 downgrade when using sqlalchemy >= 0.8

This patch fixes an issue that cause tests to break when using
SQLAlchemy 0.8 and newer. The migration was using non existant column
names in an update query. Referring to a non-existent column in an
insert() or update() construct will raise an error instead of a warning
in SQLAlchemy 0.8.

As an added bonus - this patch adds the downgrade tests for migration
186 (which were missed in the orriginal patch) to ensure there are no
further regressions.

Fixes bug: #1201453

Change-Id: I3c679e95583ee0c1bded5a01ddec6d6212904195

commit_message:
Fix mig 186 downgrade when using sqlalchemy >= 0.8

This patch fixes an issue that cause tests to break when using
SQLAlchemy 0.8 and newer. The migration was using non-existing column
names in an update query. Referring to a non-existent column in an
insert() or update() construct will raise an error instead of a warning
in SQLAlchemy 0.8.

As an added bonus - this patch adds the downgrade tests for migration
186 (which were missed in the original patch) to ensure there are no
further regressions.

Fixes bug: #1201453

Change-Id: I3c679e95583ee0c1bded5a01ddec6d6212904195

commit_message:
Fixed tests for flavor swap extension after merging in core API

flavor_swap extension was merged into core API but tests were not
updated accordinly so this functionality was not tested at all.
This commit adds proper tests for this extension

Related to blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: If5f464302f2efd51d6c48d9c28baa6e0922bfa2c

'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-01 13:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi David,

Would you be able to suggest a way for me to reproduce 
the .close problem?

(If possible I'd like to do this testing on Ubuntu -- should that be possible or is the behaviour specific to CentOS/Fedora?)

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-01 14:41:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I've been able to replicate on RHEL image with endpoint setup with ssl. That is you are accessing glance server over HTTPs. Calls to HTTPResponse will access the file associated with socket, if socket is closed prior to reads from http response, you should get the (9, Bad file descriptor) error. This fix simply delays the socket close until the file associated with socket is closed through the response.close call."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-01 14:49:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi David,

I'm making requests to a https glance server (running on Ubuntu) but am not able to reproduce the bad file descripter behaviour.

Is there anything in particular I can do to ensure that the
socket is closed prior to reads from http response (the required condition to reproduce the failure)? 

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-01 17:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I think the easiest thing to do to replicate is to run glanceclient in little rhel VM. I think reference counting might be different in rhel and ubuntu and that is why there is some timing difference, another thing that might be different is that ubuntu precise or up will come with phython 2.7 by default, rhel 6.4 still comes with python 2.6'}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-01 17:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Stuart, something else I notice is that my header back from and image list response returns connection: close as one of the headers which is what then causes the will_close var in httplib to be set to true and the HTTPConnection.close to be called before HTTPResponse is returned back.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-08 15:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

David,

Thanks for the additional info. A bit short on time to test this right now, but its on my todo list.'}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Stuart, any luck replicating this one? We consistently hit these in our RHEL 6.4 systems'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-07-18 09:37:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-glanceclient/+bug/1179392/comments/14'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-18 15:41:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

David,

I hacked my glance-api to inject 'Connection: close' into the set of headers returned back to an image-list:

This gave me:

$ glance -k -A XXX -U https://localhost:9292 image-list
Could not decode response body as JSON
string indices must be integers, not str

Is this the same behaviour as you're seeing?"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-18 15:47:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Applying the patch makes image-list work again.

If you can confirm that I reproduced I'm good to +1 here."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-18 17:27:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Stuart, no what we see is a socket error 9 like this:

(9, 'Bad file descriptor')"}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-18 18:03:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Stuart and Paul https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-glanceclient/+bug/1179392/comments/15

Can you try running glance client with the --insecure flag?'}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-18 20:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Details on systems where we see this issue https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-glanceclient/+bug/1179392/comments/16, we actually run into this in havana.'}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-18 20:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Stuart, one way you can simulate is by hacking def _check_close(self): under httplib to always return True regardless of header connection. That will cause this line to always evaluate true under HTTPResponse

# will the connection close at the end of the response?
        self.will_close = self._check_close()'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-19 09:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

David,

Making my change (to context.py to add the 'Connection: close' header), this time on Fedora, reproduced:

$ glance -A `cat token` -U https://localhost:9292 -k image-list
(9, 'Bad file descriptor')


Looking again at this context.py hack running on Ubuntu with strace I see that I'm also getting EBADF:

read(3, 0x16da453, 5)                   = -1 EBADF (Bad file descriptor)

it happens to be a read rather than a write -- hence the different symptom."}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-07-19 09:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

So based on the observation that the presence of a "connection: close" header is enough to make the client fall over, I think it should be possible to add a functional test for this.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-19 09:52:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Paul,

I think there's a gap generally in https testing (both on the server and client side). Based on the pain being experienced by the RHAT based distros by this bug I'd be inclined to accept this fix without gating it on the more general https testing issue.

David,

I'm going to do a little more functional testing (on Ubuntu) to verify the fix. Expect something back from me soon."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-19 20:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Great to hear back for you Stuart and Paul, will be alert for feedback on this'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-22 14:40:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

David,

I've run some more functional tests with this patch on Ubuntu (without the connection:close header), just to check for any regression: mainly parallel uploads/downloads/deletes. All looks fine.

If you think its appropriate to make the minor comment change I can +1 for you.

Also, I pinged Flavio -- he may be interested seeing as this issue affects redhat."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:36:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for your review'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Thanks for your patch :-)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 17:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 21:02:28.000000000', 'message': 'Provides the expected struc format for https timeout

Fixes bug 1179392

glanceclient.common.http.HTTPClient.get_connection_kwargs method
explicitly sets the timeout to be a float, while struc.pack is
still using LL as the format string which means 2 Long Integers.
Setting format string to fL which mean a float followed by Long
Integer.

Change-Id: I3a973da3b962c7572ae0f61f6996bdd1f0048339
'}, {'created': '2013-06-26 21:12:46.000000000', 'message': 'HTTPS response issues

Fixes bug 1179392

glanceclient.common.http.HTTPClient.get_connection_kwargs method
explicitly sets the timeout to be a float, while struc.pack is
still using LL as the format string which means 2 Long Integers.
Setting format string to fL which mean a float followed by Long
Integer.

commit_message:
HTTPS response issues

Fixes bug 1179392

glanceclient.common.http.HTTPClient.get_connection_kwargs method
explicitly sets the timeout to be a float, while struc.pack is
still using LL as the format string which means 2 Long Integers.
Setting format string to fL which mean a float followed by Long
Integer.

Also, Bad file descriptor error is caused by socket being closed
to soon. Added a close() implementation to VerifiedHTTPSConnection
which will remove reference to socket before returning call to
base HTTPConnection.close(). This will avoid socket to be closed
before response body is read. Socket will close when response
close is called.

Change-Id: I3a973da3b962c7572ae0f61f6996bdd1f0048339

commit_message:
Pin dependencies to known working versions

The module is no longer compatible with the latest versions of
puppetlabs-mysql and puppetlabs-rabbitmq.

* Pin fixtures to known working versions.
* Set upper bound major version of puppetlabs-mysql to <1.0.0
* Sort fixtures alphabetically for better maintainability

Change-Id: I0c7f54336bc2aad76f20ce8e2931358f986932f5

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-07-23 19:46:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Bill, we are having problems with the Storwize/SVC driver on PPC because it has a requirement on qemu-img .  I have opened bug 1200800 (https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1200800) to address that.  It looks like this code would also hit that problem on PPC.

If you look at the bug we are considering adding a configuration option like 'raw_image_only' that would be used by PPC to work around the dependency on qemu-img.

I am thinking that you may want to make the same change given PPC's affinity for GPFS."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 20:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-07-23 19:20:56.000000000', 'message': 'Do not convert image fetched from glance if already in raw format

Modify _gpfs_fetch_to_raw to check image format.  If already in raw
format, no need to call convert_image.  In that case, simply rename
to destination name.

Change-Id: I197d99194f93c02ce3c501de25433d89b23e6a35
Fixes: bug #1201676
'}, {'created': '2013-07-23 19:29:42.000000000', 'message': 'GPFS convert glance image to raw only when needed

Modify _gpfs_fetch_to_raw to check image format.  If already in raw
format, no need to call convert_image.  In that case, simply rename
to destination name.

Change-Id: I197d99194f93c02ce3c501de25433d89b23e6a35
Fixes: bug #1201676
'}]
commit_message:
GPFS convert glance image to raw only when needed

Modify _gpfs_fetch_to_raw to check image format.  If already in raw
format, no need to call convert_image.  In that case, simply rename
to destination name.

Change-Id: I197d99194f93c02ce3c501de25433d89b23e6a35
Fixes: bug #1201676

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 20:39:30.000000000', 'message': 'Pin rabbit and mysql to major version for fixtures

Previously, unit tests were using master for testing.

This commit changes them to use the newly created major version
branches. This allows us to backport bug fixes while we wait for
upstream to stabilize.

Change-Id: I43c03e7d77fba2f5153eac62a73e9f0a45ac5b33
'}]
commit_message:
Pin rabbit and mysql to major version for fixtures

Previously, unit tests were using master for testing.

This commit changes them to use the newly created major version
branches. This allows us to backport bug fixes while we wait for
upstream to stabilize.

Change-Id: I43c03e7d77fba2f5153eac62a73e9f0a45ac5b33

commit_message:
More basic install cleanup

* Make sure to apply the sysctl settings (restarting the network service
  isn't enough)
* Make sure that glance uses keystone for authentication
* Add a note about lost iptables rules after reboot
* Be more consistent with docbook tags
* Be more consistent with spacing
* Define the my_ip setting for nova nodes (the metadata service might
  not work properly if not defined)
* Use the controller IP addres to access horizon

Change-Id: I973624113d5b18ec8d53f6434a40f7250d91c04d

Allows the auth_version to be only included when a node
attribute is set to v2.0. This ensures that Keystone v3 works

commit_message:
Allow auth_version in auth_token middleware

Allows the auth_version to be only included when a node
attribute is set to v2.0. This ensures that Keystone v3 works
with Nova when not on Keystone v2.0.

Also corrects the auth endpoint to the main endpoint not
the admin one.

Fixes LP #1204627

Change-Id: Ib7c3eae117a33cc2a7a5668e033851acaecd880b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-22 14:12:10.000000000', 'message': "updated installation notes for SLES

Removed note about deprecated packages provided by B1 Systems
on the openSUSE Build Service. B1 Systems is now working on
the packages provided in the project Cloud:Master and it's
subprojects.

Updated the note about declaring the repository for SLES 11, the
lastes release of SLES 11 is SP3.

Added the note that there are no known issues with the Python
interpreter on SLES11 SP3.

Added the note that the latest development snapshots are available
in the project Cloud:OpenStack:Master on the openSUSE Build
Service.

Change-Id: I9408afdbd4b90495e2f34f5acb97a98dd5e7d179

commit_message:
updated installation notes for SLES

Removed note about deprecated packages provided by B1 Systems
on the openSUSE Build Service. B1 Systems is now working on
the packages provided in the project Cloud:Master and it's
subprojects.

Updated the note about declaring the repository for SLES 11, the
lastes release of SLES 11 is SP3.

Added the note that there are no known issues with the Python
interpreter on SLES11 SP3.

Added the note that the latest development snapshots are available
in the project Cloud:OpenStack:Master on the openSUSE Build
Service.

Change-Id: I9408afdbd4b90495e2f34f5acb97a98dd5e7d179

commit_message:
Implements extend volume feature in HP 3PAR driver

This patch enables the extend volume feature to be used in cinder
when the backend storage is a 3PAR array.

Change-Id: I8c8422f0ffc6d55ebe80fa8b2962b54eca266974

Avishay, this is in the code that I was talking with you about on IRC yesterday.  I am waiting for a user to test a version that puts the check of each of the mapping ids in an inline function that is called with FixedIntervalLoopingCall.  This is necessary as we were seeing issues with long copies causing the code to block in the code that is checking the mappings.  This would result in other REST API calls to timeout and mark the service offline.

I will let you know as soon as I have the results of the test I am waiting to complete."}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:05:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Jay - can you please submit a bug report for that issue?  I'd like to fix it in a separate patch that references it."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Implement extend volume for Storwize/SVC.

This implements the extend volume functionality for the Storwize/SVC
driver.  Extending volumes with snapshots is not supported, as this
will require converting the snapshots into full copies, which will eat
up free space.

Change-Id: I5fb8c6967e6f3df1adfef46e05c832a953dd7131

commit_message:
Added Generic Persistence API and Datatypes

Added a generic persistence API for JobBoards,
Jobs, LogBooks, Workflows, FlowDetails, Tasks,
and TaskDetails. The currently implemented
backends are in-memory and sqlite db (by use
of sqlalchemy). Also implemented generic return
types (listed above) for the generic API.

Change-Id: Ib6b108ec3cfbba4ebd31656a45eb446687e44422

[{'created': '2013-07-23 21:20:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix DHCP agent to work with latest dnsmasq

The latest dnsmasq no longer accepts hostnames which begin with a number. This
affects Fedora 19 right now, and will mean Fedora 19 will not work with Neutron
DHCP. dnsmasq should work with hostnames beginning with a number (RFC 1123 says
this is valid), but until this is fixed, many users will be left unable to use
Fedora 19 with Neutron.

This patch adds a "host-" prefix to each hostname entry generated by the DHCP
agent. This fixes the issue in Neutron.

Fixes bug 1204125

commit_message:
Fix DHCP agent to work with latest dnsmasq

The latest dnsmasq no longer accepts hostnames which begin with a number. This
affects Fedora 19 right now, and will mean Fedora 19 will not work with Neutron
DHCP. dnsmasq should work with hostnames beginning with a number (RFC 1123 says
this is valid), but until this is fixed, many users will be left unable to use
Fedora 19 with Neutron.

This patch adds a "host-" prefix to each hostname entry generated by the DHCP
agent. This fixes the issue in Neutron.

Fixes bug 1204125

Change-Id: I0e29ec033969c3fb958ed3a12b8962b73b0e3d94

commit_message:
Naming instance directory by uuid in VMware Hyper.

Like Libvirt Hyper, Using EC2 template for naming instance
directory may cause conflict. we follow what Libvirt does to use
instance uuid instead of EC2 template naming. To keep backwards
compability, when fails to find a instance by uuid, fall back to use
EC2 name.

Fix bug #1186944

(cherry picked from commit e517e5668ab20214432e06ef87f7b16776edaf7c)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/vmwareapi/db_fakes.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: Iaba099225a9b3b0390cae4c5fbd82d7e6c11f0e0

commit_message:
added Compute Services to System Info panel

Added a new tab to the System Info panel showing all Compute Services.

fixes bug #1198247

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-23 20:56:44.000000000', 'message': "Move isolated credential code to BaseTestCase

This commit takes the isolated credential code from BaseComputeTest
and moves it up to it's super class: BaseTestCase. This allows the
isolated credential code to be reused by all the test classes. All
existing(only compute and volume) isolated credential methods in
the base classes are then update to use the common methods.

Change-Id: Ifae7bb74a4aa8f853fbd87ad80a63a9dcfc3b9d1
"}]
commit_message:
Move isolated credential code to BaseTestCase

This commit takes the isolated credential code from BaseComputeTest
and moves it up to it's super class: BaseTestCase. This allows the
isolated credential code to be reused by all the test classes. All
existing(only compute and volume) isolated credential methods in
the base classes are then update to use the common methods.

Change-Id: Ifae7bb74a4aa8f853fbd87ad80a63a9dcfc3b9d1

(2 inline comments)

We need to avoid backward incompatible changes in configuration, unless we have a strong reason for doing that. If you have a strong reason for introducing such a change, just explain why and we should be all right!

The other item that should be reviewed about this patch is that this adding the list_resources check to the default policy, and leverages the fact that target is supposed to not be empty on regular GET requests. I don't have an alternative idea at the moment.

Finally, how crazy would it be to be able to create controllers which are able to enforce or not the policy on list operations? We don't need that policy for all resources but agents, so perhaps is a valuable idea that might even avoid introducing this 'list_resources' "meta-policy"'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-15 22:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

subject: Remove use_namespaces option from etc/lbaas_agent.ini
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 6072, 'name': 'Eugene Nikanorov', 'email': 'enikanorov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'enikanorov'}, {'_account_id': 8149, 'name': 'Brandon Lee', 'email': 'devmgr1@yahoo.com', 'username': 'skyrainman'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-15 06:50:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37022/1/check/gate-neutron-pep8/429 : SUCCESS in 2m 03s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/37022/1/check/gate-neutron-docs/429/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 51s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37022/1/check/gate-neutron-python26/413 : SUCCESS in 22m 30s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37022/1/check/gate-neutron-python27/429 : SUCCESS in 14m 36s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37022/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/3499 : SUCCESS in 22m 06s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 8149, 'date': '2013-07-15 07:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is not a fix, this is a downgrade. use_namespaces is an option in OpenStack, not a requirement. Removing the option causes it to be a requirement. This is a continued problem in OpenStack development, if we settle for less that's just what we get, less.

The fix is to modify the code base so that the quantum-ldaas-agent agent can be used with or without namespaces. haproxy does not require namespaces to function.

@enikanorov stated that "I think for software haproxy this would not be a practical solution for multitenant environments," well, we have the same problem with the quantum-dhcp-agent and quantum-l3-agent, however, that doesn't mean we downgrade those as well.  They've been developed to function with or without.

Regardless of advantages and disadvantages of using namespaces or not, we're creating possibilities instead of destroying them.

Please fix the code don't downgrade the code.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-15 08:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Right, namespaces support is a requirement for reference implementation of lbaas, but not of lbaas service itself.
So removing this option from conf file is just a matter of consistency.'}, {'account_id': 8149, 'date': '2013-07-15 08:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Removing the option for consistency is the easy fix, I agree with you there.  However, if no real fix is implemented, quantum-lbaas-agent will not get much usage.  

Why? If OpenStack is to become and surpass what VMware, Citrix and others are today, then it must become user friendly.

Most of the organizations/individuals who use VMware, Citrix etc., have no clue how to compile namespace support into the kernel, nor do they know how to install iproute2. 

People will pay for convenience.  Steve Jobs of Apple, changed the game based on that philosophy.  

Now we have a decision, what will OpenStack be, convenience or complex?


In VMware,'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-16 19:37:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 8149, 'date': '2013-07-16 19:37:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 19:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37022/2/check/gate-neutron-pep8/542 : SUCCESS in 2m 05s

- http://logs.openstack.org/37022/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/4327 : FAILURE in 21m 12s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-19 13:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Brandon, could you remove -1?
I believe this patch fixes exact problem of confusing help message in .ini file'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-24 10:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I think we can merge this patch. To implement one without namespace is another story.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-24 15:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Remove use_namespaces option from etc/lbaas_agent.ini

fixes bug 1201249

Remove option from ini file since it is nor registered nor used
in lbaas agent.

Change-Id: I611f794279fea4a4155309cd0668e3b9718221b1

I'm confused here. How does changing the sample configs help with Puppet stuff? Doesn't Puppet typically operate by generating a config file and then pushing it out?"}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-07-23 02:03:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

When we  want to normalize boolean values across all puppet modules, we find most of openstack projects using unified lowercase (true/false), but in Swift conf files, it mixed True/False and true/false.
For example, in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32866/6/manifests/proxy.pp, the log_headers value is False, but other boolean variables uses true/false.
It's more better if Swift could use unified boolean values."}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-07-23 07:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-07-23 07:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

'}, {'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2013-07-23 16:15:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So, like Sam asked, how does this help you?

Swift lowercases config values to check for true values.

So, it doesn't matter what case such values are in configs.

They could be tRUe or FaLsE or whatever?

And these are just the sample configs.  Does your tool read the sample configs for some reason?

It's probably ok to merge this.  I'm just trying to understand what you are doing here."}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-07-24 02:23:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Greg, I will explain more explicitly.
In puppet, the boolean value is case sensitive, it only accept two values: true/false(no quoted), while string 'False' will resolve as true.
So if we want to manage all of the boolean params in Swift, it's needed to unify all the boolean values to use lowercase:true/false. So that's the purpose of this patch.
Besides that, it would not influence on swift's boolean value resolution."}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-24 02:58:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

much better explanation'}, {'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2013-07-24 15:24:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I don't think there is any harm in this."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-24 16:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

this review make me think about this video http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zZ3fjQa5Hls'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-24 16:43:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 16:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-24 16:50:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I agree there's no harm, but I'm still confused.

Question: Is it true that Puppet parses the configuration files already on the system?

It is my understanding that Puppet generates a desired configuration file, compares it to the existing one, and overwrites the existing one if it is different from the desired one. This would not require parsing the file, merely performing a byte-for-byte comparison.

(Note that I haven't used Puppet in a long time, so my ideas on how it works may be woefully out of date.)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 18:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 18:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

[{'created': '2013-07-21 04:20:24.000000000', 'message': 'Unified format of boolean params in conf files

This patch is aim to using lowcase boolean value true/false
to replace other representions in swift conf files.

Fix Bug #1203421

commit_message:
Unified format of boolean params in conf files

In swift conf files, boolean options use different
format: some use true/false, and some use True/False.
This patch is aim to using lowcase true/false to unify
boolean params formats in swift conf files.

Fix Bug #1203421

Change-Id: I3e1bfc6e43231f51e0710aa54869f3774ee896b1

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-04 06:51:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I could not find the reason for explicit nullable=True in https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/db-sync-models-with-migrations.  It just states that we should do it not the reason."}, {'account_id': 6509, 'date': '2013-07-04 07:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Joe, Boris has updated the blueprint with more information on the nullable field. Could you take a look again, please?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-08 18:20:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

"1) Use always explicit nullable parameter for columns. There is a lot of mistakes in current nova models implementation. (sometimes in schema is nullable=True and in model nullable=False and vise versa). Also at this moment when you see Column description without nullable, you couldn't be sure that is author forget to set nullable='False' or it is really nullable='True'. So the easiest way to track all this and to fix and to avoid such things is to have one rule "always use explicit nullable"."

I disagree with that logic.  python has the notion of default values.  Also the nullable issue is related to not keeping the models and migrations in alignment.  And making nullable explicit doesn't address that, a test to make sure things are aligned does.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-08 19:03:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I was expecting a test to verify that the models were in sync once all of these changes were completed.  Is that the plan?'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-07-08 20:16:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Russell

There will be test it is already WIP https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34212/

But as I wrote in mailing list:
1) schames in different backends are different
2) there are a lot of hidden bugs in schemas

So the plan is:
1) sync schemas to mysql (what we are expecting)
2) add migration to fix schema to what we are expecting
3) sync other backends to mysql
4) add test that will protect us from mistake

It is pretty complicated to do at once.. So step by step..



Joe,

And I am for explicit nullable. I am reviewing almost all patches that changes our db. And I see that the common way for contributors (that are not familiar with our db and sqla) is to copy-paste some other code and change it. So my goal is to have such situation when if you copy paste any part of our db code (migration/db.api methods/models) and replace to solve you problems you will get well written code. 

With nullable there is a tons of problems. (some contributors specify sometimes nullable=True, and sometimes don't specify anything, sometimes nullable=False, sometimes forgot to specify nullable=False). So let we have simple rule, you are specifying nullable always, and it is the same as in migration. little bit more code, but no mistake."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-08 20:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

With regard to the explicit nullable: 

At the very least they should be in a different patch set.  the title of this patch is sync models with migrations.  nothing to do with explicit nullable.

Also, I am still unclear on what explicit nullable provides over implicit nullable (and using the default value they way we use other default values in python), and including a check to keep the migration and model in sync?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-16 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-16 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Sync some of Instance* models with migrations

Update db.models description for:

 * InstanceFault
 * InstanceAction
 * InstanceActionEvent

That brings it in sync with the actual database
schemas.

Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I5fae28a86064a0582fd2a53a1a7277947b6a3525

commit_message:
Sets storage_conn in CollectorService.

Fixes bug 1204133

Storage_conn was not being set when the CollectorService
was instantiated, thus enabling event storage would cause
exceptions when trying to store the event.

[{'created': '2013-07-12 23:16:46.000000000', 'message': "Make stale_reads_ok an argument of __init__

Actually, it appears that it is already an argument, but for some
reason it was not used anywhere in the code. So, just use it.
We borrow the existing code from the object server, which uses
setdefault(). We don't really need it, and could simply use
kwargs['stale_reads_ok']=stale_reads_ok, but let's keep the
divergencies down.

This was prompted by the desire to document the API of DB Broker
for the LFS work, and finding that documenting magical assignments
was a pain.

Change-Id: Id8f83358ad7709f0df826fbc520b3dfba026a2f1
"}, {'created': '2013-07-21 01:13:53.000000000', 'message': "Make stale_reads_ok an argument of __init__

We borrow the existing code from the object server, which uses
setdefault(). We don't really need it, and could simply use

Change-Id: Id8f83358ad7709f0df826fbc520b3dfba026a2f1

commit_message:
Make stale_reads_ok an argument of __init__

Actually, stale_reads_ok is already an argument, but for some
reason it was not used anywhere in the code. So, just use it.
We borrow the existing code from the object server, which uses
setdefault(). We don't really need it, and could simply use
kwargs['stale_reads_ok']=stale_reads_ok, but let's keep the
divergencies down.

This was prompted by the desire to document the API of DB Broker
for the LFS work, and finding that documenting magical assignments
was a pain.

Change-Id: Id8f83358ad7709f0df826fbc520b3dfba026a2f1

commit_message:
Glance api to pass identity headers to registry v1

This patch introduces the send_identity_headers
config option that allows glance-api to pass auth identity
headers when making calls to the registry v1.

docImpact
Fixes bug 1199990

Change-Id: Ie5f07ed6dfeaa8428de4f79c4d40d182328e6ab4

[{'created': '2013-07-16 00:39:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nic order not correct after reboot

Previously if an instance was rebooted or migrated the original nic order
would not be maintained. This patch retrieves the correct nic order from
info_cache so that the order is mantained.

Fixes bug 1187092

Change-Id: I3f5488cc14c692fde7d5bd3376389e2f2f5550ff
(cherry picked from commit bcd12a776e8cde8c4b64e7c1a21a7387ece55b31)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nic order not correct after reboot

Previously if an instance was rebooted or migrated the original nic order
would not be maintained. This patch retrieves the correct nic order from
info_cache so that the order is mantained.

Fixes bug 1187092

Change-Id: I3f5488cc14c692fde7d5bd3376389e2f2f5550ff
(cherry picked from commit bcd12a776e8cde8c4b64e7c1a21a7387ece55b31)

Turns out if your $TMPDIR is really long
(e.g. /var/folders/vq/n32yszdn4s76z6l8dxklmwdh0000gn/T/, which is 50
characters), then the test that drops stuff into $TMPDIR and adds it

Change-Id: I8fcab2d95091f72b831b906bfc87a36d8be12631
"}, {'created': '2013-07-23 22:34:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix bulk's unit tests on Mac OS.

Turns out if your $TMPDIR is really long
(e.g. /var/folders/vq/n32yszdn4s76z6l8dxklmwdh0000gn/T/, which is 50
characters), then the test that drops stuff into $TMPDIR and adds it
to a tarball and uploads it will fail due to every added file's name
being too long.

Change-Id: I8fcab2d95091f72b831b906bfc87a36d8be12631

commit_message:
Fix bulk's unit tests on Mac OS.

Turns out if your $TMPDIR is really long
(e.g. /var/folders/vq/n32yszdn4s76z6l8dxklmwdh0000gn/T/, which is 50
characters), then the test that drops stuff into $TMPDIR and adds it
to a tarball and uploads it will fail due to every added file's name
being too long.

Change-Id: I8fcab2d95091f72b831b906bfc87a36d8be12631

commit_message:
Port migrations extension to v3 API part 1

This is part 1 of the two part commit to port migrations to v3.
As part of this commit the api and test files are copied over to v3
plugins folder. The second changeset will have changes to port
migrations to v3.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I94d4ce6903da4c16545092f5618c4d130b700462

[{'created': '2013-07-24 14:51:22.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure StorageAPI always re-raises exceptions appropriately

Fixes bug #1204539

Change-Id: I15061ed48bef09890ac4649a4705b0bf83c02a81
'}, {'created': '2013-07-24 14:54:03.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure StorageAPI always re-raises exceptions appropriately

Due to the I/O included the exception handlers, eventlet correctly switches
greenthreads in order to not block. This has the side effect of clearing
pythons internal exception context, resulting in the reraise failing with
a confusing error message.

Fixes bug #1204539

Change-Id: I15061ed48bef09890ac4649a4705b0bf83c02a81
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure StorageAPI always re-raises exceptions appropriately

Due to the I/O included the exception handlers, eventlet correctly switches
greenthreads in order to not block. This has the side effect of clearing
pythons internal exception context, resulting in the reraise failing with
a confusing error message.

Fixes bug #1204539

Change-Id: I15061ed48bef09890ac4649a4705b0bf83c02a81

commit_message:
Package PyCrypto 2.6 into an rpm using fpm.

The available python-crypto package in CentOS 6.4 (version 2.0.1)
is too old.  Specifically the Crypto.Random package is unavaliable.

Change-Id: Ifa000d1fb633de5b69194e557978587280e47b02

[{'created': '2013-07-24 03:04:32.000000000', 'message': "Update README for swift off by default

Change 11277b1f3cfa850c074d3effbb43987b6e6e6391 disabled swift due to
port conflicts but the documentation still states that it is enabled
by default, which can be quite confusing.

While we're there, wrap affected lines to 80 chars.

Change-Id: I9d543f3368bdadadae482c163d814065009ab395
"}]
commit_message:
Update README for swift off by default

Change 11277b1f3cfa850c074d3effbb43987b6e6e6391 disabled swift due to
port conflicts but the documentation still states that it is enabled
by default, which can be quite confusing.

While we're there, wrap affected lines to 80 chars.

Change-Id: I9d543f3368bdadadae482c163d814065009ab395

commit_message:
Remove edit of controller-address

We were editing the heat template to replace the controller ip
with 192.0.2.2, this isn't needed as heat-localip changes the
metadata.

Change-Id: I92dcdd41cfdab6a94de7d8e92e8fa77927cee440

commit_message:
python3: handle module moves in log

Python 3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions to different modules.
Six provides a consistent interface to them through the fake six.moves module.

Change-Id: I040fe8e0e4640e7cdd805ab49891b94da6cc4595
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

[{'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-10 17:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:04:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I see one issue here...

If you extend the snapshot, and only write the original snapshot size amount of data, how do you know that you actually wiped all user data?"}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

I like this idea :)"}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:43:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Same reason as noted for patch set 2.

I don't think you are guaranteeing that user data is wiped here if you extend the snapshot but only wipe the original size."}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-10 18:49:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I have some concern as Eric."}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-10 19:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-07-10 19:04:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-10 19:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Eric @Zhiteng This article[1] is about the lvm-snapshot explanation .  Additional space is used to store snapshot metadata, the metadata will not be wiped when you zero the snapshot, but when you remove a snapshot(using lvremove), the space occupied by the snapshot metadata will be recycled.



[1]:   http://sgf-dma.blogspot.jp/2011/08/lvm-snapshots-and-corresponding-dm.html'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-07-10 19:39:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Here's my basic reasoning for the concern:

This fix may work -- but I'm not convinced it's guaranteed to always be safe.  Say you have a 5 GB snapshot, which was filled with 5 GB of user data.  You extend it to 6 GB, and then write 5 GB of zeros to it.

Do the 5 GB of zeros overwrite all of the initial user data that was present before the expansion?  Maybe only 4 GB of user data was overwritten, and the last GB of zeros went into the newly available snapshot space.

Adapting one idea I listed in the bug... we could force wipe the original size (as this does), but then at least attempt to zero the additional space as well, even if this second operation is expected to fail w/ ENOSPC.  (So, dd starting at seek=<original size>.)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 23:07:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-cinder-pep8/4798 : SUCCESS in 3m 20s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-cinder-docs/4692/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 5m 33s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-cinder-python26/4701 : FAILURE in 8m 02s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-cinder-python27/4724 : FAILURE in 3m 47s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-cinder-pylint/929 : FAILURE in 4m 14s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/30503 : FAILURE in 2h 30m 08s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/30207 : FAILURE in 2h 40m 25s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/1741 : FAILURE in 30m 17s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36512/5/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/16642 : FAILURE in 40m 04s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-07-11 01:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I'm fine with trying Eric's suggestion, however I"m concerned because we know there's a bug in certain distros with LVM where it doesn't respond with an error when you go past the valid blocks but instead the kernel hangs.

I'd REALLY like to avoid fighting that whole situation again if possible.'}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-17 09:27:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I agree with Eric and John?let the distros workaround kernel bugs... ??'}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-17 09:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I agree with Eric and John, let the distros workaround kernel bugs... :)'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-18 18:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Rongze, if we agreed not fixing this bug, can you abandon this review?  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-18 23:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Do not merge

'}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2013-07-24 13:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2013-07-10 17:45:07.000000000', 'message': 'Extend snapshot before LVM delete snapshot

We need zero the snapshot when delete LVM snapshot, but you can't actually
write full size of data to it since there is a small percentage of space
consumed by the metadata used to track the snapshot data, and this lives
inside the space allocated for the snap LV itself. This makes the device-mapper
generates an "Unable to allocate exception" error. So we could extend
additional space for the the snapshot to enable it can be zero successfully.
When the snapshot is removed, the additional space will be recycled.

Fixes bug #1199909

Change-Id: I433b1cfbae26691eba2e781fc6008dc525b1895c

commit_message:
Extend snapshot before LVM delete snapshot

We need zero the snapshot when delete LVM snapshot, but you can't actually
write full size of data to it since there is a small percentage of space
consumed by the metadata used to track the snapshot data, and this lives
inside the space allocated for the snap LV itself. This makes the device-mapper
generates an "Unable to allocate exception" error. So we could extend
additional space for the the snapshot to enable it can be zero successfully.
When the snapshot is removed, the additional space will be recycled.

Fixes bug #1191812

Change-Id: I433b1cfbae26691eba2e781fc6008dc525b1895c

subject: Remove replace/preserve logic from rate of change transformer
messages:
[{'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-22 12:24:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ok for the change, but I think we should settle on the fact that the replace option is a bad idea and that the code should be equivalent to True by default and not abuse the pipeline system.
That would simplify things."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 12:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37/38137/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/3589 : SUCCESS in 1m 28s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/37/38137/1/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/2393/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 6m 01s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37/38137/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/3514 : SUCCESS in 26m 25s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37/38137/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/3516 : SUCCESS in 9m 34s
'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:33:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Can I have the replace option totally removed so we're sure nobody's going to be confused or use the pipeline in a weird way?

I'm not a UX designer, but having only one way to do things seems better to me, ala Python. :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37/38137/2/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/3598 : SUCCESS in 1m 38s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/37/38137/2/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/2402/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 08s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37/38137/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/3523 : SUCCESS in 27m 48s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37/38137/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/3525 : SUCCESS in 7m 04s
'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-07-23 06:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-23 08:24:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(Tagging -1 until Eoghan responds or changes)"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-23 08:53:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Well sure, I could change it further to remove all the counter replacement logic.

But I think we're beginning to adopt an overly restrictive view of what a transformer needs to be, i.e. always implementing a 1:1 transformation from one sample to another.

For example, the existing accumulator transformer doesn't follow this model, instead it just gathers a sequence of samples before eventually emitting them unchanged.

Maybe if we'd used terminology such as 'filter' or 'interceptor' instead of 'transformer', it would seem a bit more natural to be doing non-1:1 transformations. But I'm not sure we should be overly constrained by our original choice of terminology.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-23 09:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Fair enough, but can I argue that in this case the mechanism should not be implemented in EACH transformers?'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-23 14:28:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-23 14:35:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 14:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Remove replace/preserve logic from rate of change transformer

The idea is to not re-emit cpu samples from the cpu_pipeline
by default, but instead simplify the pipeline.yaml by allowing
these original samples to be emitted by the general-purpose
pipeline as before, thus avoiding unintended double-publication.

Now only the derived samples would be emitted from the
scaling or rate of change transformers.

Change-Id: I12623181d289fc0ee3cdb6fcdbacf8e76e53d244

commit_message:
Fixing man page generation

The man page generation failed with sphinx v1.1.3
and docutils 0.10 and 0.11.

Adding docutils==0.9.1 to the test-requirements.txt
in order to solve this issue.

The docutils==0.9.1 is on the common OpenStack dependency list.

Several doc creation warning and error also fixed by this change.

Change-Id: Icb412876f5a989e6b8aa4886f2a246127a76521a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-23 08:53:09.000000000', 'message': "Fixed timestamp creation in MongoDB mapreduce

datetime.strftime('%s') doesn't respect tzinfo see:
http://bugs.python.org/issue12750

Naive time in UTC was converted as a local time
causing test failures in timezone with DST

Change-Id: I0fb5afae91a3b1240402d252b8e3a4fe0497fa05
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed timestamp creation in MongoDB mapreduce

datetime.strftime('%s') doesn't respect tzinfo see:
http://bugs.python.org/issue12750

Naive time in UTC was converted as a local time
causing test failures in timezone with DST

Change-Id: I0fb5afae91a3b1240402d252b8e3a4fe0497fa05

- http://logs.openstack.org/37452/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/32802 : FAILURE in 13m 43s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37452/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/4733 : FAILURE in 17m 12s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/37452/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-full/400 : FAILURE in 18m 21s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/37452/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/18951 : FAILURE in 18m 50s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/37452/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/17188 : SUCCESS in 11m 52s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-07-17 13:42:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't think you can blindly parse in the db api because values[key] will be a datetime object at times.

Looking at the bug report I think this is the wrong solution to the issue.  Nova is moving towards having slightly stronger typing of some data, and the time fields on an instance are a case where you should reasonably expect to have a datetime object unless you've explicitly converted it.  So rather than checking at the db layer, I think you should change make sure that those fields are datetimes when passed in.  Once everything is converted to objects that will probably be the case anyways."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-07-18 14:10:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

After discussing this in irc I've been convinced that the conversion in the sqlalchemy api is alright. commit_message:
Converting to datetime before updating the inst

While updating the instance, we expect some fields to be datetime,
on which we try to strip off the timezone using replace. The fields come
in as string, so converting them to datetime before we strip the
timezone

The fix is already present. Removing code duplication and reusing
existing function which converts string to datetime. Also adding tests
to check that timezone is removed from datetime

fixes LP 1201766

Change-Id: I969a0c2c03ff6a33169570b966e4c7842948b039

commit_message:
alarm: Per user setting to disable ssl verify

This allows the user to disable ssl verification via a query string
parameter in the action url.

example of action:
 https://unstrusted-ssl-host/?ceilometer-alarm-ssl-verify=0

Change-Id: I12294aa191ff4dfa5adaf2e24419bdfca70e8726
Blueprint: alarm-notifier

commit_message:
Handle user_metadata in alarm threshold evaluator

This change allow to use the reserved_metadata_namespace in the alarm
matching_metadata field. Example:

When alarm want to match 'metering.whatever.key' of a resouce_metadata,
the alarm threshold evaluator convert the key to
'metadata.user_metadata.whatever_key'.

Change-Id: Iaf296a3ef204ef64612794ec93d571813051e333

 [alarm]

commit_message:
alarm: Global setting to disable ssl verification

Allow to disable the ssl server certificate verification when
the action url is a https request in the global configuration file:

 [alarm]
 rest_notifier_ssl_verify = False

Change-Id: I9f7301f4804f0a58d0ab8a21fecdaf3643547191
Blueprint: alarm-notifier

commit_message:
Add sockjs-tornado requirement

This is a prerequisite for the blueprint realtime-communication in Horizon.

Change-Id: I1dddeec13a45949f01f94014a8451d98cb443b4e
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

'}, {'created': '2013-07-17 19:19:16.000000000', 'message': 'Create vmware section

VMware specific parameters will be moved to a new section. The

Change-Id: Ic9b425a3d9ea2b614643ba8d3db50b065947c806
'}, {'created': '2013-07-19 21:12:44.000000000', 'message': 'Create vmware section

Implements blueprint vmware-configuration-section

VMware specific parameters will be moved to a new section. The

commit_message:
Create vmware section

Implements blueprint vmware-configuration-section

VMware specific parameters will be moved to a new section. The
change is backward compatible and supports existing
configurations.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic9b425a3d9ea2b614643ba8d3db50b065947c806

commit_message:
Adding driver minimum features and volume stats to dev doc

This is a first pass in getting information out of the wiki and into the
dev docs, so changes can be reviewed properly as discussed at the Havana
summit.

Change-Id: I75e71b3e5df69e6b507ee64d330a9ec2455266c5

commit_message:
Code dedup in class ImageXMLSerializationTest

Externed common parts to setUp():
- fixture with test image data
- test image
- dictionary with test images
- test serializer
These parts were equal in the most part of the methods.

bp nova-tests-code-duplication

Change-Id: I8394c7ccbd0d71ffcf5f35c64a5c307dbf579364

commit_message:
Code dedup in test_libvirt_volume

- externed common assertions to methods
- externed common parts to setUp():
  - test disk info
  - test connector
  - test volume name, location, iqn, data, uuid
  - test user
  - test fake connection

bp nova-tests-code-duplication

Change-Id: I83bfd8b597121c9de091283845b841680e150e76

commit_message:
Add lesscpy>=0.9h

A prereq to drop horizon's less.js (and thus NodeJS) dependency for
compiling static assets.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37473/

commit_message:
Image Registry tags validation

New format 'valid_tag' was added to jsonschema and tags check to match 'valid_tag'
Added UT for this.

Fixes: bug #1200199

Change-Id: I64318b5c745074741a197a5ef1940bae900f6358

commit_message:
Implementation of the alarm RPCAlarmNotifier

This change implement the RPCAlarmNotifier to allow
the threshold-evaluator to communicate with the notifier.

Change-Id: I1dd3b5aabe5221a37903a4e87de64702aec94ad2

[{'created': '2013-07-16 16:39:40.000000000', 'message': 'Increase default OS_TEST_TIMEOUT value.

There are large amount of migration scripts in Nova.
This is why migrations tests (espetially on postgresql or mysql) failed
with `TimeoutException`.
We increased default timeout value from 60 to 120 seconds to fix it.

Fixes bug 1200289

Change-Id: I62f7d6cf7bc950fe06eb42fabd6f3db5bd8f3543
'}]
commit_message:
Increase default OS_TEST_TIMEOUT value.

There are large amount of migration scripts in Nova.
This is why migrations tests (espetially on postgresql or mysql) failed
with `TimeoutException`.
We increased default timeout value from 60 to 120 seconds to fix it.

Fixes bug 1200289

Change-Id: I62f7d6cf7bc950fe06eb42fabd6f3db5bd8f3543

commit_message:
Fix cache delete-all-queued-images for xattr

Deleting all queued images was broken when using caching with the xattr
driver, due to a missing get_cache_files function.

The missing function can be satisfied by substituting the call to
get_cache_files() with get_all_regular_files()

Fixes bug 1197402

Change-Id: Ia7f289e15615ef31865ebfd23902aa1ae1b05d66

commit_message:
Don't register options with cfg.CONF at module import

oslo.messaging will only register options with a ConfigOpts object
supplied by the caller.

Change-Id: I18115e9dd5241b1bdfae14671a62328c47125400

commit_message:
trailing slash in url causes 404 error

when accessing samples for a specific meter, appending a trailing
slash will add an empty target path to 'remainder', in turn
triggering 404 error. in case last target path in remainder, we
will drop that empty instance.

Change-Id: I583a0fe9755c9bec8bcb08b13a3f1d03a3acf336
Fixes:Bug#1202739

commit_message:
Added functions to sync db in both alembic and migrate

This functionality allows to port existing migrations one by one without
breaking db structure. It uses migration description to match migrate
files to alembic example:
167b3be5fd4a_add_meter_table.py <-> 001_add_meter_table.py

Migrations are supposed to be ported starting from the oldest ones.

Related to blueprint convert-to-alembic

Change-Id: I4f3c104a05f9d79ec25c8f2b0f6075039b5d2b26

commit_message:
Adding hardware-agent

This adds basic monitoring for physical devices. The structure is similar to the compute-agent.
The agent is designed for easy extending with inspectors.
The hardware-agent is configurable over the hardware-agent.conf as well as over the ceilometer.conf

Implements: blueprint monitoring-physical-devices

Change-Id: I0fc28bc148411b390bb8b3ffcb15b7951ee20e06

(2 inline comments)

The basic test looks good. The -1 is for the ocmment.

The test does not actually verify that the VM is locked, it only checks what is reported by the API. 
I think we should have something to verify response code and status in the API tests for lock/unlock, and in the scenario include a more E2E tests. commit_message:
update requires to prevent version cap

OpenStack clients. None of these should have an upper bound
as that has implications for testing in the gate. An exception
is currently being made for neutron client because of the need
for an incompatible change in their next release.
https://github.com/openstack/requirements

fixes bug #1200214
Change-Id: I0c3c7ca17db5eb5098cab5947934fd24350ad754

commit_message:
Defer to pip for requirements processing

pip knows what it's doing, we should stop doing its job for it.
Additionally, we should not inject version numbers into the
install_requires itself, as upstream pip tells us this is bad form.
install_requires should list the requirement itself, requirements.txt
should indicate the version that should be installed.

Change-Id: I3b6708444ec8b3d37271c0c8df91fee2cd593088

commit_message:
Support API fping in shell.

"It may be interesting for a cloud user or administrator to perform a
simple instance monitoring. A ping could be an acceptable solution: it
is fast and quite reliable. A limit for ping is 1 time a minute by
default."

This patch make novaclient support the API:
GET /v2/{tenant}/os-fping?all_tenants=1&include=1,2&exclude=3,4
GET /v2/{tenant}/os-fping/{instance-id}
also add some tests for it.

DocImpact

implemented bp: support-fping-api

Change-Id: I558d95d2f8556da8e9a6a65222dc555a19c57480

commit_message:
Creates parent directory when injecting a file.

Checks that the parent directory exists for injected files. If the
parent directory does not exist, it is created using make_path.

Change-Id: I43eb073fb0280a5457e9ac3433bce136eaa2402a
Fixes: bug 1157923

commit_message:
python3: Fix tracebacks while running testsuite.

According to PEP 3115, the syntax for changing
metaclasses has been altered. So use six to deal
with this incompatibility betwen python2 and python3.

Change-Id: Ie363e3a31574833043e36dd15beb9fbbef138edf
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 16:43:14.000000000', 'message': "python3: Fix tracebacks while running  tests

While running the testsuite under python3, you will
get the following traceback:

TypeError: 'map' object is not subscriptable

which is due to a change in python3. In python3
map returns an iterable object of type map,
and not a subscriptible (i.e. you can write map[i]) list.

Change-Id: I648305cc23ee84f412aab57f8e3c3dfc301f1d24
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix tracebacks while running  tests

While running the testsuite under python3, you will
get the following traceback:

TypeError: 'map' object is not subscriptable

which is due to a change in python3. In python3
map returns an iterable object of type map,
and not a subscriptible (i.e. you can write map[i]) list.

Change-Id: I648305cc23ee84f412aab57f8e3c3dfc301f1d24
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

Add trunk oslo.config and oslo.messaging

The oslo libraries release on the OpenStack cadence, so we should
be running their trunk with project's trunk like everything else.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/37294

commit_message:
Fix missing foreign keys.

There are a lot of ForeignKey that had been skipped in database but
declared in models.
This migration adds them.

bp: ceilometer-db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I3e34c3e87b3d3df63971fe9994afc63fe27594f8

commit_message:
Provide the length of the flows.

Its useful to be able to check if a flow contains
anything by just inspecting the len() of the flow.
This can be used to avoid running a flow in the
first place if nothing is in said flow.

Change-Id: Ibfea7f10fc67d5dd3ddfa6f6fe6c08805562998a

commit_message:
Parents should be frozen after creation.

Use a tuple to ensure that the parents list
can not be mutated after flow creation.

Change-Id: Ic2a0ed73a2a7211184deb92d57720ff417429dca

commit_message:
Set the image_ref when booting from a volume.

When booting a VM from a volume, the image information should be retrieved
from the system_metadata instead of image_ref. Furthermore, if the original
image is deleted, image_meta should be retrieved from volume_image_metadata
in volume.

Fixed Bug 1191069.

Change-Id: I8bf10f505a13c82a5faf6e1dbcf7b920d64669d8

commit_message:
Allow exceptions to propagate through stevedore map

Allow exceptions to propagate up through the stevedore map
function used by the V3 API servers core extension. This allows
for functionality such as extension specific parsing of client
supplied data formerly required to be handled by the core API to
be handled by the extension itself instead.

This functionality requires stevedore 0.10 or later

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ib848147225707f1c7eda27b1ba796022161ba20f

'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-07-02 12:11:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (3 inline comments)

A few suggestions on how to simplify the code and improve readability inline.

Though, I don't really like the way you insert entries and handle duplicates:  session.rollback() followed by session.begin() in except IntegrityError block is a very subtle way of starting new transactions - in this case you should know, that rollback() in outer function becomes useless, as you have already started a new transaction (or even a plenty of them)...

So, these insertions must either be:
  - done in separate transactions (easy, but makes a 'global' ROLLBACK harder)
  - or done inside an original transaction, but you should make a SELECT query first to find out, which entries are already present in DB (this can be put inside a while + try/except block to ensure we try again in case if a concurrent transaction was committed between SELECT query and COMMIT in this transaction)."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-07-03 00:31:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There were 12 other changes competing for migration number 190, and unfortunately this change wasn't the winner. You'll need to rebase this change with a new migration number before it can be approved."}, {'account_id': 7711, 'date': '2013-07-03 07:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to InstanceTypeExtraSpecs.

Added unique constraint
'uniq_instance_type_extra_specs0instance_type_id0key0deleted'
('instance_type_id', 'key', 'deleted')
to InstanceTypeExtraSpecs model and migrate
scripts.

Exception from UC violation used in method
flavor_extra_specs_update_or_create()
for race condition check.
Get-update-create procedure will be restarted
in case race condition.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ie91c6fc19ca01526b5f48f85cbb63a6842f9c890

commit_message:
Only use a token for openstack client operations.

This uses the same techniques as horizon for getting client
instances with an existing token.

This change also fetches a new auth_token if the context has none,
as will happen when the context is created from saved user_creds
rather than a real request.

While it appears that some code paths will result in an extra call to the
keystone client, the actual calls to keystone will be less. This is
because each client was making its own calls to keystone when
authenticating with a username and password.

Implements blueprint auth-token-only

Change-Id: If6a63a5079464758f42d5d5e83dfffb196f4a7f6

[{'created': '2013-07-17 04:22:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix can't convert String into Integer error

When a role is present on the current node either the node attributes or a subset are returned depending if section is passed.  Conversely if role is not present on the current node search_for is called which always returns an array.  This is inconsistant.  Since it appears the roles should contain the attributes it doesn't matter which one is return, so the first should suffice.

commit_message:
Revert "Correct faulty Chef search query"

This reverts commit 8311869e5b99fecefd567ce3f1ad1cbdf8d5c5c6.

When a role is present on the current node either the node attributes or a
subset are returned depending if section is passed.  Conversely if role is
not present on the current node search_for is called which always returns an
array.  This is inconsistant.  Since it appears the roles should contain the
attributes it doesn't matter which one is return, so the first should suffice.
Update spec tests stub to properly return an array from search_for

Change-Id: I180fe8c6a4d0e31e877b91f8cbad54018ef81049

commit_message:
make heat-api return a parsable error

add a wsgi middleware (faultwrap) that catches exceptions
and transform those exceptions into a parsable format
according to 'Content-Type' of the request.

Fixes bug 1158598
Implements blueprint exception-formatting

Change-Id: Iacdb8cc119b250ff1e39c99b7a7f66fd4c35e7d9

'assert' raise AssertionError only when run python without '-O' flag. It
is bad to except Assertionerror to do some bussiness logic.

Change-Id: I426aa830d35d97af43a80b161697c5618fa85931

commit_message:
remove improper assert syntax

'assert' raise AssertionError only when run python without '-O' flag. It
is bad to except Assertionerror to do some bussiness logic.

Change-Id: I426aa830d35d97af43a80b161697c5618fa85931

commit_message:
Add notes for /srv/node in swift-object-info

'devices' is set in object-server.conf on each node, not in ring data,
and the things printed here is just for watching not for running, so
just leave a note here. (this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23951/
is used for running, so just a note is not enough)

mark this commit as bug fixing is because this script is the last place
using /srv/node but not from conf as Chmouel said.

fixes import change on read_metadata
fixes bug #885006
Change-Id: I727ec2d01c093af61fd3895e5701d87ef67cd9ff

commit_message:
Set state to deleted when deleting

In some cases (e.g. when all servers are deleted), a machine may be
deleted even if the current db state is not DELETE (or ERROR).
In all cases, if the db state is not DELETE when a machine is
deleted, set it to DELETE, so that it will be removed from the
db during the next pass.

Change-Id: Icd6a6eb6e6896f88e06ff0c8e9d53b6b34092ad8

I guess there's still the one mount check in REPLICATE(), but there's no diskfile being instantiated there, so not much can be done there."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 22:30:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work
