"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-17 22:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh look, a timing-dependent unit test failed.

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-17 22:42:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think it's natural for the DiskFile interface to define an exceptional condition that may be thrown to generically indicate some classification of storage above this single file is unavailable.  Since devices are things in the ring I think that concept will apply in some fashion to most implementors of DiskFile, so I suggest the exception be named DeviceUnavailableError.  The DeviceUnavailableError would of course indicate all of the partitions on that device are not available and the object server it's daemons and the proxy can work around it as needed.

I think a DeviceUnavailableError would include an attribute .device that maps back to the thing in the ring that we're calling unavailable.  If you have .device as an attribute you can move the exception handling out of the request methods and catch it during dispatch so we get DRY'd out too.

I think it just happens to be the case that we do the mount_check manually now in the _diskfile helper.  This exception eventually needs to only be raised from within the DiskFile.  As such, the other mount_check call site should at least include the DeviceUnavailableError token as comment if nothing else so future grep's can know that we need to fix that too."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-18 18:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-18 19:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Move the mount checking into DiskFile constructor

Move the mount checking into the DiskFile object constructor. The
REPLICATE method does not use the DiskFile object currently, so that
method still has to perform its own mount check.

We also refactored the DiskFile exceptions a bit for a hierarchy.

Change-Id: Idcbb5a912d8c7d956dac96ff523c1cf1163c98a6
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Sync 10 DB models and migrations.

This patch syncs models with migrations for:
- BlockDeviceMapping
- IscsiTarget
- FixedIp
- FloatingIp
- KeyPair
- Migration
- Network
- ProviderFirewallRule
- Reservation
- S3Image

Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I8e16375fe48744513167272e956cdbfdbfd8af23

commit_message:
Removed restart tests from blackbox group

Removing the restart tests from the integration blackbox group. This
test has been causing intermittent failures due to an indeterministic
interaction with upstart, so pulling it out of the group until we figure
out a long term fix.

Fixes bug: bug/1204235

Change-Id: I6d95ba9c0946fb31a219c0d00438f42b636599c1

commit_message:
fix r'home/$' in url partten

r'home/$' will match a container-name like 'test-name' or a path like
'somepath/a-key-name-home'. It should be r'^home/$'

fixes bug #1202079

Change-Id: I94f704990efc4ea6348c5707c774e1141ef1f3c2

commit_message:
Add isolated tenants for admin compute tests

This adds support for isolated credentials on admin tests. Previously
the admin tests just ran with the admin username, password, and
tenant from the config file. This changes that behavior by getting
isolated credentials for the admin base test class and then adding
the create user to the admin role.

This may fix a race condition uncovered by the testr runs.

Possibly part of: bp speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: I74339662ab769e005cb79b2d741a04640c5546ce

subject: Fix DB access when refreshing the network cache.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 7450, 'name': 'Yassine Lamgarchal', 'email': 'yassine.lamgarchal@redhat.com', 'username': 'yassine.lamgarchal'}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2013-07-18 15:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I tried to add a regression test for this patch:

diff --git a/nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py b/nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py
index 6539ba1..98bb1aa 100644
--- a/nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py
+++ b/nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py
@@ -7717,6 +7717,36 @@ class ComputeAPITestCase(BaseTestCase):
         self.compute.detach_interface(self.context, {}, port_id)
         self.assertEqual(self.compute.driver._interfaces, {}) 
 
+    def test_detach_interface_db_access(self):
+        """ 
+        Tests that the database can be accessed to update the instance cache
+        when calling detach_interface().
+        TODO: same test for attach_interface().
+        """ 
+        nwinfo, port_id = self.test_attach_interface()
+        self.stubs.Set(self.compute.network_api, 'get_instance_nw_info',
+                       lambda *a, **k: nwinfo)
+
+        refresh_cache = network_api.refresh_cache
+
+        @refresh_cache
+        def fake_deallocate_port_for_instance(self, context, instance, port_id,
+                                              conductor_api=None):
+            pass
+
+        # XXX When doing this, "fake" is used as a function, not as a method.
+        self.stubs.Set(self.compute.network_api,
+                       'deallocate_port_for_instance',
+                       fake_deallocate_port_for_instance)
+        fail = False
+        try:
+            self.compute.detach_interface(self.context, {}, port_id)
+        except exception.DBNotAllowed:
+            fail = True
+
+        self.assertFalse(fail)
+        self.assertEqual(self.compute.driver._interfaces, {}) 
+
     def test_attach_volume(self):
         # Ensure instance can be soft rebooted.
 

The problem is, it fails with:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py", line 7740, in test_detach_interface_db_access
    self.compute.detach_interface(self.context, {}, port_id)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 3571, in detach_interface
    port_id, conductor_api=self.conductor_api)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/network/api.py", line 48, in wrapper
    res = f(self, context, *args, **kwargs)
TypeError: fake_deallocate_port_for_instance() takes at least 4 arguments (4 given)

After debugging this, I'm pretty sure that "self" is not implicitely passed to
fake_deallocate_port_for_instance() as it could be expected, and that it is
called as a function rather than as a method.

All I really need is to trigger the "refresh_cache" decorator, in order to
access the database. Without the patch, a DBNotAllowed exception should be
thrown; with the patch, this should work.

Any idea ?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-18 16:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-18 15:18:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix DB access when refreshing the network cache.

When calling ComputeManager.attach_interface(), the following happens:

1) self.network_api.allocate_port_for_instance() is called from within
   ComputeManager.attach_interface();
2) refresh_cache() is called, since it decorates allocate_port_for_instance();
3) refresh_cache calls update_instance_cache_with_nw_info(), with
   "conductor_api=None" since 'conductor_api' cannot be found in the kwargs;
4) update_instance_cache_with_nw_info() calls
   api.db.instance_info_cache_update();
5) Since the call to the database should be made through the conductor, a
   DBNotAllowed exception is raised, which prevents the cache from being updated.

This patch fixes the call to allocate_port_for_instance (step 1) so that
'conductor_api' can be found in the kwargs (step 3).

When using ComputeManager.detach_interface, the exact same problem arises (with
deallocate_port_for_instance instead of allocate_port_for_instance).

This is a first step towards fixing bug #1197192.

Change-Id: I647795907b22790759d3be74afcaf70b712cb338
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DB access when refreshing the network cache.

When calling ComputeManager.attach_interface(), the following happens:

1) self.network_api.allocate_port_for_instance() is called from within
   ComputeManager.attach_interface();
2) refresh_cache() is called, since it decorates allocate_port_for_instance();
3) refresh_cache calls update_instance_cache_with_nw_info(), with
   "conductor_api=None" since 'conductor_api' cannot be found in the kwargs;
4) update_instance_cache_with_nw_info() calls
   api.db.instance_info_cache_update();
5) Since the call to the database should be made through the conductor, a
   DBNotAllowed exception is raised, which prevents the cache from being updated.

This patch fixes the call to allocate_port_for_instance (step 1) so that
'conductor_api' can be found in the kwargs (step 3).

When using ComputeManager.detach_interface, the exact same problem arises (with
deallocate_port_for_instance instead of allocate_port_for_instance).

This is a first step towards fixing bug #1197192.

Change-Id: I647795907b22790759d3be74afcaf70b712cb338

subject: Fix bug 1196187: In tables, add whitespace to long strings that overrun column width.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/37906/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-cli-guide/717 : SUCCESS in 3m 25s
- http://logs.openstack.org/37906/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/1588 : SUCCESS in 8s
'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Aren't test tables autogenerated from code? If not, looks good."}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-07-19 14:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-07-20 15:18:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Denis,

Thanks for picking up this bug - it annoyed me too, which is why I lodged it.

Unfortunately, the note by Diane is correct - these tables are automatically generated and changes like this will be overwritten next time the script is run.

The code that produces them can be found in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35726/ 

we could consider adding a patch to that that detects when a long string is a default value and inserts some linebreaks and spacing


However, personally, I find this solution suboptimal due to breaking the ability to copy & paste the values ... which can lead to confusion (especially as these are supposed to be the 'definitive references'). Ideally, we'd fix this in the build tools - but as you note, this could be hard!"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-07-23 15:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Denis, you can mark this one "Abandoned" knowing what we know about autogenerated tables. Tom is the one who wrote the code for autogenerating the tables.'}, {'account_id': 8043, 'date': '2013-07-23 21:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

These docs are generated from code, so XML edits will not persist. Ann confirms that this patch set should be abandoned. The wrapping problem needs to be fixed in code generation by adding whitespace (for example, adding spaces before commas in argument lists). 

To avoid future miscues like this, it might also help to generate an SGML comment at the top of the XML file, advising writers not to edit it.'}]

commit_message:
make v2_auth and plugin_auth explictly return their results

In cases where the respective authentication methods return
non-NoneTypes, (e.g., HTTP 305 redirects) they would get dropped
on the floor previously.

This patch set splits the test_auth_redirect unit test into two
nearly-identical unit tests to exercise the different code paths.
Without the patch, the test_v2_auth_redirect unit test fails with
an HTTP 401 error

Change-Id: I2018bc5b73ce86d6d5383958375d5dbbde2e763c
Fixes: Bug 1197191

according to comment, I are trying to divide this patch into sub-patches.'}, {'account_id': 1387, 'date': '2013-07-23 21:34:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I am attempting to use this patch, and I have noticed some issues.

First off the tree that this is based on seems to have some issues (some commits seem not to be in openstack/master).  Can it be rebased on openstack/master?

There is some sort of race which sometimes results in 'sysctl -w net.ipv4.ip_forward=1' not being ran inside the namespace. When this happens, I see two 'ip netns add' commands ran within the same second.  I believe both the l3 and dhcp agents are trying to create the namespace at the same time.  ensure_namespace does not seem multi-process safe.

When creating a multihost network, on the external network an unused IP/port is allocated, labeled 'network:router_gateway'. The gateways that are actually used are called 'network:router_gateway:multihost.  The unused one should probably be removed, as it is unnecessary and uses up an IP.  Also, the default SNAT rule on each host uses the IP from 'network:router_gateway', which is not assigned, resulting in instances without floating IPs the inability to have network access.  The default SNAT rule should use the external ip that is assigned to that host.

There should be a way to make multihost default to True for new networks.

There are inconsistencies in the code between 'multihost' and 'multi_host'. Can one be picked and the others changed to be consistent?

Inside the multihost namespace, two default routes are created (one for the internal network gateway and one for the external network gateway).  There should not be a route to the internal network gateway when there is one to the external one.

It should be possible to set up a single multihost external network, with dhcp and metadata access.  However this does not work correctly since in this case ip_forward does not get enabled inside the namespace, and the metadata proxy does not get started inside the namespace."}]

commit_message:
multi-host feature

blueprint quantum-multihost

DHCP port's IP will be the gateway ip of subnet of multihost network.

to experiment, download patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29767/

Change-Id: Ic13010dc5941f71a7d59755bee2205d26fb6f7ae

The following calls are no longer called by nova.compute.api and should
be removed along with their associated tests:

db.api.instance_metadata_get_all
db.api.sqlalchemy.instance_metadata_get_all
db.api.sqlalchemy._instance_metadata_get_all_query

Change-Id: Id02786127ee35124e58425c699e5d3e84f42f527
'}]
commit_message:
Remove instance_metadata_get_all* from db api

The following calls are no longer called by nova.compute.api and should
be removed along with their associated tests:

db.api.instance_metadata_get_all
db.api.sqlalchemy.instance_metadata_get_all
db.api.sqlalchemy._instance_metadata_get_all_query

Change-Id: Id02786127ee35124e58425c699e5d3e84f42f527

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 15:59:49.000000000', 'message': 'Remove extra lstat() calls from check_mount

The os.path.exists call performs an lstat, but os.path.ismount already
performs the same check. However, it performs a separate lstat() call
to check for a symlink, which we remove as well, cutting the number
performed in half.

Sample program to be straced for comparison:

from swift.common.constraints import check_mount
import os
os.write(1, "Starting\n")
if check_mount("/", "tmp"):
    os.write(1, "Mounted\n")

Here is the output of a check on a mounted file system (common case)
using the new method:

---- strace new ----
write(1, "Starting\n", 9) = 9
lstat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp/..", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0555, st_size=4096, ...}) = 0
write(1, "Mounted\n", 8) = 8

---- strace old ----
write(1, "Starting\n", 9) = 9
stat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp/..", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0555, st_size=4096, ...}) = 0
write(1, "Mounted\n", 8) = 8

Change-Id: I027c862a2b7d9ff99d7f61bd43ccc0825dba525c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-07-19 16:53:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove extra lstat() calls from check_mount

lstat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp/..", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0555, st_size=4096, ...}) = 0
write(1, "Mounted\n", 8) = 8

Change-Id: I027c862a2b7d9ff99d7f61bd43ccc0825dba525c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extra lstat() calls from check_mount

The os.path.exists call performs an lstat, but os.path.ismount already
performs the same check. However, it performs a separate lstat() call
to check for a symlink, which we remove as well, cutting the number
performed in half.

Sample program to be straced for comparison:

from swift.common.constraints import check_mount
import os
os.write(1, "Starting\n")
if check_mount("/", "tmp"):
    os.write(1, "Mounted\n")

Here is the output of a check on a mounted file system (common case)
using the new method:

---- strace new ----
write(1, "Starting\n", 9) = 9
lstat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp/..", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0555, st_size=4096, ...}) = 0
write(1, "Mounted\n", 8) = 8

---- strace old ----
write(1, "Starting\n", 9) = 9
stat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|S_ISVTX|0777, st_size=8460, ...}) = 0
lstat("/tmp/..", {st_mode=S_IFDIR|0555, st_size=4096, ...}) = 0
write(1, "Mounted\n", 8) = 8

Change-Id: I027c862a2b7d9ff99d7f61bd43ccc0825dba525c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Sync toci with current devtest

Toci hasn't worked in nearly two weeks, ever since some stuff was refactored,
after this commit toci
1. is now back in sync with devtest in incubator.
2. brings up an overcloud by default (set TOCI_DO_OVERCLOUD=0 to stop a
   undercloud).
3. clones all git repositories to /opt/toci (these arn't refreshed
   between toci runs unless removed).
4. changes some env variables so that the default behaviour is now
   closer to a what a user setting up a dev env would want.
5. removes unused patches and adds some new ones.
6. Adds a bit more documentation.

Change-Id: I19a34b1a400ec646f37310f265d1345bb6882dc3

[{'created': '2013-07-23 18:34:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix call to install-dependencies.

If the current user running install-dependencies is not in the
libvirtd group, the user is added and install-dependencies is
reran.  This patch calls install-dependencies with $0 instead
of $PWD/$0.  There is no gaurantee that that the current working
directory is the scripts directory, so using $PWD/$0 could result
in an error.

Change-Id: I67e7eeaba365ded8fcaa1ba6b48d6759e90d5222
'}]
commit_message:
Fix call to install-dependencies.

If the current user running install-dependencies is not in the
libvirtd group, the user is added and install-dependencies is
reran.  This patch calls install-dependencies with $0 instead
of $PWD/$0.  There is no gaurantee that that the current working
directory is the scripts directory, so using $PWD/$0 could result
in an error.

Change-Id: I67e7eeaba365ded8fcaa1ba6b48d6759e90d5222

commit_message:
Migrating ec2 credentials to credential.

Merging ec2 credentials into the credentials
table to simplify management of ec2
credentials.

blueprint migrate-ec2-credentials

Change-Id: I9c92408c30a18176f03f8f3f0b2045c61598332a

What am I missing?"}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-07-23 19:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I submitted this for review when describe_tags _was_ using this db api call :)  [One of my accepted patches changed that].

I also gathered from other reviewers that removing functions from the db API is a Bad Idea, even if nova.compute.api no longer calls them.  So should we fix db.api.instance_metadata_get_all to have the right behavior in this case?'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-23 19:01:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I would just remove it if it's not used.  There's no reason to keep dead code.  We can always dig it back from git history if needed."}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-07-23 20:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

These methods are now deprecated.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 15:14:17.000000000', 'message': 'Change filters on getting instance metadata to OR instead of AND

From the EC2 API on DescribeTags:

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeTags.html

You can specify multiple filters (for example, specify a specific
resource type and tag values that contain the string database). The
response includes information for a tag only if it matches all the
filters that you specified. If there's no match, no special message is
returned, the response is simply empty.

The phrase "only if it matches all the filters" means we should AND
search filters together.

Fixes bug #1190845

Change-Id: Icc0a7df1f93da803bbb2d7c9d18a4ce42bbe6720
'}, {'created': '2013-07-05 19:15:32.000000000', 'message': 'Change filters on getting instance metadata to AND instead of OR

commit_message:
Change filters on getting instance metadata to AND instead of OR

From the EC2 API on DescribeTags:

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeTags.html

You can specify multiple filters (for example, specify a specific
resource type and tag values that contain the string database). The
response includes information for a tag only if it matches all the
filters that you specified. If there's no match, no special message is
returned, the response is simply empty.

The phrase "only if it matches all the filters" means we should AND
search filters together.

Fixes bug #1190845

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icc0a7df1f93da803bbb2d7c9d18a4ce42bbe6720
